story:
Short Summary


Hello folks,

I'm currently working on a project revolving around 300 - 72 Princess, together with FRAME Arts Warehouse.  We have currently turned self-sufficient and profitable, and are looking to raise funds to further our goal of artist development in the city of Winnipeg.  All funds can be used to invest in all kinds of art projects.  Albums, shows, touring, music videos, training, development etc.  Currently, all our previous funds were put into assets to get up and running, and now we are, so any funds we raise can be invested into all kinds of musical and video projects.


What We Need & What You Get


Basically each project should start at $5000, so there's no lack of overhead funds.  Each project involves a unique experience, either an album release show, a festival, a training gathering, whatever we get, we can create as many projects as our folks can come up with.  We've put on festivals and shows for a long time without even making money, so we have an extensive reach into the Winnipeg music scene.  
If we don't reach our goal, we can either return the funds, or put them in part to a smaller project we would announce ahead of time

The Impact


The impact is to the benefit of the music scene as a whole.  This city has a reputation for producing talented artists of all kinds, rock, folk, pop, EDM, actors. etc.  It's been a struggle just to get recognized for your talent though, unless you know the right people.  Our goal is to break that cycle, and help people who take care of themselves achieve their goals.  
We've currently worked and plan to in the next few months work with an extensive amount of Manitoban artists, such as
-Micah Erenberg -  I Wanna Sleep Forever
-Scott Petrowski -Poetic Lung
-Richard Inman (The Madtrappers) -            Hippie Friends - Richard Inman ft. The Honey Sliders      
-Dirty Catfish Brass Band - Brass Riot
-Flat City Folk - Early Morning Blues
-Aisha Belle & Brady Enslen - Little Tree
-Zander Howard-Scott - Princess Collection
-Little House - 
-Kieran West & His Buffalo Band - Matlock Festival 2013
-Sebastian Owl - 
-Somebody Language - 
-Real Love Winnipeg - 
-Ingrid Gatin & Ryan Dutchak
-Ben Figler
-Foppish Dandies
-Boy Prince

-The Thiefs
-Devon Nickerson
-Explorers Club
-Soulhounds
links to be added later
The Good Time Boys music library

story:
Summary

I / YOU / HE / SHE / IT / WE / THEY is a collaboration of works by visual artist Blanda, photographer Silke Labson and musician Kilo Kish. As young motivated females in an industry highly led by the opposite sex, they unite to elevate their artistic expressions through a harmonious conglomerate of work. The result is a multifaceted collection of both professional and personal works built in homage to their social interactions with a very intimate glimpse into each of their lives.

We envision a night were creativity, fun and friendship reigns supreme. We want to build a space that not only embodies our work but is also cohesive with who we are.

We want the space to be filled with our network of industry colleagues, friends and family that have seen our development over the years and that will come to support and celebrate our hard work with us.

We want our guest to feel like they have been part of our journey – as they have – and so we are looking to create an experiential rates art, music and of course, social media to allows us to capture and share these moments forever. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need funding to pay for everything from the opening night, cleaning, painting, etc. which will sum up to $6k +.
The money will go towards
  • Security
  • PA / DJ
  • Staff / Bar Staff
  • Art hangers
  • Cleaners (After opening and after closing)
  • Repainting and restoring the gallery space after closing night
  • Alcohol license
  • Insurance for space
  • Bar supplies
  • Photographer/Videographer
  • Bathroom supplies
  • Furniture for opening
  • Materials to built out space
With this, you will get an amazing opening night event and will be able to view our work alongside us to get an intimate look into our personal creative lives!

Risks & Challenges

We were given this opportunity to create an amazing all female group show.  This was our chance to share our personal work and we couldn't pass this up.  All of us are funding this 100% by ourselves and investing all of our own income possible to put this on. Including using our rent money! :/ All of this is because we believe that we can do this and want to show others that you can have a big idea and make it happen. Even in a super short period of time!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Send the campaign to your friends!
  • Share on social media
  • Come to the event :)

story:
Hi everyone my name is Helen and my son Joshua was born with ABS ( amniotic band syndrome) it is a condition where bands form in the womb and get caught around the baby and it leads to restrictions in growth causing deformed fingers, toes and sometimes amputation of fingers, toes, arms, legs. We like so many other parents didn't know our baby was affected until he was born. The cause is unknown. Both Joshua's hands were affected he is missing fingers and most of them are small Joshua is now 15 and he still amazes me everyday with all his accomplishments. Every time we thought he would not be able to do something due to his hand deformities he proved us wrong, he struggled many times but always found a way to do what he needed to do. Like every parent with a child affected with ABS you learn that these kids are amazing and never let anything stop them. Joshua has had a hard time growing up being different, looking different even though we never let him feel different at home and with family to us he was our little boy and still is but kids can be cruel. He would come home many times from school in tears asking why his hands were different and why the kids wouldn't just leave him alone and stop picking on him. They would push him around and call him names and physically and emotionally hurt him. He is very self concious of his hands and feet and it is heart breaking watching him silently suffering. This is what has brought me here, I need help getting a 3d printer for Joshua. My partner has with Joshua designed a robotic hand that will help him do the things he can't, and has troubles with. My partner came up with the idea after seeing these hands on the internet and Joshuas face lit up at the idea of having something made like this. Unfortunatly they are very expensive to make into the thousands of dollars. They both built a prototype using some mouldable plastic but now they need to finish and the only way to make all the movable parts is by 3d printing. Joshua loves computers and we are doing our best to push him into that direction for his future career, having a printer that he can make new hands for himself is the first step. Any help would greatly be appreciated to make Joshua's life easier. THANKYOU for taking the time to read and thankyou for any donations you might make.

Sincerely Helen obrien.

story:
Public Allies New York is 15!

Public Allies New York is celebrating 15 years of supporting and cultivating non profit leaders in New York:

  • This is a big year as our parent organization, Americorps, turns 20
  • We have graduated over 400 non profit leaders who have made great strides in supporting communities across all 5 borough, across the United States and Internationally
  • Our Allies carry the Public Allies 5 Core Values with them in their organizing

Imagine a world with 400 more non-profit sector leaders

This campaign is in celebration of what we have accomplished and looking forward to where we want to go

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please share the #PANY15for15 campaign on your social media channels
  • Volunteer with us!? We have a number of great activities coming up
  • Get your friends, family and coworkers to donate


Don't Forget

Everyone Leads!

story:
Short Summary

This Is my life, I spend every waking minute available on building my career as a painter. When I come home from my day job at 330pm-4pm depending on traffic I eat something take a quick nap (20-30 minutes as suggested by NASA) and get to work from 5pm-12am. Sleep and wake up at 530am to get to work by 7. rinse and repeat. I have slept on a couch for the past 6 years so I can use my room as my studio. Everything I do is timed and recorded in my work journal. I have a sense of humor but do not joke around with my career. I am saving every nickel and penny I can for my trip to Europe. I want to attend schooling at Studio Escalier and Angel Academy of Art, in the meantime I keep by my own curriculum of life drawing, master studies and anatomy memorization. There Is also a local artist by the name of Matt Dickson who holds classes on a weekly basis, Id like to continue to attend his classes for the next year and learn as much as I can before I leave. I have to save money though for my studies abroad. 

What We Need & What You Get

The cost of the classes are 145.00 a month. for 12 months that is 1740.00 I would like to attend as many classes as I can to shorten my learning curve before I leave. The remaining fund of 160.00 would be to cover cost of drawing supplies. 

The Impact

The cost of studying abroad Is in the 7-8 thousand dollar range, that means I have to save every penny I can from my day job to ensure I can study abroad. I literally plan on eating bread and drinking water when Im at either school. I just need enough to get there and study.  So having these classes covered will save me 1900.00 thats enough for a plane ticket to Europe and rent for 1 month abroad. 

Risks & Challenges

Im past my point of no return, Ive been at this for 6 years and faced emotional, physical, and financial obstacles.  This is not a want but a need, I need to do this because when I miss a  day of painting or drawing I get cranky and have to work twice as hard the next day to make up for it. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • please share with your friends and family and small amount counts. thanks for your time.

story:
ABOUT ME

My name is Ewa Seweryn and I was born in 1960 

I am visual artist with many years professional experience in art painting, using all available types of paints and materials. Accurate, conscientious and hard-working. Work done to the highest standard.

I was learning in State High School of of Fine Arts. - Kielce, Poland where I finished it with several awards for the best disciple in past 5 years of school history.I was promoted to further learning in Saint Petersburg ( in that days Leningrad ) but in that communist times someone went to head teacher with money in envelope and that was the end of my dreams. For many years later I was painting but I was not enable to get so many customers to live from art . 

Below I present to you my artistic awards and achievements :

I place - the Outdoor Sculpture Competition,

organized by the Department of Culture and Arts in – Tomaszow, Poland

I place - competition for the Medal, to them. H. Czarnecki 

(35 years of PLSP in Kielce)

Main Prize and Award of F.ŁT. "Iskra" (Kielce) - III Review of non-professional art - Oct. '88

I place - Poster Contest - "Kosmos'80"

Second place - National Poster Contest - "Moskwa'80"

Participation in the project. and implementation - Soldiers Monument to Polish (Tomaszów Mazowiecki)

My painting exhibitions :

Gallery - Company Culture F.Ł.T. "Iskra" in Kielce, Poland :

- Author's Painting Exhibition - August 1986.

- I review non-professional art - September 1986.

- Second Review of non-professional art - September 1987.

- III Review of non-professional art - Oct. , 1988. (Main Prize Director)

- Author's Exhibition of Painting and Drawing - June 1990. Cooperative House of Culture – 

"Witeź" – Kielce, Poland

- Author's Exhibition of Painting, Drawing and Graphics - January 1989.

   Northern Italy (Italia) - Moena

- Author's Exhibition of Painting, and Drawing - November 1990

Professional experience :

2000 - 2005 Enterprise Design, Performance and Investment Services "AW"                                Andrzej Wojarski - Kielce, Poland

             -   the position - Head of Reproduction.

1984 - 1989  Depot unclassified  - Kielce, Poland

            -     the position Visual artist.

1981 - 1984 Workshop Craft-Art Painting Glass and Porcelain 

                  Kielce, Poland

            -     the position Visual artist.


PRESENT LIFE AND WHAT I NEED TO MAKE MY LIFE'S DREAM COME TRUE

Unfortunately when I lost my job because of company bankruptcy,for the past 10 years I was trying to get another one but my Job Center offered me only position as cleaner.Now I am living in UK and for the past 8 years I must working as mentioned above cleaner and if I must be honest from year to year it's getting worse.Now I am living in one room home ( studio room ) . It's very dark and I don't have enough space to work in there.Off course I need good light to see realistic colours on canvas.I have money only to survive another day not mentioned to buy brushes and other materials for painting . I know it's sounds very bad but I am very honest with you.On the pictures you can see my one room home where I now live.



My dream come true is to collect enough money to buy new,professional paint brushes,turpentines,varnish,easel,oil paints,pastels,palette,bristol boards,wooden frames for paintings and more materials that I need for work. Also for rent  ( for at least three months for start ) bigger home with two rooms and windows to have light and space for working.I would like to open new web site where people ( worldwide ) will be ordering paintings from me,where they will be able to send me pictures or photos what painting or drawing they want .In this times when internet rules I have opportunity for the first time in my whole life to live from that want I love and what I was born for.This campaign is my only hope.

Below you can see couple of my works ( oil painting,pastels etc ) . For more paintings please visit facebook page - 

https://www.facebook.com/pages/My-dream-of-online-painting-store/828933837169093?fref=ts

            

      

 



WHAT YOU CAN GET FROM ME

When campaign will end the first thing that I will do will be rewarding people that helped me.I will send to you worldwide sketches and paintings with special individual dedications :

10 £ - Big ,big thank you ,every amount helps me a lot.

35 £ - A4 Pencil sketch with individual dedication send 

           worldwide.Please add at least 10 $ for international 

           shipping out of UK.

60 £ - A4 Pencil sketch of your photo or picture that you send to

           me online.With individual dedication send 

           worldwide.Please add at least 10 $ for international 

           shipping out of UK.

90 £ - 8X10 Inches Oil Painting with landscape or flowers

           motive with individual dedication. Please add at least 

           12 $ for international shipping out of UK.

 135 £ - 10X10 Inches Oil Painting with landscape or flowers

           motive with individual dedication. Please add at least 

           12 $ for international shipping out of UK.

280 £ - 18X14 inches Oil Painting with your photo or picture 

            that you send me online.With individual dedication send 

           worldwide.Free international shipping  

600 £ - Big 20X30 inches Oil Painting with your photo or picture 

            that you send me online.With individual dedication send 

           worldwide.Free International shipping

900 £ - Big 30X40 inches Oil Painting with your photo or 

            picture that you send me online.With individual      

            dedication send worldwide.Free international shipping  

Please note that max time to receive your gifts is two months with big oil paintings with sketches and smaller formats is about one month or less.


Other Ways You Can Help

 I understand that not every one can help me and send money

but from the deep of my heart I will be pleased and very  

 grateful if you can send this message about my campaign to 

 your friends or somewhere that people would know about this.

 Every one that is reading this can help me to start a new life.

 Thank you for your attention and time, God bless you.

 Please note that English is not my native language so sorry

 for grammar.

600 £ - Big 20X30 inches Oil Painting with your photo or picture 
            that you send me online.With individual dedication send 
           worldwide.Free International shipping
900 £ - Big 30X40 inches Oil Painting with your photo or 
            picture that you send me online.With individual      
            dedication send worldwide.Free international shipping  
Please note that max time to receive your gifts is two months with big oil paintings with sketches and smaller formats is about one month or less.   

Other Ways You Can Help

 I understand that not every one can help me and send money
but from the deep of my heart I will be pleased and very  
 grateful if you can send this message about my campaign to 
 your friends or somewhere that people would know about this.
 Every one that is reading this can help me to start a new life.
 Thank you for your attention and time, God bless you.
 Please note that English is not my native language so sorry
 for grammar.

story:
Hey! 
Thanks for taking time out of your day to visit our crowdfunding campaign.  We are i am Love, we are a band.   You can find out more about us and stay up to date on our website iamloveband.com.  5 of us will be making the trip overseas.  We want to make the best first impression possible so we're doing our best to put together the best show we can.  Touring overseas is a longtime dream to many musicians and this certainly includes each of us making the trip.   Below is an estimated breakdown of total costs involved.

1.  Airfare                                      ~  $6,300usd
2. Equipment rental/shipping ~  $1,300usd
3. Van Rental                               ~  $1,900usd
4. Accommodations                  ~  $1,200usd
5. Food/living expenses            ~  $4,500usd (at a rate of $30pp per day)

TOTAL                                           ~  $15,200    
 

What You Get

A group of the most grateful young men the world ever did see.  Perks are outlined in the Perks section. 

The Impact

You are about to contribute to real dreams of people who are passionate about their art and dedicated to bringing positive energy to the entire globe.

Risks & Challenges

Of course there are risks involved and we being working class folks understand the value of a hard earned dollar.  We appreciate whatever you can do an do not take your giving lightly.  We do get paid for the shows but there are no advances on the shows that are booked. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share our music!  If you cannot give$$, share a hug and share your love.

story:
In addition to the AMAZING centre piece of the Odditorium, The Cabinet of Curiosities which will be stuffed full of the Best of the Bizarre, we will be creating a unique space for people to come and enjoy the wonders of the 4 regions contributing to the cabinet: Argentina, Saskatchewan, North Bay CA, and Shanghai China. Our booth will provide a place to challenge your mind, and perhaps even your body. Nightly we will offer midnight tea, adult sized twister, a lounge area, a taxi-dermy station, and hope to be the odd-centric part of the 6 O clock radial of the Midway!  Stop in and perhaps share some Matte with the Argentinians! Discuss the origins of the Saskquatch with the Saskatoonians! Take in the fabulous and classic asian decor from Shanghai while sipping tea! Fall in love with the fabulous antler Chandelier, not to mention the booth staff from California!

Cabinet Wood cut details

The Saskatchewan Crew is pleased to  be able to offer FREE MUSTACHE RIDES at the 2015 Sask Playa Odditorium to all participants on the playa! We are currently working on upgrading the Mustache Ride to the 2.0 version which will feature more padding, leg room and possibly even some steering! We look forward to seating you on our comfortable fluffy mustache and giving you a thrill! The participant driven Mustache will drive you wild!

The Mustache ride in action at Freezer Burn Alberta

Why do we need your help?

We are looking for help to raise funds to create this wonderful and bizarre midway booth so that it can be shared with the participants of Burning Man 2015 and beyond. We are raising funds individually as each country and are also pooling our fund raising here! There are many elements needed to create this awesome environment from wood to paint to electrical elements to exotic Chinese fabrics! The cabinet plans to continue to make appearances after the burn at a variety of festivals and events across Canada and the US and possibly beyond so your support will help this art piece live on well past the burning of the Man in 2015!

We have included a rough budget break down below so you can see what we are in need of. We are not including some expenses such as traveling and accommodation costs, all the cool swag we are making and transportation of the cabinet. Each country is running locally based events to raise those extra funds.  So come visit us if you are in one of our areas!

Budget Items: AKA Things we need to pay for!

Cabinet: $2400 USD; fabric: $250 USD, Lighting $100 USD, furniture $200 USD, decorations $250 USD, oddities $150 USD

Total $3350

We hope to raise $2000 via Indiegogo and appreciate your support very much!

Thank you for your contribution.

With your help we will be able to provide a truly great Odditorium experience for all of the playa, and future Burning Man regional events to enjoy!

story:
About us! Autotelic is committed to providing affordable workspace and facilities to artists interested in creating within a community-centric environment. Autotelic offers inexpensive individual studios to artists-in-residence, access to shop facilities and equipment, teaching and learning initiatives, and experimental exhibition opportunities and special projects. Through partnerships and collaborative projects, we strive to act as an advocate, incubator and resource for artists that thrive within a tight-knit community of artists and makers. Cumulatively, these elements make up the heart of Autotelic's function—to make making easier for artists in Chicago.

After opening our newest studio building at 3551 W. Diversey Ave. just this past July, we are working hard to set up a highly functional community wood shop to accommodate our roster of studio artists as well as other neighborhood makers in need of shop access. The Autotelic Wood Shop is a revenue generator for our nonprofit, and allows us to keep our overhead costs low, ensuring highly affordable studios for artists and low-cost, shop training for all.

We've already acquired many of the tools and equipment necessary to get our shop up and running, but we need a little extra help to purchase a few essential pieces of equipment that'll make our shop a true makerspace. By contributing to our campaign, you're helping us make two big equipment purchases, pay a qualified staffer for a few weekend tool authorization sessions, and cover general liability insurance for an entire year!

Here's what we need:

1. 10" Grizzly Cabinet Saw
The table saw we've been using at the shop has served us well, but after five years on loan, it needs to be returned to its original owner. Our neighbor at our first studio location was kind enough to let us move and use this piece of equipment for a very long time, but it's time for an upgrade! This cabinet saw will give us the precision and safety features necessary to make easy, clean cuts for the many artists who use our tools for sculptures, framing, pedestals and plinths. Let's give them the tools they need to do it safely and efficiently! $1,250 + $99 freight shipping

2: 1.5 HP Grizzly Cyclone Dust Collector
The cyclone dust collection is the minimum requirement for a safer shop as far as fine dust collection goes. Now that our wood shop has expanded to a larger facility, a larger cyclone is ideal to keep fine particles out of the air and out of our lungs. This piece of equipment will give us the flexibility to use multiple tools at once, keep our space clean, and keep our artists breathing clean air while working. $995 + $79 freight shipping

3. Shop Manager Salary 
Our Board of Directors recently voted to pay our super awesome, totally amazing Shop Manager a regular monthly salary to pay her a fair wage for the weekend hours she currently contributes to Autotelic. Ali is a long-time, dedicated Autotelic artist with mad wood working skills and incredible patience for teaching others, and we're always down to pay artists for their work–especially since her job is so essential to the function of our shop. $3000

4. Visiting Artist Teaching Stipends
Our studio and wood shop occasionally hire artists who are interested in sharing their skills and material knowledge through community workshops. In the spirit of paying artists for their valuable work, we want to offer our visiting teaching artists a guaranteed stipend plus a percentage of each workshop fee. Help us set up a sustainable program that pays artists fairly! $900


The rest of our fundraising goal is reserved to support materials and shipping costs associated with our perks and Indiegogo's 5% fee. Every contribution counts!

story:
Short Summary

Out of Site is the brainchild of Carron Little (Faculty in Performance Art at The School of The Art Institute of Chicago) and Whitney Tassie (Curator of Modern and Contemporary Art at the Utah Museum of Fine Arts).  They were thinking about how amazing it would be if when people come home on a Friday night there would be a unique dance piece like Rachel Bunting and The Humans running around the Polish Triangle with horses heads  or some strange encounter like Martine Viale from Canada slowly assembling an installation and then becoming a sculptural element. 

With each year, the festival's ultimate goal is to bring cultural experiences and unexpected encounters for people as they come home from work in the Wicker Park/ Bucktown area. We curate work that brings joy, is provocative and transports people out of their daily routines to create a moment of reflection and wonder in their lives after an unexpected encounter.

To continue to bring art and culture to the community, we need financial support. The 12 invited artists and their performances are already covered to present 28 unexpected encounters from July 25 to September 6. However, we still need financial support for our administration and documentation team in order to run the festival, support the artists, maintain communication through social media, and produce documentation of the performances.

By contributing, you are not only supporting the staff financially, you are helping to insert art and wonder into the viewer's everyday routine.


What We Need & What You Get

We need $5,000 altogether to pay our four administrators and the video editor. The festival runs from July through September, but there is also a lot of post-festival work that needs to happen in order for the impact to resonate such as keeping up with social media communications, updating the website, and screening the documentation of the performances.
If you donate, you will not be disappointed in what you get in return!
$5-15 
  • Eternal gratitude and good karma (It goes a long way!)
$20
  • "Out of Site 2015" T-Shirt  
  • Ticket to the theatrical screening of the performances
  • Eternal gratitude and good karma 
$50
  • Donor spot on the website
  • "Out of Site 2015" T-Shirt  
  • Ticket to the theatrical screening of the performances
  • Eternal gratitude and good karma 
$100
  • Film Credit (You're famous!)
  • Donor spot on the website
  • "Out of Site 2015" T-Shirt  
  • Ticket to the theatrical screening of the performances
  • Eternal gratitude and good karma
$500
  • A painting by artist Carron Little
  • Film Credit (You're famous!)
  • Donor spot on the website
  • "Out of Site 2015" T-Shirt  
  • Ticket to the theatrical screening of the performances 
  • Eternal gratitude and good karma

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, that's ok! Help spread the word about our campaign from social media.

story:
Hey there! 

    I'm Kyle and I'm an artist from Florida. I am attempting to expand my reach and get my art on more canvases to hang on more walls in more cities in Florida and the U.S. With your help I can reach this goal and you can become a collector of my work or add to an existing collection. 

    Some wonderful opportunities have presented themselves to me and in order to take advantage of them I need supplies to create art to hang in locations all over the state of Florida. It's easy to get spread thin as an artist and I think this is a fun way to raise the capital that I need to make that happen. By making a contribution to this campaign you will help me take the next step in the nearly impossible endeavor of being successful as a self-sufficient freelance artist. 


Example of an 18" X 24" Canvas


Example of a 24" X 36" Canvas


How it works

    For the length of this campaign I am going to make my entire body of work available on canvas to backers of this project at an incredible price. 

    An 18" X 24" canvas of my work retails for $85.00, but if you back this project you can own one of your choice for only $50.00

    A 24" X 36" canvas of my work retails for $300.00, and is available here for a limited time for $175.00

    Choose from 170 of my works:


Click here to see the entire album!


    I've added a sticker tier for a $5 pledge for you ballers on a budget. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can’t contribute doesn't mean you can’t help:

  • You can share this campaign with your friends, artists, art lovers and those who want to see cool people do awesome things. 
  • Follow me on social media: Facebook - Instagram - Twitter - Tumblr 

If I can't fund it this way, my next option is to find this baby


New arrival! 


This guy is now available as part of the campaign. Deadpool fan, anyone?

story:
Introduction

I am Xiaochen Gao, a current graduate student at the Savannah College of Art and Design As a program requirement, I am planning a final project (similar to a thesis), which will design, plan and execute an illustration exhibition; Global Arts Miniature. for young artists in Savannah, Georgia. This exhibition will introduce young illustration artists to the public and encourage these artists and others to promote their artworks in the community. The artists represented in the exhibition are from different countries and they create artworks with Eastern and Western cultural backgrounds. Based on this, I want to provide the audience with an unbiased environment to understand both of them, and have the opportunity to communicate with these young artists.

What is Global Arts Miniature?

Global Arts Miniature is an illustration exhibition designed to build a connection with artists and audience. Thefive artists are from different countries and regions with different cultural backgrounds. Consequently, their artworks have different styles and expressions, especially in Eastern and Western culture. The exhibition is an opportunity for these artists to come together in artistic expression, but also express their unique experiences through their own styles. It is important for the community to share in the experiences of each artist in the exhibition to educate themselves not only of the contemporary art movement, but also see firsthand how culture is still affecting the art world. 

What We Need & What You Get

For this exhibition:

Rental Fee: $100

Print and Frame Artworks: $1200

In this exhibition, I prefer to provide audience members a  high-quality arts services with outstanding artworks. According to this, I would like to pay more attention on the printing artworks for my audience! Therefore, I prefer to use contribution on the illustration artworks and give all of my audience a visual feast in this exhibition!  

$5 - For $5, you will receive a Shout Out on the Facebook event page and a thank-you email! 

$15 - For $15, add $5 package, you will also receive a handwritten thank-you card.

$30 - For $30, your name will be listed on the Moonstone Sponsor in Global Arts Miniature exhibition with $15 package.

$50 - For$50, you will receive a special thank-you postcard, one of artworks (size 8'' × 11.5‘’) with artists' signature and $30 package. Your name will be also on the Emerald Sponsor’s list.

$100 - For $100, you will  talk with artists in a single studio, one of artworks (pick up by yourself), receive their notes, and an exhibition catalog with all of artworks that are shown in Global Arts Miniature Exhibition with $50 package. It will include artists’ statements, contact information and images of artworks. Your name will be on the Ruby Sponsor’s list. 

$150 -  For $150, you will make a communication with artists firstly, one of artworks (pick up by yourself), enjoy all of artists’ notes in the Global Arts Miniature Exhibition and their inspirations! You will also receive all of artists’ postcards, photos from the opening reception with $100 package! 

Purpose

This exhibition will introduce young artists to the public and encourage them to promote their artworks in the community. To support the artists, I will sell and promote artworks, gain revenue and expand the awareness for artists through this event. In the events, artists will receive benefits and improve their art skills through feedbacks from the audience.

Artists Statement

        Anna Dittmann

As a child, Anna Dittmann wanted to recreate the world as she saw it. Her first canvases were the walls of her bedroom and it’s been a strange, fantastic ride ever since. Born and raised in San Francisco, Anna is a digital illustrator with a passion for enigmatic portraiture. She eventually moved to Georgia to study at the Savannah College of Art and Design, focusing on a BFA in Illustration.

Anna has a love for nature, biology, and portraiture which are recurring themes throughout her work. Through her art she hopes to inspire a sense of otherworldly beauty and mystery. Her personal inspiration comes from organic natural elements, mythology and history, movement and texture, lyrics and melodies, expressions, color variations, pretty much anything which makes her want to grab her tablet and paint (which is almost all the time)!

 Abigail Goh

Abigail is a designer with a clear and simple illustrative voice. Using simple lines and shapes, she tries to translate complex ideas into clever and powerful images. She weaves bits of her soul into every piece of work, to achieve her goal of conveying intelligent ideas with lyrical undertones that can touch the heart. She has a passion for efficient communication and succinct storytelling, and hopes to create art that can inspire positive thoughts ad simple joy. Drawing heavily from the rich experiences in her life, she tries to capture the essence of details that slip by unnoticed.

       Dola Sun

Dola Sun is an illustrator originally from China. She likes to create illustrations with textures and graphic shapes,works both traditionally and digitally. After coming to the USA, she gradually fell in love with visual story telling. The process of solving a problem with visual language is the most attractive part to her. She likes subjects with emotion, She tries to put herself in the positions of who the story is about and imagine what they’re going through.

           Lin Sun

Lin,a fashion student who full of creative and passion to her arts, no matter in fashion design, fashion illustration or illustration. Her arts always bring people a lot surprises.

          Yao Yu

Yao Yu didn’t know that she would become an illustrator before she graduated with an international business bachelor degree in China four years ago. After graduation, she had a strong feeling that she did not want to work in a bank and deal with money. So she came to the US and started over with something totally different.

She was amazed by the world of art and fell in love with it immediately. As time went by, her artworks changed from realistic style to graphic style. So she considered herself as a design illustrator. She likes to utilize geometric shapes and primary colors in creating conceptual and functional illustration. Yao loves reading. In her opinion, the thinking process is very attractive before making beautiful arts. Books and movies are significant inspiration for her. She can stay at home for several months alone just reading books.

Other Ways You Can Help

More detail information is on Facebook Event Page:

https://www.facebook.com/events/1046592438691065/

All of Artists information and their artworks are on this page! 

Please share this campaign with your friends and families! Thanks for your help! 
Any way that you can help will be greatly appreciated, so thank you in advance for your generosity!

The artists represented in the exhibition are from different countries and they create artworks with Eastern and Western cultural backgrounds. Based on this, I want to provide the audience with an unbiased environment to understand both of them, and have the opportunity to communicate with these young artists.
  
What is Global Arts Miniature?

Global
Arts Miniature is an illustration exhibition designed to build a connection
with artists and audience. Thefive artists are from different countries and
regions with different cultural backgrounds. Consequently, their artworks have
different styles and expressions, especially in Eastern and Western culture. The
exhibition is an opportunity for these artists to come together in artistic
expression, but also express their unique experiences through their own styles.
It is important for the community to share in the experiences of each artist in
the exhibition to educate themselves not only of the contemporary art movement,
but also see firsthand how culture is still affecting the art world. 

What We Need & What You Get

For this exhibition:
Rental Fee: $100
Print and Frame Artworks: $1200
In this exhibition, I prefer to
provide audience members a  high-quality arts services with outstanding
artworks. According to this, I would like to pay more attention on the printing
artworks for my audience! Therefore, I prefer to use contribution on the
illustration artworks and give all of my audience a visual feast in this
exhibition!  
$5 - For $5, you will receive a Shout Out on the Facebook event page and a thank-you email! 
$15 - For $15, add $5 package, you will also receive a handwritten thank-you card.
$30 - For $30, your name will be listed on the Moonstone Sponsor in Global Arts Miniature exhibition with $15 package.
$50 - For$50, you will receive a special thank-you postcard, one of artworks (size 8'' × 11.5‘’) with artists' signature and $30 package. Your name will be also on the Emerald Sponsor’s list.
$100 - For $100, you will  talk with artists in a single studio, one of artworks (pick up by yourself), receive their notes, and an exhibition catalog with all of artworks that are shown in Global Arts Miniature Exhibition with $50 package. It will include artists’ statements, contact information and images of artworks. Your name will be on the Ruby Sponsor’s list. 
$150 -  For $150, you will make a communication with artists firstly, one of artworks (pick up by yourself), enjoy all of artists’ notes in the Global Arts Miniature Exhibition and their inspirations! You will also receive all of artists’ postcards, photos from the opening reception with $100 package! 


Purpose  

This exhibition will introduce young
artists to the public and encourage them to promote their artworks in the
community. To support the artists, I will sell and promote artworks, gain
revenue and expand the awareness for artists through this event. In the events,
artists will receive benefits and improve their art skills through feedbacks
from the audience.

Artists Statement



        Anna Dittmann
As a child, Anna Dittmann
wanted to recreate the world as she saw it. Her first canvases were the walls
of her bedroom and it’s been a strange, fantastic ride ever since. Born and
raised in San Francisco, Anna is a digital
illustrator with a passion for enigmatic portraiture. She eventually moved to Georgia to study at the
Savannah College of Art and Design, focusing on a BFA in Illustration.


Anna has a love for nature, biology, and
portraiture which are recurring themes throughout her work. Through her art she
hopes to inspire a sense of otherworldly beauty and mystery. Her
personal inspiration comes from organic natural elements, mythology and
history, movement and texture, lyrics and melodies, expressions, color variations,
pretty much anything which makes her want to grab her tablet and paint (which
is almost all the time)!

 Abigail Goh
Abigail is a designer with a clear and simple illustrative voice. Using simple lines and shapes, she tries to translate complex ideas into clever and powerful images. She weaves bits of her soul into every piece of work, to achieve her goal of conveying intelligent ideas with lyrical undertones that can touch the heart. She has a passion for efficient communication and succinct storytelling, and hopes to create art that can inspire positive thoughts ad simple joy. Drawing heavily from the rich experiences in her life, she tries to capture the essence of details that slip by unnoticed.


       Dola SunDola Sun is an illustrator originally from China. She likes to create illustrations with textures and graphic shapes,works both traditionally and digitally. After coming to the USA, she gradually fell in love with visual story telling. The process of solving a problem with visual language is the most attractive part to her. She likes subjects with emotion, She tries to put herself in the positions of who the story is about and imagine what they’re going through.


           Lin Sun
Lin,a fashion student who full of creative and passion to her arts, no matter in fashion design, fashion illustration or illustration. Her arts always bring people a lot surprises.


          Yao Yu
Yao Yu didn’t know that she would become an illustrator before she graduated with an international business bachelor degree in China four years ago. After graduation, she had a strong feeling that she did not want to work in a bank and deal with money. So she came to the US and started over with something totally different.
She was amazed by the world of art and fell in love with it immediately. As time went by, her artworks changed from realistic style to graphic style. So she considered herself as a design illustrator. She likes to utilize geometric shapes and primary colors in creating conceptual and functional illustration. Yao loves reading. In her opinion, the thinking process is very attractive before making beautiful arts. Books and movies are significant inspiration for her. She can stay at home for several months alone just reading books.


   Other Ways You Can Help More detail information is on Facebook Event Page:
https://www.facebook.com/events/1046592438691065/
All of Artists information and their artworks are on this page! 

Please share this campaign with your friends and families! Thanks for your help! Any way that you can help will be greatly appreciated, so thank you in advance for your generosity!

story:
I have liaised with a book publishing company who has been kind enough to provide advice and support on the steps I need to take and the funds required in order to put together a book detailing the culture of gaming tattoos.

I created the instagram page in March 2014, it was my ambiton to bring together a community of dedicated gamers and amazing artists by sharing work by people from all over the world.

I've been lucky enough to be featured in a few gaming magazines, and now I would love to move on the possibility of a book!

In addition, more than 50 artists and tattoo artists from all over the world including the UK, Australia and the US have donated perks such as prints, orginal art pieces and even tattoo time to make help make the book happen, so if you are passionate about the gaming and tattoo community, be sure to check the campaign out and even donate if you can, its a chance to get tattooed by loads of amazing artists and have a piece featured in a book at the same time!

For more artist info, check out the updates tab or head over to instagram and find videogametatts 

I would be honoured if you would make a contribution to this project,

Thanks again,

Regards, Alex

videogametatts

AS YOU ALL ARE AWARE THE PROJECT IS SET AS FLEXIBLE FUNDING, HOWEVER ALL PROCEEDS WILL STILL BE INVESTED INTO FUNDING THE BOOK AND EVERYONE WHO HAS CONTRIBUTED FOR PERKS WILL STILL RECEIVE WHAT THEY HAVE DONATED FOR =)

story:
BEADWORK: Visions of Peace Chile – June 2015:

Native Immigrant has transformed from its original inception by artist, Carolina Echeverria, to an emerging collective of ten to fifteen people, six of whom will be travelling to Mapuche territory in Victoria and Santiago de Chile to participate in the Encuentro ‘Native Immigrant Chile 2015’ to be held in the Espacio de Arte Departamento 44 and in the streets of the cities of Santiago and Victoria, Chile.

The event, which will take place from June 22nd to July 5th 2015, will include Native Immigrant dressmaking and story-collecting, as well as performances, forums, lectures, visual art exhibitions and site-specific installations. Participating artists will create works inspired by the stories collected throughout the entire process. The purpose of this phase of Native Immigrant is to create dialogue and to build bridges between First Nations and immigrants, both in Canada and in Chile.

The Vision

Among the Iroquois, Wampum Beads were beaded for various purposes such as recording on strings, the condolence ceremony. Wampum belts were also created to record treaty events. Most relevant to our beadwork project is the Circle Wampum, which is the constitution of the Iroquois Confederacy. The fifty strings represent the fifty "chiefs" of the Confederacy. Sha'tethonatte': they are all the same height. This is what the fifty strings represent. The "chiefs" must work together collaborative with each other, and with the clan mothers. The clan mothers work together with the people. Sha'tetionkwatte': We are all the same height. No one is above the other. This is the basis for the Iroquois vision of world peace. It is all recorded in beads, wampum beads. Our symbol, at the top of the tree of Great Peace, is the Eagle that sees afar - the eagle that we say protects the children. We wish to share this point of view with all the people of the world, particularly the Mapuche, the people of the Condor. We wish to learn their understanding of the world, and how they recorded it. Was it with beads, or with some other art form? What is the Mapuche vision of world peace? How was it recorded, and remembered. We wish to exchange art forms about peace, with the Mapuche, and if all agree, share this knowledge with the world, beginning in August, in old Montreal.”

-Philip Deering

Why raise funds?

Native Immigrant needs funds for two main reasons: to support participating artists’ travel to and around Chile, and to bring a Mapuche artist to Canada to present work at the Ashukan Cultural Center in August, 2015. This is an important cultural exchange that resonates with all communities involved, as well as with mandates to promote First Nations cultures within Canada and Chile. A small portion of the funds raised will also be used for promotional material, materials for the site-specific work, to secure a place at Espacio de Arte Departamento 44, and as honoraria for artists taking part in the Kultrun of Peace events in Victoria and Santiago de Chile. Traveling artists will be billeted in the host communities; so no outside funds will be required for food or lodging.

What will you get in exchange for your donation?

$10 - a mention and a blessing

$25 - a pack of art cards by Carolina Echeverria 

$50 – "Hope" - hand framed print 

 $100 - a necklace, made by "agatacarolina"

 $250 - a one-of a kind mixed media piece by Judith Brisson

 $500 - a Mohawk Raised Beadwork piece, from Taion’wesenhtane

 $500 - original signed poem by Roy Wright 

$1000 – sculpture by Carolina Echeverria

 $2000 - an original painting by Carolina Echeverria

Who are you supporting?

Christine Brault lives and works in Montreal. As an interdisciplinary artist, relating to various contexts, she creates actions and site-specific interventions, material or immaterial with a poetic, engaged and feminist angle using an anthropological vision. Holding a Master’s degree in Visual Arts from UQÀM, she has been granted from Canada Arts Council, Conseil des arts et lettres du Québec and Engrenage Noir. She has presented her work in Canada, in Europe, in China, in Latin America and in the USA. Her performative actions has brought her to participate in various international performance festivals and artist residencies in Dominican Republic, in Mexico, in Chile, in Czech Republic, in Miami. Furthermore, she also teaches french to new immigrants at Cégep du Vieux-Montréal.

Judith Brisson is an educator and an MFA student at the Vermont College of Fine Arts, a human rights defender and an independent multidisciplinary artist who creates, site-specific installations around ideas of peace and reconciliation. Her writing has been featured in NACLA, Siafu Magazine, and the Upstream Journal and her art practice has been featured in The New Quarterly, Hyperallergic, Génération d’idées, and on Les Nouveaux Explorateurs (Canal +). She has also had feature interviews on Global TV and CBC radio. In recent years, Judith has attempted to bridge the gap between art-making and activism through a variety of means – from furtive practices, to socially-engaged visual works, to collaborations that engage with others, whether artists or the general public, to generate new ideas around creating peace.

Tais Costa was born in Brazil and moved to Montreal at the age of twelve, where she became an artist. Helping NI with website design, video and documentation, she is able to contribute both with her artistic vision and immigration experience. She is currently exploring South America and is already planting some seeds for Native Immigrant in Chile.

Saulo Cruz de Oliveira was born in 1973 in São Paulo (Brazil). He started his musical studies at age 13 with Raymond Roger Rainville in the “Senac Marching Band” (trombone, euphonium and theory) and with Manoel Hermínio Marques de Souza at the Carlos Gomes Conservatoire (piano). He pursued his studies at the “Drama and Music Conservatoire Dr. Carlos de Campos” in Tatuí - São Paulo (trombone, piano, harpsichord and composition), where he also worked for five years as a teacher in the piano chair.

As our main NI partner in Chile, Saulo will be traveling with us to the South and will be introducing his original musical creations to our encounters.

Carolina Echeverria is an artist, storyteller and the creator of a powerful relationship with words; Carolina Echeverría was born in Santiago de Chile. She left in 1986, re-rooting herself in Montreal, Quebec.

Carolina is no stranger to controversy: her exhibits have always challenged social norms. Carolina believes in the power of a woman to change the current of perception in today’s world. A stranger in a strange land, she has adapted to a new culture while protecting her true self from its divisive politics.

Carolina has been working on an artistic statement of collective cultural values since 2010. As an artist, she seeks to bridge immigrants and First Nations, to talk about the space between Native and Immigrant by inserting a hyphen—a symbol of what holds us all together, to preserve the space in which dialogue, creativity, and true healing can occur.

Philip Deering - Mohawk Cultural Interpreter, educator.

From 1972 to 1982 Philip Deering was Co-Administrator of Indian Way School (35 students) in Kahnawake, the first native controlled high school north of the U.S./Canadian border. In the Fall of 1978 he created key design plan features for the Kahnawake Survival School (250 students) including project-based education, a participatory student council, and a campus style approach. At the moment he is involved in the struggle to maintain a campus style approach at Survival School by developing a new teacher training program designed to support project-based education and other participatory approaches.

Agata Kozanecka - Chief Dressmaker

Born in Poland. Since 1990 lives in Montreal where, she is raising her family. For the last 14 years she has been involved in community activism in the context of Polish-Jewish relations, common heritage and history, bridging communities and promoting awareness. Considers a preservation of memories and the sharing of life stories important in the process of restoring mutual understanding and reconciliation.

As a member of Native Immigrant Collective, Agata continues her engagement in activities of immigrant dress-making as artistic expression of cultural exchange, building tolerance and inclusiveness.

Roxana Miranda Rupailaf - Mapuche Poet

Roxana (1982, Osorno) is one of the most interesting and compelling Mapuche poets in contemporary Chile and part of the dazzling picture of young poets in Chile. “Without a doubt, a captivating poetry that explores - saying of Pablo Huirimilla - a certain feminine ontology associated with sexuality, the body, in a controversial dialogue with images that inherited the great judeo-Christian allegories. In addition to a gender awareness, which in turn is also informed by an awareness of ethnicity, given their status as poet mapuche huilliche. Finally, a poet who must be taken into account.

http://www.letras.s5.com/egb220907.htm

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F0DR5oEsgL8

Roy WRIGHT (Tekastiaks) - 

Competence (teaching, writing, research): Astronomy; history of science; anthropology; (ethno-) history; (historical, descriptive, applied) linguistics; languages: English, Icelandic, German, Swedish, Gothic; Romanian, French, Latin, Spanish, Italian, Portuguese; Albanian, Gaelic, Welsh, Russian, Polish, Serbian, Modern & Ancient Greek, Hittite; Mohawk, Huron, Tuscarora, Abenaki, Mi'kmaq, Maliseet, Odawa, Cree, Lakota; Guo yu, Nihongo, Hungarian, Finnish, Yiddish, &c. (fluency varies; 42 taught, 63 studied)

Education:

National Merit: Harvard, AB1963cumlaude linguistics & Romance philology; thesis: Albanian

Fulbright: Univ. Bucureşti, 1963-5, Academia Româna: diplomas

NDEA Harvard, PhD cand. 1965-8 (AbD) linguistics; thesis: Jesuit Huron-Iroquois

With great thanks to:

Gabriel Antilao

Francisca Pailalleo

The Chilean Consulate in Montreal

Nadine St-Louis and the Ashukan Cultural Center in Montreal

Comite de Apoyo al Pueblo Mapuche

John Bead Corp.



Tissage et Visions de paix:  

Chili – juin 2015

Immigrant de souche, conçu par l'artiste Carolina Echeverria,a évolué depuis sa création, en un collectif émergent de dix à quinze personnes, dont six se rendront en territoire Mapuche, à Victoria et à Santiago au Chili, pour participer à l’Encuentro Native Immigrant au Chili 2015, qui se tiendra dans le Departamento del Espacio de Arte 44 et dans les rues des villes de Santiago et Victoria, au Chili.

L'événement, qui aura lieu du 22 juin au 5 juillet 2015, comprendra l’oeuvre collective qu’est la confection de la robe de l’Immigrant et le recueil des histoires personnelles des participants, ainsi que des spectacles, forums, conférences, expositions d'arts visuels et installations in situ. Les artistes/participants créeront des travaux inspirés par les récits recueillis tout au long du processus. Cette phase de l’Immigrant de souche vise à établir un dialogue et à créer des ponts entre les Premières Nations et les immigrants, au Canada et au Chili. 

La Vision

“Chez les Iroquois, les perles de Wampum étaient perlées à des fins diverses, telles que le recueil sur des fils, de la cérémonie des condoléances.

Les ceintures de wampum ont également été créées lors d’événements et de traités.

Le plus pertinent à notre projet de perlage est le Wampum du cercle, qui représente la constitution de la Confédération iroquoise.

Les cinquante liens (cordes) représentent cinquante « chefs » de la Confédération.

Sha'tethonatte': Ils ont tous la même hauteur.

C'est ce que représentent les cinquante cordes.

Les « chefs » doivent travailler ensemble et collaborer entre eux et avec les Mères du clan. Les Mères du clan travaillent avec le peuple.

Sha'tetionkwatte': Nous sommes tous de la même hauteur. 

Nul n'est au-dessus de l'autre.

C'est la base de la vision iroquoise de la paix dans le monde. Elle est  enregistrée avec des perles, des perles de wampum.

Notre symbole, tout en haut de l'arbre de la Grande Paix, est l'aigle qui voit loin - l'aigle qui, comme nous le disons, protège les enfants.

Nous tenons à partager ce point de vue avec tous les peuples du monde, et en particulier avec les Mapuches, le peuple du Condor. Nous voulons apprendre leur compréhension du monde, et comment ils l’ont enregistré.  Était-ce avec des perles, ou avec une autre forme d'art. Quelle est la vision de la paix mondiale des Mapuche? Comment était elle enregistrée et remémorée?

Nous souhaitons échanger nos formes d'art sur la paix, avec les Mapuches et si tous sont d'accord, partager ces connaissances avec le monde, en commençant en août, dans le Vieux-Montréal.”

-Philip Deering

Pourquoi une collecte de fonds?

Immigrant de souche a besoin de fonds pour deux raisons principales: Pour financer le voyage des artistes participants au Chili et inviter un artiste Mapuche au Canada pour présenter ses oeuvres  au Centre Culturel Ashukan au mois d’août 2015. Il s’agit d’un échange culturel important qui résonne avec toutes les communautés concernées, ainsi que pour poursuivre le mandat de promouvoir les cultures des Premières Nations au Canada et au Chili. Une petite partie des fonds recueillis servira à la production du matériel promotionnel, à l’achat de matériaux pour les œuvres in situ, et pour obtenir un espace au Departamento de Espacio de Arte 44 ainsi que pour les honoraires des artistes chiliens qui participent aux événements Kultrun de la paix à Victoria et à Santiago du Chili. Les artistes seront logés dans les communautés d’accueil, donc aucun financement ne sera nécessaire pour les repas ou l’hébergement.

Ce que vous obtiendrez en échange pour votre don:

$10  - une mention et une bénédiction

$25 - paquet de 5 cartes (Carolina)

$50  - une impression du bateau Immigrant de souche, encadrée

$100 - un collier, fait par Carolina & Agatha

$250  - une pièce unique de medias mixtes par Judith

$500  - une oeuvre perlage Mohawk, de Taion'wesenhtane

$500  - un poème original signé par Roy

$1000 - une sculpture par Carolina

$2000 - une toile originale de Carolina

Christine Brault vit et travaille à Montréal. Artiste interdisciplinaire, selon les contextes elle crée des actions et des interventions in situ, matérielles ou immatérielles, selon un angle poétique, mais engagé et féministe empruntant un regard anthropologique. Diplômée de l’UQÀM avec une maîtrise en arts visuels, boursière du Conseil des arts du Canada, du Conseil des arts et lettres du Québec et d’Engrenage Noir, elle a présenté son travail au Canada, en Europe, en Chine, en Amérique Latine et aux Etats-Unis. Ses actions performatives l’amènent à participer à divers festivals internationaux de performance et résidences d’artiste en République Dominicaine, au Mexique, au Chili, en République Tchèque, à Miami. 

Judith Brisson est une éducatrice et une étudiante au Vermont College of Fine Arts, une défenseur des droits de la personne et artiste multidisciplinaire, elle crée des installations in situ à propos des idées de la paix et la réconciliation. Son écriture a été présentée dans NACLA, Siafu Magazine et The Upstream Journal et sa pratique d'art a été présenté dans The New Quarterly, Hyperallergic, Génération d'idées, ainsi que Les Nouveaux Explorateurs (Canal +). Récemment, Judith a tenté de combler le fossé entre la création artistique et l'activisme par une variété de moyens – des pratiques furtives, pratiques engagées et à des collaborations qui s'engagent avec les autres, tant artistes ou du public, afin de générer de nouvelles idées autour de la création de paix.

Carolina Echeverria est artiste, conteuse et créatrice d’une puissante relation avec les mots, Carolina Echeverría est née à Santiago du Chili. Elle est partie en 1986, se ré-enracinant à Montréal au Québec.

Carolina n’est pas étrangère à la controverse: ses expositions ont toujours défié les normes sociales. Carolina croit au pouvoir qu’a une femme de changer le flux de la perception dans le monde d’aujourd’hui. Une étrangère dans une terre étrangère, elle s’est adaptée à une nouvelle culture tout en protégeant sa vraie personne des politiques qui créent des divisions.

Carolina a travaillé sur une démarche artistique de valeurs culturelles collectives depuis 2010. En tant qu’artiste, elle cherche à faire le lien entre les immigrants et les Premières Nations, à parler de l’espace entre Natif et Immigrant en insérant un trait d’union —le symbole de ce qui nous rapproche, pour préserver l’espace dans lequel le dialogue, la créativité et la véritable guérison peuvent se dérouler.

Philip Deering - Interprète culturel Mohawk, éducateur.

Agata Kozanescka - Chef-couturière

Roy WRIGHT (Tekastiaks)

Compétences (enseignement, écriture, recherche):

astronomie ; histoire de la science ; anthropologie ; (ethno-) histoire ; linguistique (historique, descriptive, appliquée) ; langues : anglais, allemand, suédois, islandais, gothique ; roumain, français, latin, espagnol, italien, portugais ; gaélique, gallois, russe, polonais, serbe, moderne & antique grec, albanais, hittite ; mohawk, huron, tuscarora, abénaquis, micmacs, malécites, odawa, cris, Lakota ; guo yu, nihongo, hongrois, finnois, yiddish, & c. (fluidité varie ; 42 apprise, 63)

Éducation:

Mérite national: Harvard, AB1963cumlaude linguistique & philologie romane; thèse: albanais

Fulbright: Univ. Bucureşti, 1963-5, Româna Academia: diplômes

Cand NDEA Harvard, PhD. 1965-8 (AbD) linguistique; thèse: jésuites Huron-Iroquois

Sincères remerciements à:

Gabriel Antilao

Francisca Pailalleo

Le Consulat Chilien à Montréal

Nadine St-Louis et le Centre culturel Ashukan à Montréal 

Comite de Apoyo al Pueblo Mapuche

John Bead Corp.

Native Immigrant has transformed from its original inception by artist, Carolina Echeverria, to an emerging collective of ten to fifteen people, six of whom will be travelling to Mapuche territory in Victoria and Santiago de Chile to participate in the Encuentro ‘Native Immigrant Chile 2015’ to be held in the Espacio de Arte Departamento 44 and in the streets of the cities of Santiago and Victoria, Chile.

The Vision
Among the Iroquois, Wampum Beads were beaded for various purposes such as recording on strings, the condolence ceremony. Wampum belts were also created to record treaty events. Most relevant to our beadwork project is the Circle Wampum, which is the constitution of the Iroquois Confederacy. The fifty strings represent the fifty "chiefs" of the Confederacy. The clan mothers work together with the people. Sha'tetionkwatte': We are all the same height. No one is above the other. This is the basis for the Iroquois vision of world peace. It is all recorded in beads, wampum beads. Our symbol, at the top of the tree of Great Peace, is the Eagle that sees afar - the eagle that we say protects the children. We wish to exchange art forms about peace, with the Mapuche, and if all agree, share this knowledge with the world, beginning in August, in old Montreal.”
-Philip Deering

Native Immigrant needs funds for two main reasons: to support participating artists’ travel to and around Chile, and to bring a Mapuche artist to Canada to present work at the Ashukan Cultural Center in August, 2015. This is an important cultural exchange that resonates with all communities involved, as well as with mandates to promote First Nations cultures within Canada and Chile. What will you get in exchange for your donation?
$10 - a mention and a blessing
$25 - a pack of art cards by Carolina Echeverria 
$50 – "Hope" - hand framed print 
 $100 - a necklace, made by "agatacarolina"
 $250 - a one-of a kind mixed media piece by Judith Brisson
 $500 - a Mohawk Raised Beadwork piece, from Taion’wesenhtane
 $500 - original signed poem by Roy Wright 
$1000 – sculpture by Carolina Echeverria
