As an interdisciplinary artist, relating to various contexts, she creates actions and site-specific interventions, material or immaterial with a poetic, engaged and feminist angle using an anthropological vision. Holding a Master’s degree in Visual Arts from UQÀM, she has been granted from Canada Arts Council, Conseil des arts et lettres du Québec and Engrenage Noir. She has presented her work in Canada, in Europe, in China, in Latin America and in the USA. Her performative actions has brought her to participate in various international performance festivals and artist residencies in Dominican Republic, in Mexico, in Chile, in Czech Republic, in Miami. Furthermore, she also teaches french to new immigrants at Cégep du Vieux-Montréal.
Judith Brisson is an educator and an MFA student at the Vermont College of Fine Arts, a human rights defender and an independent multidisciplinary artist who creates, site-specific installations around ideas of peace and reconciliation. Her writing has been featured in NACLA, Siafu Magazine, and the Upstream Journal and her art practice has been featured in The New Quarterly, Hyperallergic, Génération d’idées, and on Les Nouveaux Explorateurs (Canal +). She has also had feature interviews on Global TV and CBC radio. In recent years, Judith has attempted to bridge the gap between art-making and activism through a variety of means – from furtive practices, to socially-engaged visual works, to collaborations that engage with others, whether artists or the general public, to generate new ideas around creating peace.
Tais Costa was born in Brazil and moved to Montreal at the age of twelve, where she became an artist. Helping NI with website design, video and documentation, she is able to contribute both with her artistic vision and immigration experience. She is currently exploring South America and is already planting some seeds for Native Immigrant in Chile.
Saulo Cruz de Oliveira was born in 1973 in São Paulo (Brazil). He started his musical studies at age 13 with Raymond Roger Rainville in the “Senac Marching Band” (trombone, euphonium and theory) and with Manoel Hermínio Marques de Souza at the Carlos Gomes Conservatoire (piano). He pursued his studies at the “Drama and Music Conservatoire Dr. Carlos de Campos” in Tatuí - São Paulo (trombone, piano, harpsichord and composition), where he also worked for five years as a teacher in the piano chair.
As our main NI partner in Chile, Saulo will be traveling with us to the South and will be introducing his original musical creations to our encounters.
Carolina Echeverria is an artist, storyteller and the creator of a powerful relationship with words; Carolina Echeverría was born in Santiago de Chile. She left in 1986, re-rooting herself in Montreal, Quebec.
Carolina is no stranger to controversy: her exhibits have always challenged social norms. Carolina believes in the power of a woman to change the current of perception in today’s world. A stranger in a strange land, she has adapted to a new culture while protecting her true self from its divisive politics.
Carolina has been working on an artistic statement of collective cultural values since 2010. As an artist, she seeks to bridge immigrants and First Nations, to talk about the space between Native and Immigrant by inserting a hyphen—a symbol of what holds us all together, to preserve the space in which dialogue, creativity, and true healing can occur.
Philip Deering - Mohawk Cultural Interpreter, educator.
From 1972 to 1982 Philip Deering was Co-Administrator of Indian Way School (35 students) in Kahnawake, the first native controlled high school north of the U.S./Canadian border. In the Fall of 1978 he created key design plan features for the Kahnawake Survival School (250 students) including project-based education, a participatory student council, and a campus style approach. At the moment he is involved in the struggle to maintain a campus style approach at Survival School by developing a new teacher training program designed to support project-based education and other participatory approaches.
Agata Kozanecka - Chief Dressmaker
Born in Poland. Since 1990 lives in Montreal where, she is raising her family. For the last 14 years she has been involved in community activism in the context of Polish-Jewish relations, common heritage and history, bridging communities and promoting awareness. Considers a preservation of memories and the sharing of life stories important in the process of restoring mutual understanding and reconciliation.
As a member of Native Immigrant Collective, Agata continues her engagement in activities of immigrant dress-making as artistic expression of cultural exchange, building tolerance and inclusiveness.
Roxana Miranda Rupailaf - Mapuche Poet
Roxana (1982, Osorno) is one of the most interesting and compelling Mapuche poets in contemporary Chile and part of the dazzling picture of young poets in Chile. “Without a doubt, a captivating poetry that explores - saying of Pablo Huirimilla - a certain feminine ontology associated with sexuality, the body, in a controversial dialogue with images that inherited the great judeo-Christian allegories. In addition to a gender awareness, which in turn is also informed by an awareness of ethnicity, given their status as poet mapuche huilliche. Finally, a poet who must be taken into account.
http://www.letras.s5.com/egb220907.htm
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F0DR5oEsgL8
Roy WRIGHT (Tekastiaks) - 
Competence (teaching, writing, research): Astronomy; history of science; anthropology; (ethno-) history; (historical, descriptive, applied) linguistics; languages: English, Icelandic, German, Swedish, Gothic; Romanian, French, Latin, Spanish, Italian, Portuguese; Albanian, Gaelic, Welsh, Russian, Polish, Serbian, Modern & Ancient Greek, Hittite; Mohawk, Huron, Tuscarora, Abenaki, Mi'kmaq, Maliseet, Odawa, Cree, Lakota; Guo yu, Nihongo, Hungarian, Finnish, Yiddish, &c. (fluency varies; 42 taught, 63 studied)
Education:
National Merit: Harvard, AB1963cumlaude linguistics & Romance philology; thesis: Albanian
Fulbright: Univ. Bucureşti, 1963-5, Academia Româna: diplomas
NDEA Harvard, PhD cand. 1965-8 (AbD) linguistics; thesis: Jesuit Huron-Iroquois

With great thanks to:
Gabriel Antilao
Francisca Pailalleo
The Chilean Consulate in Montreal
Nadine St-Louis and the Ashukan Cultural Center in Montreal
Comite de Apoyo al Pueblo Mapuche
John Bead Corp.



Tissage et Visions de paix:  Chili – juin 2015
Immigrant de souche, conçu par l'artiste Carolina Echeverria,a évolué depuis sa création, en un collectif émergent de dix à quinze personnes, dont six se rendront en territoire Mapuche, à Victoria et à Santiago au Chili, pour participer à l’Encuentro Native Immigrant au Chili 2015, qui se tiendra dans le Departamento del Espacio de Arte 44 et dans les rues des villes de Santiago et Victoria, au Chili.
L'événement, qui aura lieu du 22 juin au 5 juillet 2015, comprendra l’oeuvre collective qu’est la confection de la robe de l’Immigrant et le recueil des histoires personnelles des participants, ainsi que des spectacles, forums, conférences, expositions d'arts visuels et installations in situ. Les artistes/participants créeront des travaux inspirés par les récits recueillis tout au long du processus. Cette phase de l’Immigrant de souche vise à établir un dialogue et à créer des ponts entre les Premières Nations et les immigrants, au Canada et au Chili. 
La Vision
“Chez les Iroquois, les perles de Wampum étaient perlées à des fins diverses, telles que le recueil sur des fils, de la cérémonie des condoléances.
Les ceintures de wampum ont également été créées lors d’événements et de traités.
Le plus pertinent à notre projet de perlage est le Wampum du cercle, qui représente la constitution de la Confédération iroquoise.
Les cinquante liens (cordes) représentent cinquante « chefs » de la Confédération.
Sha'tethonatte': Ils ont tous la même hauteur.
C'est ce que représentent les cinquante cordes.
Les « chefs » doivent travailler ensemble et collaborer entre eux et avec les Mères du clan. Les Mères du clan travaillent avec le peuple.
Sha'tetionkwatte': Nous sommes tous de la même hauteur. 
Nul n'est au-dessus de l'autre.
C'est la base de la vision iroquoise de la paix dans le monde. Elle est  enregistrée avec des perles, des perles de wampum.
Notre symbole, tout en haut de l'arbre de la Grande Paix, est l'aigle qui voit loin - l'aigle qui, comme nous le disons, protège les enfants.
Nous tenons à partager ce point de vue avec tous les peuples du monde, et en particulier avec les Mapuches, le peuple du Condor. Nous voulons apprendre leur compréhension du monde, et comment ils l’ont enregistré.  Était-ce avec des perles, ou avec une autre forme d'art. Quelle est la vision de la paix mondiale des Mapuche? Comment était elle enregistrée et remémorée?
Nous souhaitons échanger nos formes d'art sur la paix, avec les Mapuches et si tous sont d'accord, partager ces connaissances avec le monde, en commençant en août, dans le Vieux-Montréal.”
-Philip Deering
Pourquoi une collecte de fonds?
Immigrant de souche a besoin de fonds pour deux raisons principales: Pour financer le voyage des artistes participants au Chili et inviter un artiste Mapuche au Canada pour présenter ses oeuvres  au Centre Culturel Ashukan au mois d’août 2015. Il s’agit d’un échange culturel important qui résonne avec toutes les communautés concernées, ainsi que pour poursuivre le mandat de promouvoir les cultures des Premières Nations au Canada et au Chili. Une petite partie des fonds recueillis servira à la production du matériel promotionnel, à l’achat de matériaux pour les œuvres in situ, et pour obtenir un espace au Departamento de Espacio de Arte 44 ainsi que pour les honoraires des artistes chiliens qui participent aux événements Kultrun de la paix à Victoria et à Santiago du Chili. Les artistes seront logés dans les communautés d’accueil, donc aucun financement ne sera nécessaire pour les repas ou l’hébergement.
Ce que vous obtiendrez en échange pour votre don:
$10  - une mention et une bénédiction
$25 - paquet de 5 cartes (Carolina)
$50  - une impression du bateau Immigrant de souche, encadrée
$100 - un collier, fait par Carolina & Agatha
$250  - une pièce unique de medias mixtes par Judith
$500  - une oeuvre perlage Mohawk, de Taion'wesenhtane
$500  - un poème original signé par Roy
$1000 - une sculpture par Carolina
$2000 - une toile originale de Carolina
Christine Brault vit et travaille à Montréal. Artiste interdisciplinaire, selon les contextes elle crée des actions et des interventions in situ, matérielles ou immatérielles, selon un angle poétique, mais engagé et féministe empruntant un regard anthropologique. Diplômée de l’UQÀM avec une maîtrise en arts visuels, boursière du Conseil des arts du Canada, du Conseil des arts et lettres du Québec et d’Engrenage Noir, elle a présenté son travail au Canada, en Europe, en Chine, en Amérique Latine et aux Etats-Unis. Ses actions performatives l’amènent à participer à divers festivals internationaux de performance et résidences d’artiste en République Dominicaine, au Mexique, au Chili, en République Tchèque, à Miami. 
Judith Brisson est une éducatrice et une étudiante au Vermont College of Fine Arts, une défenseur des droits de la personne et artiste multidisciplinaire, elle crée des installations in situ à propos des idées de la paix et la réconciliation. Son écriture a été présentée dans NACLA, Siafu Magazine et The Upstream Journal et sa pratique d'art a été présenté dans The New Quarterly, Hyperallergic, Génération d'idées, ainsi que Les Nouveaux Explorateurs (Canal +). Récemment, Judith a tenté de combler le fossé entre la création artistique et l'activisme par une variété de moyens – des pratiques furtives, pratiques engagées et à des collaborations qui s'engagent avec les autres, tant artistes ou du public, afin de générer de nouvelles idées autour de la création de paix.
Carolina Echeverria est artiste, conteuse et créatrice d’une puissante relation avec les mots, Carolina Echeverría est née à Santiago du Chili. Elle est partie en 1986, se ré-enracinant à Montréal au Québec.
Carolina n’est pas étrangère à la controverse: ses expositions ont toujours défié les normes sociales. Carolina croit au pouvoir qu’a une femme de changer le flux de la perception dans le monde d’aujourd’hui. Une étrangère dans une terre étrangère, elle s’est adaptée à une nouvelle culture tout en protégeant sa vraie personne des politiques qui créent des divisions.
Carolina a travaillé sur une démarche artistique de valeurs culturelles collectives depuis 2010. En tant qu’artiste, elle cherche à faire le lien entre les immigrants et les Premières Nations, à parler de l’espace entre Natif et Immigrant en insérant un trait d’union —le symbole de ce qui nous rapproche, pour préserver l’espace dans lequel le dialogue, la créativité et la véritable guérison peuvent se dérouler.
Philip Deering - Interprète culturel Mohawk, éducateur.
Agata Kozanescka - Chef-couturière
Roy WRIGHT (Tekastiaks)
Compétences (enseignement, écriture, recherche):
astronomie ; histoire de la science ; anthropologie ; (ethno-) histoire ; linguistique (historique, descriptive, appliquée) ; langues : anglais, allemand, suédois, islandais, gothique ; roumain, français, latin, espagnol, italien, portugais ; gaélique, gallois, russe, polonais, serbe, moderne & antique grec, albanais, hittite ; mohawk, huron, tuscarora, abénaquis, micmacs, malécites, odawa, cris, Lakota ; guo yu, nihongo, hongrois, finnois, yiddish, & c. (fluidité varie ; 42 apprise, 63)
Éducation:
Mérite national: Harvard, AB1963cumlaude linguistique & philologie romane; thèse: albanais
Fulbright: Univ. Bucureşti, 1963-5, Româna Academia: diplômes
Cand NDEA Harvard, PhD. 1965-8 (AbD) linguistique; thèse: jésuites Huron-Iroquois
Sincères remerciements à:
Gabriel Antilao
Francisca Pailalleo
Le Consulat Chilien à Montréal
Nadine St-Louis et le Centre culturel Ashukan à Montréal 
Comite de Apoyo al Pueblo Mapuche
John Bead Corp.

story:
Short Summary

Hi! We are Artist Organized Art, a non-profit, 501(c)(3) committed to supporting artist organized media, events and cultural education. We have over 150,000 all time email subscribers and over 5,000 members of our currently decomissioned wiki. Our online community of artists and arts professionals is global, with 44% in North America, 33% in Europe, 23% in Asia and beyond.

We are excited about art, data and collaboration. In 2008 we launched a very crude wiki which allowed our community to sign up and collaborate on pages, upload works, promote projects and cross link to social networks while informing an authoritative following of artist organizers. Our wiki attracted over 5000 editors and was a great resource for raw expressions from all over the world. A wiki is special, because it looks technical and allows for collaboration. Art looks especially anarchic in the wiki container, which also features taxonomy and geo tagging. We want to run the wiki as one big book of art made together!

Because of a growing user base, we've had to upgrade our server. Our current wiki can't migrate. We need to raise a production budget to customize and launch a new wiki script, then open it up to all of you for accounts. We also need to carefully migrate data from the old wiki to the new wiki. It's many days of work, that's why we need to raise a small budget to push this project through.

Please help us with your donation and support our wiki community today. It's a resource you can positively impact that gives you the power to make an impact.

SWITCH TV, New Observations Magazine and Artist Organized Art Online are all programs of Artist Organized Art

What We Need & What You Get

We are raising $3,500.00 to compensate our design and IT workers and to pay for the cost of outreach, for hosting, engineering and bandwith.

Your donations come with some very useful perks. Take full advantage of our newsletter and announcements service in exchange for your support. Our social networks and corporate Youtube channel are also at your disposal for donating. You can literally go global over night. http://get-started.artistorganizedart.org

If we don't reach our entire goal we will apply what we have rasied to the project and run a new campaign to continue financing work until we launch. We are fundraising as a group so you can choose to donate by credit card or by PayPal. All donations to Artist Organized Art are tax deductible under 501(c)(3). Yay!


The Impact

As editors, artists and arts professionals will find a lot to like in the art-wiki. Editors can create substantial entries that rival the scope of wikipedia, but without the fear of deletion. That means almost anything can be included and collaborated. There are social tools, media tools and geographic tools, to name a few.  Everyone will benefit from the collective expression and will be welcomed to add to it. An open art-wiki is a very cool thing to support in today's world.

We have a proven track record. Since 2008 Artist Organized Art has successfully launched a newswire grown to over 150,000 targeted email recipients. We've also been the strategic partner to a nationally syndicated TV show of experimental art with 16 episodes, 28 minutes each (http://switch.artistorganizedart.org ). Having launched a feature articles archive with hundreds of entries, our correspondents have covered major art fairs, gone to the White House, The Venice Biennale, The Cannes Film Festival and many other venues. We also acquired New Observations Magazine with 128 back issues and launched the publication back into print (http://newobs.org ). This all happened while we successfully launched an art-wiki and ran it for over 5,000 editors from cities all over the world. We can handle this re-launch technically, if we can raise the funds.

We have given over $30,000.00 in artist grants since 2012 and have raised over $15,000.00 in crowd funding contributions for partner projects. Your support will go directly into the culture that surrounds you.

Anecdotal response to how Artist Organized Art gets artists out of the studio and into the streets. It's in the audio..

Risks & Challenges

Launching an art-wiki has its challenges, but our Chief Information Officer has led internet startups and worked in Fortune 500 media companies. He is responsible for our Google technology grants and is referenced in a Facebook patent for innovations in social networks.

Artist Organized Art is advised by, followed by & supported by some of the most prestigious independent artists, organizers, curators, historians and institutions in the world including founding members of Fluxus, members of the International Artists Museum and the publishers of New Observations Magazine.

Putting experienced IT at the service of diverse and experimental artists is a win win situation.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please dontate to our campaign and then spread the word. If you can't donate right now, but you are interested and want to support us, spread the word to those who will donate. Here's a short link - http://igg.me/at/artwiki

This is easy to do by using Indiegogo's share tools!

More Links:

http://artistorganizedart.org/commons

http://artistorganizedart.org/bulletins
http://facebook.com/artistorganizedart.org
http://youtube.com/artistorganizedart
http://newobs.org
http://switchtv.artistorganizedart.org
http://wiki.artistorganizedart.org

story:
ART & ME Gallery of Fine Arts announces a competition called "Invisible work". The project aims to settle accompanying art exhibition and media campaign calling for tenders for professional artists in order to raise awareness of the invisible work in our society.

Please support our "Invisible work" project. From the donations 1000 USD amount corresponding to the amount of HUF is the prize of the winning artist and the remaining 500 USD will cover the costs of exhibition organizing, installation, documentation and Indiegogo's commission.

ART&ME is a contemporary gallery combining the advantages of a social enterprise, a public gallery and an artistic meeting point. The primary goal of ART&ME is to bring about a change in people’s attitude to art. Our mission is to take art into your homes as well as into offices, to build bridges between artists and customers, and at the same time to make collecting pieces of art an experience.


Az ART&ME Galéria képzőművészeti pályázatot hirdet „Láthatatlan munka” címmel. A pályázat célja képzőművészeti pályázat kiírása  professzionális képzőművészeknek, kiállítás rendezése kísérő médiakampánnyal abból a célból, hogy felhívjuk a figyelmet a társadalmunkban láthatatlan munkát végzőkre. Tegyük láthatóvá a láthatatlan munkát!

Mi is az a láthatatlan munka?

Forrás: Infotandem

Ha a környezetetekben van olyan, aki láthatatlan (vagyis fizetetlen) munkát végez, beteget ápol, gyermeket nevel, idős embert gondoz, önkéntes munkát végez, háztartást vezet, akkor támogassátok akár egy dollárnak megfelelő forintösszeggel a  társadalmi célú LÁTHATATLAN MUNKA pályázatunkat.  Itt tudjátok támogatni már 280 forinttal, (vagy egy megosztással).

Minden év áprilisának első keddje világszerte a láthatatlan munka napja. A Kanadából indult kezdeményezés célja, hogy elismerjék azt az értékes és pótolhatatlan munkát, amelyet sokan végeznek a gyermekek, idős, beteg vagy fogyatékossággal élő családtagok gondozásával, továbbá önkéntesként civil szervezetekben, helyi közösségekben. Egy felmérés szerint az ilyen munka becsült értéke eléri a GDP egynegyedét, jelentős mértékben járul hozzá a gazdaság fenntartásához, a munkaerő megújulásához, a fiatalok felneveléséhez, erősíti a generációk közötti együttműködést és szolidaritást, tehermentesíti az állami intézményrendszert. A pályázat és a kiállítás célja, hogy felhívja a figyelmet erre a keveset tematizált jelenségre, és annak fontosságára, hogy a társadalom ismerje el az ilyesfajta tevékenység erkölcsi és anyagi értékét. El kell érni, hogy az ezeket a feladatokat ellátókat ne tekintsük inaktívnak, hogy megszüntessék a sok országban őket érő diszkriminációt, hogy megbecsüljék azokat, akik csendben, nem látványosan dolgoznak a családban és egyéb, a társadalmat átszövő közösségekben.


Az ART&ME Galéria és Élménytér kortárs galériaként ötvözi egy társadalmi vállalkozás, egy közösségi galéria és egy képzőművészeti találkozóhely előnyeit, szeretnénk megváltoztatni az emberek képzőművészethez való viszonyát. Galériánk küldetése, hogy bevigyük a képzőművészetet az otthonok és a munkahelyek falai közé, hidat építsünk a képzőművész és a vásárló között, közben élménnyé tegyük a mecenatúrát, társadalmi kérdésekre felhívjuk a figyelmet a művészet eszközeivel.

Részletes pályázati kiírás: Láthatatlan munka pályázati kiírás

A pályázat zsűrije:

Drozdik Orsolya – képzőművész, Dr. habil DLA Magyar Képzőművészeti Egyetem

Dr. Czafrangó János – Erste Bank Hungary Zrt. Good.bee program vezetője

Kopeczky Róna – művészettörténész, kurátor, acb Galéria

Szép Péter – műgyűjtő (RIP)

Projektterv vázlat:

1. Képzőművészeti pályázat előkészítés és kiírás

2. Bírálati időszak, eredményhirdetés

3. Kiállítás összeállítása, installálás

4. Kampány (integrált online, offline)

5. Megnyitó esemény és eredményhirdetés

6. Follow up, kiállítás további helyszínek bevonásával

Ütemezés és kapcsolódó programok

2015. március 15 - április 6. Előkészítés

április 7. Láthatatlan munka nap pályázati kiírás publikálása

május 1. pályázatok beérkezési határideje

május 1 - 7. bírálati szakasz

május 1 - 19. kiállításszervezés

május 19. kiállításmegnyitó és ünnepélyes erdményhirdetés, a támogatói díjak kiosztása, Ericsson Galéria, Budapest

június 15-21. kiállítás 2. állomása: Telekom Székház

május 1. és 3. munka ünnepe (láthatatlan munka témájú sajtómegjelenések) és anyák napján kampánycsúcspont a fizetetlen női munka fókuszba állításával

Kérjük támogassa "Láthatatlan munka" projektünket. A befolyó támogatási összegből 1000 USD-nek megfelelő forintösszeget a nyertes képzőművész díjazására, 500 USD-t kiállításszervezésre, installálásra, dokumentációra és az Indiegogo jutalékra szeretnénk felhasználni.

English Summary

ART & ME Gallery of Fine Arts announces a competition called "Invisible work". The project aims to settle accompanying art exhibition and media campaign calling for tenders for professional artists in order to raise awareness of the invisible work in our society.

Please support our "Invisible work" project. From the donations 1000 USD amount corresponding to the amount of HUF is the prize of the winning artist and the remaining 500 USD will cover the costs of exhibition organizing, installation, documentation and Indiegogo's commission.

ART&ME is a contemporary gallery combining the advantages of a social enterprise, a public gallery and an artistic meeting point. The primary goal of ART&ME is to bring about a change in people’s attitude to art. Our mission is to take art into your homes as well as into offices, to build bridges between artists and customers, and at the same time to make collecting pieces of art an experience.
story_txt:
ART & ME Gallery of Fine Arts announces a competition called "Invisible work". The project aims to settle accompanying art exhibition and media campaign calling for tenders for professional artists in order to raise awareness of the invisible work in our society.
Please support our "Invisible work" project. From the donations 1000 USD amount corresponding to the amount of HUF is the prize of the winning artist and the remaining 500 USD will cover the costs of exhibition organizing, installation, documentation and Indiegogo's commission.
ART&ME is a contemporary gallery combining the advantages of a social enterprise, a public gallery and an artistic meeting point. The primary goal of ART&ME is to bring about a change in people’s attitude to art. Our mission is to take art into your homes as well as into offices, to build bridges between artists and customers, and at the same time to make collecting pieces of art an experience.

Az
ART&ME Galéria képzőművészeti pályázatot hirdet „Láthatatlan munka” címmel. A
pályázat célja képzőművészeti pályázat kiírása  professzionális képzőművészeknek, kiállítás rendezése kísérő médiakampánnyal abból a célból, hogy felhívjuk a figyelmet a társadalmunkban láthatatlan munkát
végzőkre. Tegyük láthatóvá a láthatatlan munkát!

Mi is az a láthatatlan munka?


Forrás: Infotandem
Ha a környezetetekben van olyan, aki láthatatlan (vagyis fizetetlen) munkát végez, beteget ápol, gyermeket nevel, idős embert gondoz, önkéntes munkát végez, háztartást vezet, akkor támogassátok akár egy dollárnak megfelelő forintösszeggel a  társadalmi célú LÁTHATATLAN MUNKA pályázatunkat.  Itt tudjátok támogatni már 280 forinttal, (vagy egy megosztással).
Minden
év áprilisának első keddje világszerte a láthatatlan munka napja. A Kanadából
indult kezdeményezés célja, hogy elismerjék azt az értékes és pótolhatatlan
munkát, amelyet sokan végeznek a gyermekek, idős, beteg vagy fogyatékossággal
élő családtagok gondozásával, továbbá önkéntesként civil szervezetekben, helyi
közösségekben. Egy felmérés
szerint az ilyen munka becsült értéke eléri a GDP egynegyedét, jelentős
mértékben járul hozzá a gazdaság fenntartásához, a munkaerő megújulásához, a
fiatalok felneveléséhez, erősíti a generációk közötti együttműködést és
szolidaritást, tehermentesíti az állami intézményrendszert. A pályázat és a
kiállítás célja, hogy felhívja a figyelmet erre a keveset tematizált
jelenségre, és annak fontosságára, hogy a társadalom ismerje el az ilyesfajta
tevékenység erkölcsi és anyagi értékét. El kell érni, hogy az ezeket a feladatokat
ellátókat ne tekintsük inaktívnak, hogy megszüntessék a sok országban őket érő
diszkriminációt, hogy megbecsüljék azokat, akik csendben, nem látványosan
dolgoznak a családban és egyéb, a társadalmat átszövő közösségekben.



Az ART&ME Galéria és Élménytér kortárs galériaként ötvözi egy társadalmi vállalkozás, egy közösségi galéria és egy képzőművészeti találkozóhely előnyeit, szeretnénk megváltoztatni az emberek képzőművészethez való viszonyát. Galériánk küldetése, hogy bevigyük a képzőművészetet az otthonok és a munkahelyek falai közé, hidat építsünk a képzőművész és a vásárló között, közben élménnyé tegyük a mecenatúrát, társadalmi kérdésekre felhívjuk a figyelmet a művészet eszközeivel.
Részletes pályázati kiírás: Láthatatlan munka pályázati kiírás

A pályázat zsűrije:
Drozdik Orsolya –
képzőművész, Dr. habil DLA Magyar Képzőművészeti Egyetem
Dr. Czafrangó
János – Erste Bank Hungary Zrt. Good.bee program vezetője
Kopeczky
Róna – művészettörténész, kurátor, acb Galéria
Szép
Péter – műgyűjtő (RIP)

story:
My name is Marian Petrovici and I am an orthodox priest and painter of Byzantine religious icons.

The project that I propose is one for the soul:

„The Religious Icon – Warmth and Light of the Heart”

             Byzantine church icons are wooden objects painted with religious scenes, saints, the Holy Virgin or Jesus Christ, the Saviour. Their purpose in to bring us closer to God. As we have strong feelings when looking at the picture of somebody dear to us, in the same way icons touch the soul of those who pray or meditate. By respecting the icons, we respect those who are represented there in a symbolic way. The wood of the icon is only a support.

The icon painting is a century-long tradition of the Church, dating back to the times of the Holy Apostles. Saint Luke the Evangelist himself  was the first who painted the Holy Virgin. It is from him that we inherited this gift through the Church and we are bound to hand it down to the generations to come.


   

In the spirit of the above-mentioned ideas, I initiated a project by which I intend to make a professional tutorial presenting in detail all the phases of Byzantine icon painting. Namely: preparing the wood, ground coating, drawing, gold application, painting of the saint and varnishing the icon.

     


How will the funds be used?

How will the funds be used?

-Materials needed in order to paint an icon will be bought: lime wood, brushes, paints, 23.75 karat gold leaf, varnish.

-The film will be edited and DVDs will be written.

      


What do we offer for your generosity?

1.  For 5$, 10$, 15$, we assure you of all our gratitude and of the fact that your name will be listed on the page of our site, with the other financial supporters.

http://icoane-mozaic.weebly.com/thanks-page.html

2.  For  25$we assure you of all our gratitude and of the fact that your name will be listed on the page of our site, with the other financial supporters.

http://icoane-mozaic.weebly.com/thanks-page.html

3.  For 50$, you will receive what is mentioned at number 1  and a DVD with „The Religious Icon – Warmth and Light of the Heart”

4.  For 100$, you will receive what is mentioned at number 3, as well as a hand-painted icon, size 10/15 cm, with a saint of your choice

Example:
http://icoane-mozaic.weebly.com/sfantul-vasile-...

5.  For 200$ you will receive the things mentioned at number 3. and a hand-painted icon, sizes 20/30 cm, with a saint of your choice.
Example:
http://icoane-mozaic.weebly.com/sfantul-vasile-cel-mare.html

6.  For 300$ you will receive the things mentioned at number 3. and a hand-painted icon, sizes 30/40 cm, with a saint of your choice.
Example:
http://icoane-mozaic.weebly.com/sfantul-vasile-cel-mare.html

7.  For 500$ you will receive the things mentioned at number 3. and a hand-painted icon, sizes 40/60 cm, with a saint of your choice.
Example:
http://icoane-mozaic.weebly.com/sfantul-vasile-cel-mare.html

8.  For 800$ you will receive the things mentioned at number 3. and a hand-painted icon, sizes 50/70 cm, with a saint of your choice.
Example:
http://icoane-mozaic.weebly.com/sfantul-vasile-cel-mare.html

9.  For 1000$ you will receive the things mentioned at number 3. and a hand-painted icon, sizes 60/90 cm, with a saint of your choice.
Example:
http://icoane-mozaic.weebly.com/sfantul-vasile-cel-mare.html

10.  For 1500$ you will receive the things mentioned at number 3. and a hand-painted icon, sizes 60/90 cm, with a religious scene: the Holy Trinity, the Annunciation, the Resurrection of our Lord, the Birth of our Lord, etc.

11.  For 600 $ you will receive the things mentioned at number 3. and the hand-painted icon, sizes 30/40 cm, used as study object in the tutorial, signed by the icon painter with a dedication. 

    


With God’s help and with your help, I have the hope that we will do a benefficial thing both for the mind and for the soul. The icons which you will receive will be small but efficient windows towards the spiritual, towards God. Weather you will choose to keep it  in your house, or to offer it as a gift at a baptism or a wedding, the icon will be the warmth and light of the soul in this world, which tends to become every day colder and darker.

                                                       

We thank you and we assure you that we will have you in our prayers.

God bless you!

story:
VIA CRUCIS (the Moving Altarpiece)

Hello all, my name is Marzia Ellero Ransom. I am an Italian artist living and working in the beautiful Pensacola, Florida. I have created art for as long as I can remember, and I was able to follow my dreams by pursuing an artistic career. Even though I am primarily a painter, my fascination with different mediums has led me to investigate disparate subject matters.

I grew up in the North-East of Italy where I was accustomed to visit museums and beautiful churches filled with timeless and breathtaking works of art.  My dream was to become an artist and create art that would spark profound emotions in the heart of the viewer. I have been interested in historical subject matters for several years now, and in 2008 I began working on a large project called Deificatio. This has been quite an extraordinary journey. For reference, throughout the project, I studied the Bible, the Apocrypha, and other ancient texts. The result was a stunning collection of black and white photographs of specific biblical characters who were martyred, persecuted, or otherwise raptured, depicted by various models suspended and bound with ropes.

Deificatio took two years to complete, and was a success. I knew then, however, that I wanted to continue this journey and create additional works to complement the cycle of memorable photographs. I set out to create a video; a layered compilation of moving images representing the Lamentation and Pietá. However well received, the video is representative of a mere sketch of what my mind has conceived during these years of investigation. This new project, Via Crucis (the Moving Altarpiece), is a piece depicting the Crucifixion, Deposition, and Lamentation of Christ, referencing some of my favorite works of art from the late Medieval period. The Via Crucis (the Moving Altariece) will define a necessary transition in my artistic achievement as well as my passion for research. Because of the extent of my vision, a professional cinematic crew needs to be involved in the process, and only with your generous contribution the Via Crucis (the Moving Altarpiece) can become a reality, allowing me to continue expanding my research and my art making career. 

I have began exhibiting consistently since 2005, and my work has been shown in United States as well as Italy and Costa Rica. My work has been collected and appreciated for sometime now, and I believe this project to be a crowning moment in my career. In the past, I have developed several artistic projects, and managed large groups of people in order to achieve the desired results. In all, I believe this project to be most valuable in regards to the actualization of a historical subject matter that has been developed throughout the history of the arts. The contemporary spin given will definitely be appealing to different generations of artists and viewers.

Video making is a very expensive art form. Understanding its machinery, its complexity, and every quiver of its beating heart is key to the creation of a meaningful work of art that is also professionally presented. In the eventuality my project does not meet the required amount, I will be working towards a smaller version of the video, using less materials and re-dimensioning the crew needed to create the work of art.

Based on the given budget, the sum needed to fund the video production, and make this dream a reality is that of $22,922.  The artists involved in the realization of my dream, fellow researchers, and the actors who will have to endure hours of bonding and lifting, will all need to be paid for their troubles, not to mention production cost, as well as the cost of labor; I have detailed the currant budget with all these factors in mind down below.

Here is the budget:

CAMERA:

Sony NEX-FS700U camcorder $150.00 per 4 days = $600.00

Zeiss 35mm CP2 lens $45.00 per 4 days = $180.00

Zeiss 50mm CP2 lens $55.00 per 4 days = $220.00

Zeiss 85mm CP2 lens $55.00 per 4 days = $220.00

Marshall 7” Monitor $60.00 per 4 days = $240.00

Birnsgear slate w/clapper $8.00 per 4 days = $32.00

Sony 21.5 LCD monitor $115.00 per 4 days = $460.00

KanexPro 25' HDMI cable $10.00 per 4 days = $40.00

Manfrotto tripod mode 546B $25.00 per 4 days = $100.00

Manfrotto bowl mount Hercules head $25.00 per 4 days = $100.00

Gemini unit $115.00 per 4 days = $460.00

X-rite Color Checker Passport $5.00 per 4 days = $20.00

Sony 128 GB XQD memory card $22.00 per 4 days = $88.00

Metabones Canon EF to E Adapter $12.00 per 4 days = $48.00

Benro A373Ftripod w/S8 head $35.00 per 4 days = $140.00

AUDIO:

Audix pre-polarized condenser microphone $8.00 per 4 days = $32.00

K-Tek Avalon boom pole w/ XLR cable $5.00 per 4 days = $20.00

Pearstone DLX universal shock mount $1.00 per 4 days = $4.00

Rycote 18cm softie front only $4.00 per 4 days = $16.00

DOLLY/CRANE:

Cineslider 5 ft w/all-terrain feet $40.00 per 4 days = $160.00

Cineslider motor and mount $22.00 per 4 days = $88.00

Oracle controller and cables $18.00 per 4 days = $72.00

Cineslider battery pack and power cords $0.00

Revolution motion control head $55.00 per 4 days = $220.00

LIGHTING:

Arri Heavy Duty Case for Arrilite 2K Kit

Arri 650 Watt Plus Tungsten Fresnel $20.00 per 4 days = $80.00

Arri 300 Watt Plus Tungsten Fresnel $15.00 per 4 days = $60.00

Arrilite 750 Plus fresnel $22.00 per 4 days = $88.00

Arri AS-01 Lightweight Light Stand 8.5' $3.00 per 4 days = $12.00

Silver Avanger mountain stand w/boom $10.00 per 4 days = $40.00

Black Avanger mountain stand w/boom $8.00 per 4 days = $32.00

Luxbanx Duo Softbox (16 x 22”) $6.00 per 4 days = $24.00

Gel set (random rolls and squares) $3.00 per 4 days = $12.00

Kino Flo barfly w/mounts model BAR-400D $60.00 per 4 days = $240.00

Sekonic Flash Master light meter $25.00 per 4 days = $100.00

ELECTRIC:

Stinger 100 ft 14G 15A $18.00 per 4 days = $72.00

Stinger 50 ft 14G 15A $12.00 per 4 days = $48.00

Stinger 25 ft 16G 15A three way $6.00 per 4 days = $24.00

Surge protector $2.00 per 4 days = $8.00

Impact D1000 1,000W AC dimmer control $5.00 per 4 days = $20.00

GRIP:

C-stand (1 stand, 1 arm, 1 Knuckle, 1 lolly) $5.00 per 4 days = $20.00

Alligator clips medium (orange) $1.00 per 4 days = $4.00

Sandbag $1.00 per 4 days = $4.00

Shop fan (large) $15.00 per 4 days = $60.00

Davidson Pro 12-foot ladder $15.00 per 4 days = $60.00

PRODUCTION:

Igloo 10 Gallon Seat Top Beverage Dispenser $5.00 per 4 days = $20.00

8-foot plastic table (white) $10.00 per 4 days = $40.00

Onway Sports director chair (green) $5.00 per 4 days = $20.00

Earth Products tall director chair (black) $8.00 per 4 days = $32.00

CREW:

Crew members (filming, sound, light) $200.00 per member, per 4 days = $5,600

Cast members and assistants $2,000.00 total

Editor $150.00 per 4 days = $600

Catering $300.00 per 4 days = $1,200

MATERIAL:

Wings (different sizes) $590.00 total

Sony Camera and lenses $3,000.00

Scaffolding (week rental) $117.00 total

Warehouse rental $500.00 per 4 days = $2,000

Cherrypicker rental $300.00 total

Digital projector $800.00

Harnesses $195.00

Sheets $100.00

Cotton batting $700.00

Ropes $300.00

Pulleys $100.00

¾ in plywood (5 sheets) $175.00

Nails, bolts, screws $100.00

Cordless drill $100.00

Miscellaneous fabric $150.00

Backdrop paper $35.00

Rollei film $80.00

Total $22,922.00

I set out to create a video; a layered compilation of moving images representing the Lamentation and Pietá. However well received, the video is representative of a mere sketch of what my mind has conceived during these years of investigation. This new project, Via Crucis (the Moving Altarpiece), is a piece depicting the Crucifixion, Deposition, and Lamentation of Christ, referencing some of my favorite works of art from the late Medieval period. The Via Crucis (the Moving Altariece) will define a necessary transition in my artistic achievement as well as my passion for research. Because of the extent of my vision, a professional cinematic crew needs to be involved in the process, and only with your generous contribution the Via Crucis (the Moving Altarpiece) can become a reality, allowing me to continue expanding my research and my art making career. 
I have began exhibiting consistently since 2005, and my work has been 
shown in United States as well as Italy and Costa Rica. My work has been
 collected and appreciated for sometime now, and I believe this project 
to be a crowning moment in my career. In the past, I have developed 
several artistic projects, and managed large groups of people in order 
to achieve the desired results. In all, I believe this project to be 
most valuable in regards to the actualization of a historical subject 
matter that has been developed throughout the history of the arts. The 
contemporary spin given will definitely be appealing to different 
generations of artists and viewers. 
Video making is a very expensive art form. Understanding its machinery, its complexity, and every quiver of its beating heart is key to the creation of a meaningful work of art that is also professionally presented. In the eventuality my project does not meet the required amount, I will be working towards a smaller version of the video, using less materials and re-dimensioning the crew needed to create the work of art.
Based on the given budget, the sum needed to fund the video production, 
and make this dream a reality is that of $22,922.  The artists involved 
in the realization of my dream, fellow researchers, and the actors who 
will have to endure hours of bonding and lifting, will all need to be 
paid for their troubles, not to mention production cost, as well as the 
cost of labor; I have detailed the currant budget with all these factors
 in mind down below.

story:
Updates!

Thank you for the support so far.  Keep spreading the word.

We have five videos to enjoy that are part of the YouTube Channel "StoryCrossroads" that can also be seen below.

Besides people like you, we are receiving support from other organizations.  We learned that the Utah Humanities will cover our Translation Services ($1,910) so that Spanish and ASL will also be options when we launch Story Crossroads April 15-16, 2016.

We are collaborating with the city of Fillmore, Utah as well as people like Clive Romney (Utah Pioneer Heritage Arts) and Ken Crossley (EngAGE Utah) to do a Grand Stories Project that has tandem telling with grandparents and grandchildren.  We will then invite some of these grand tellers to Story Crossroads.

In 2016, Life Story Library Foundation is focusing on immigrant and refugee stories that we want to hear on our stage for Story Crossroads.  We are voicing the forgotten of our community in a way that will be unforgettable.  

This gives you a hint of all the behind-the-scene works for what Story Crossroads is all about.  And why we need your help.

Enjoy these other video clips.  Give today!





Summary

This is so huge of an idea I shared with one person about 15 years ago has now grown to a whole community ready to launch Story Crossroads.  

We still need you.

We’re going to launch a six-day World Story Crossroads to celebrate each of the six major continents in 2022.

So why did we say "Story Crossroads: The 2016 Launch"?  That is for Salt Lake Story Crossroads on April 15-16, 2016.  We need to grow into that World Story Crossroads adventure.  

This is a free and open event and we need your help in the giving of this gift.  

We have a place:  the Viridian Event Center.  It’s a Library merged with a Conference Center.  Wrap your head around that.  I will give you a moment.

Yes, what better way to celebrate stories than having a building already dedicated to stories!  This place even has broadcast abilities in and out so we are networking with other universities to pick up the signal of these stories and presentations.  It won't matter where you live. 

So you could enjoy this in your pajamas and sporting fuzzy Big Foot slippers.

Of course, live is best.

We have the people:  80 community members--youth, adults, and seniors--will be featured along with our 50 story artists of different cultures and styles.

We offer free residency programs through school districts, libraries, and other venues so that we can have those community tellers.

We will have pure storytelling as well as any combination of storytelling.

Story and music.

Story and dance.

Story and theatre.

Story and the visual arts.

Story and…well…anything you can imagine.  We are called Story Crossroads.

All those styles of storytelling is nice but what makes it fantastic are the many languages we will hear from the stage even from the first year we launch Story Crossroads in 2016.

We will have English, Spanish and American Sign Language the first years and then add languages through the years. 

And we have a fiscal sponsor:  the Utah Storytelling Guild.  Donations you give to Story Crossroads are tax deductible due to this partnership.  Anything you give through this crowdsourcing campaign is linked to the Utah Storytelling Guild PayPal account.

What We Need

For this crowdsourcing campaign, we will reach $15,000+.

We know that to launch April 15-16, 2016, we need $50,000.  We are not asking $50,000 from you unless you want to write that check and we would praise your name throughout the galaxy plus shower you with the perks (see details on those below).

Then we could plan for a Galactic Story Crossroads instead of a World Story Crossroads.

Let’s focus on 2016.

Here is a rough breakdown of why we will eventually need $50,000 a year to run Story Crossroads:

It should be no surprise that our largest expense is to respect and pay for the talents shared by our 50 professional story artists and 80 community tellers.  Although this could be the first time the community tellers take the stage, we want to pay a small stipend as a thank you to their dedication to the art. 

Covered Cost Covered at $5,000+ value--Normally an event like this has “Facilities” as one of their top expenses.  We are thrilled to have the Viridian Event Center completely covered.  

Our "Media Production" costs are so high due to video and sound recording of all sessions of the main stage event.  With the Viridian Event Center's ability to broadcast, we will then stream live the Story Crossroads event to anyone who would like to pick up the signal for free.  These stories will also be archived and shared with deposition sites such as the Library of Congress.  We love the filming that has already taken place to spread the word of this campaign and for promotional use as we near the April main stage event.  Thank you, Sterling Elliott, for allowing us to do an initial payment and then take some money raised from this crowdsourcing campaign to add that rate.

We also counted "Value of Volunteers" as in-kind service that is part of that $50,000 total.  Easily we could have 100 volunteers (averaging 4-hour shifts at $10.00/hour) that total from helping at outreaches, residencies, and main stage events.  

In September 2015, about 15 librarians will be trained to be master story facilitators through 16-hour courses conducted by experts.  These librarians then will host and teach storytelling residencies offered to the public for free.  This way, besides the storytelling happening in the classroom or after school with the school districts, we can have more youth, adults, and seniors participate with Story Crossroads.  We are not charging these librarians for this intense training yet we are covering the costs of the experts to train those librarians.  This will cost $4,800+ depending on if more librarians are interested in this service.

Covered Cost by Utah Humanities--We are unique that "Translation Services" is a category.  Most events focus on one language and never budget this service.  Some people would argue that one could drive for miles in the United States and not have to worry about other languages.  Yet, we are rich in languages from Spanish to American Sign Language to many more.  We expect about $2,000+ for this area.

What You Get

We have many perks to show how much we appreciate your support.
In fact, the donation of $1.00 is exciting because you are choosing to be an active community member in this movement.  That is why you take part in our "Globe of Fame" page on our website.
We are especially excited when you give $10.00 and give a SHOUT OUT online plus that listing of your glorious name on the "Globe of Fame" page.  If you happen to have a blog, YouTube channel, website, book--something you want to promote--then your SHOUT OUT could veer in that direction that only  a name.
These next levels?  Oh, boy!

Listen to the Story Crossroads Anthem by clicking here.


$45 Level

Autographed CD, Book, or DVD (choose one of six options)

Joseph Sobol, Christopher Agostino, Sam Payne, Clive Romney, Steffani Raff, and Stephen Gashler are some of our featured tellers for the 2016 Story Crossroads


$60 Level

Story Crossroads T-Shirt (regular or lady styles)


$100 Level

Agostino's Custom Art Print (see example, will not be this one)


$165 Level

Laser Engraved Cedar Box (with Story Crossroads logo, holds 30 CDs)


$200 Level

Lunch with Story Artist (meal is on us)

Enjoy this lunch during that April 15-16, 2016 time with one of our featured story artists.  These professionals could be Joseph Sobol, Christopher Agostino, Sam Payne, Clive Romney, Steffani Raff, Stephen Gashler or any other featured teller for the 2016 Story Crossroads.


$300 Level

Video Conferencing with Story Artist (record 30 min., use as wished)

Learn or hang out with one of the 2016 Story Artists for 30 minutes and ask what you always wanted to know.  We have recording options so you can play again that wonderful moment.  These professionals could be Joseph Sobol, Christopher Agostino, Sam Payne, Clive Romney, Steffani Raff, Stephen Gashler or any other featured teller for the 2016 Story Crossroads.


$1,200 Level

Original Song Composed for You

Here is your chance to have a song composed in your honor after taking a 5 -question survey to guide the ever-talented Stephen Gashler in the piece. Receive that finished song recording as well as the sheet music digitally. 


$2,000 Level

Song about You or Relative

Choose Clive Romney or Sam Payne to compose a song about you or a relative. Either one of these talented musicians will interview you by phone or video conferencing to delve deep and research before creating this piece. Receive that song recording as well as the sheet music digitally.


$5,000 Level

One Performance & One Outreach (artist fee covered, you cover and negotiate travel/lodging fees)

Choose any of the featured Story Crossroads story artists and have them give one performance and one outreach at the venue(s) with those fees covered by us. You take care of any traveling/lodging expenses to be negotiated with the story artist.  These professionals could be Joseph Sobol, Christopher Agostino, Sam Payne, Clive Romney, Steffani Raff, Stephen Gashler or any other featured teller for the 2016 Story Crossroads.

Risks & Challenges

Raising $50,000+ every year to run Story Crossroads could sound daunting.  It's a good thing we have consulted with other storytelling events such as the Timpanogos Storytelling Festival, the Weber State University Storytelling Festival, the Cache Valley Storytelling Festival, and the La Crosse Storytelling Festival to understand the budgets required and the possibilities of funding.  These events need more or less the same amount that we need.  Some of these events have been around for 20 or 25 years and still going strong.

Again, this campaign aims for $15,000+ and not that $50,000+ because we know that funding comes from more than one source.  From grants to corporate sponsors to in-kind services, we feel confident we can raise that $50,000+ each and every year.

No matter how the fundraising turns out to be for us, we have our facilities completely covered for those April 15-16, 2016 dates.  Facilities is usually the largest expense for this kind of venture.  We also know many community tellers who would go on stage without any kind of compensation.  Yet, we value our story artists--new to the art to veterans--and strive to show that in how we cover their fees or stipends.

Though you must know that when we had our first Community Planning Meeting in June of 2014, we had 27 people attend who represented civic, education, and arts groups.  Many people are interested and are supporting this cause.

We also received fiscal sponsorship from the Utah Storytelling Guild, a nonprofit committed to inviting all to the art of storytelling.  Besides connecting with their nonprofit status, the Utah Storytelling Guild Board voted unanimously to give us some start-up funds.

Finally, we are doing what seems crazy.  We are offering all the storytelling residencies in the libraries, schools, and other venues for free.  We are offering the entire main stage event of Story Crossroads for free.  We will not receive any ticketing revenue.  Never fear.  The Weber State University Storytelling Festival, an event about 45 minutes north of us, have been doing their 3-day event with 14,000+ crowds for free for years.

Story Crossroads is our gift to the community and to the world.  Be part of the giving.

Other Ways You Can Help

Time is more precious than any amount you can give to Story Crossroads.  Consider if you or someone you know would love to:

·Find funding sources, including grants, private donors, and businesses

·Be a volunteer or intern, for all the little to big projects to make this smoother for everyone

·Connect with marketing avenues, from local to global

·Provide technical expertise, involving social media and ways to efficiently use the Internet

·Offer international contacts, emphasis for traditional and professional storytelling organizations and individuals

Of course, we appreciate any word you can spread about Story Crossroads and about this campaign.  You can use the Indiegogo share tools, too.

story:
¡¡¡MUITO OBRIGADO POR DAR UMA OLHADA NA MINHA CAMPANHA!!!

Investir em arte

Olá galera! Meu nome é Agus e sou faixa azul de uma arte marcial chamada Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu, mas uma de minhas paixões sempre foi a fotografia.

Faz 2 anos, com muito esforço, comprei minha primeira câmara e minha primeira lente, foi assim que comecei a tirar fotos de meus colegas de equipe em competições de BJJ. Percebi que a gente gostava e dava valor a minhas fotos e assim decidi criar uma página no Facebook (Guardeiros BJJ) e publicar as fotos. Hoje somos uma pequena comunidade. (O vídeo que foi postado acima foi gravado e montado por mim)

 Com sua ajuda vou poder:

- Eu sempre tenho dito e o mantenho, uma câmera não faz melhores fotos, mas, se você conta com os conhecimentos precisos, agiliza muito o trabalho e acho que chegou o momento de dar um passo mais e trabalhar com um material profissional, já que meus conhecimentos neste tempo têm avançado muito e poderia obter seu maior rendimento.

- O modelo da câmara e a lente pelas que preciso de ajuda são: Canon 5D Mark III (2.690,00 €) + Canon EF 70-200mm /1:2,8 L IS USM II (2.164,45 €). (este equipo é o que possuem a maioria dos fotógrafos com sucesso no BJJ)

- A dia de hoje, para mim é impossível investir neste material, já que não tenho um objetivo lucrativo de meu trabalho fotográfico. 

-Jamais cobrei aos atletas pelas fotos que eu fiz, mas eu invisto varias horas ao dia tornando-se uma parte importante da minha vida. 

- Neste esporte é muito difícil ter apoio e patrocínio para os propios atletas, imagina como fica complicado para um fotografo.

-As condições para tomar fotos nas competições e nas academias de BJJ são muito ruins, pouca luz, por isso com os materiais que tenho agora preciso forçar muito alguns valores que “estragam” as fotos e baixam muito a qualidade. 

-Hoje em dia vou na maioria das competições nacionais e visito todas as academias que posso, a ajuda de vocês vai refletir em cada uma das fotografias e com isso poderão ter um maior impacto.

-Quando visito uma academia sempre me deram um trato como se fosse da família e é com a publicidade que faço a forma para agradece-lhes.

-Canon EF 70-200 mm / 1:2,8 L IS USM II - EUR 2.164,45

-Canon EOS 5D MARK III - EUR 2.690,00


Thank you for visiting my campaign!

Invest in Art

Hi! My name is Agus and I am a blue belt in a martial art called Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu. However, my other passion has always been photography.

Two years ago I bought my first semi-professional camera and I started to take pictures in BJJ competitions. I noticed that people were appreciating the pictures and I decided to create a Facebook page (Guardeiros BJJ) where I can publish all my photos. (The link above shows a video that was shot and assembled by me).

I have always believed that a better camera, not necesarilly produces better results. However, they do facilitate the work. Therefore I think that it is time to acquire profesional material, so I can take advantage of my photography knowledge.

With your help I can:

Buy a CANON 5D Mark III (€ 2690.00) + Canon EF 70-200mm / 1: 2.8 L IS USM II (€ 2,164.45). (This set has been having the most successful photographers in BJJ)

For me it is impossible to invest in this equipment because I don’t get any financial benefits from the photos. I spend several hours a day working with the photos and this has become an important part of my life.

The light conditions for taking great photos in BJJ competitions and gyms are very bad, with my current camera the potos don’t have the quality that I want to achieve.

I go to many national competitions and visited different gyms on hollidays. Every time I visit a gym, I have been treated like family and I have always been grateful for it. Therefore, after completing the visits, I do free advertisement for the gym with the pictures I take.

-  CANONEF 70-200 mm / 1: 2.8 L IS USM II - EUR 2164.45

-  Canon EOS 5D MARK III - EUR 2690.00

-  Commission 9% campaign (this page) - EUR 436.90

The impact can improve the quality of my work

greater diffusion of our valuable support

Your help is a way to support me and appreciate my work!


¡¡Muchas gracias por visitar mi campaña!! 

Invertir en arte

¡Hola! Mi nombre es Agus y soy cinturon azul de un arte marcial llamado Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu, pero una de mis grandes aficiones siempre ha sido la fotografía. 

Hace 2 años, con mucho esfuerzo, pude comprarme mi primera cámara y mi primer objetivo y con ellos comencé a hacer fotos en competiciones de BJJ a compañeros. Me di cuenta que la gente disfrutaba y valoraba mis fotos y decidí crear una página de Facebook (Guardeiros BJJ) y publicarlas. Hoy somos una pequeña comunidad. (El video de arriba fue grabado y montado por mi)

Con tu ayuda podré:

  • Siempre lo he dicho y lo mantengo, una cámara mejor no hace mejores fotos, pero, si tienes los conocimientos, facilitan mucho el trabajo y creo que ha llegado el momento de lanzarme con material profesional, ya que mis conocimientos fotográficos han avanzado mucho, y podría sacarles el máximo partido. 
  • El modelo de cámara y objetivo para el que pido la ayuda es el siguiente: Canon 5D Mark III (2.690,00 €) + Canon EF 70-200mm /1:2,8 L IS USM II (2.164,45 €). (este equipo es el que tienen la mayor parte de fotógrafos de éxito en BJJ)
  • Hoy por hoy, me resulta imposible invertir en este material por mi mismo, pues no obtengo beneficios de las fotos.
  • Nunca he cobrado a los atletas por las fotos que les hago, Pero le dedico varias horas al día y se está convirtiendo en una parte importante de mi vida. 
  • En este deporte resulta complicado conseguir apoyo y patrocinio para los propios atletas, así que imaginad como se complica para el fotógrafo. 
  • Las condiciones para la fotografía de las competiciones y de los gimnasios de BJJ son muy malas, pues la luz escasea, con el equipo que tengo ahora, tengo que forzar mucho algunos valores que "estropean" las fotos y bajan mucho la calidad.
  • Hoy en dia estoy presente en la mayoría de las competiciones nacionales y visito todos  los gimnasios que puedo, vuestra ayuda se verá reflejada en cada una de estas fotografías y el impacto que estas tengan.
  • Cada vez que he visitado un gimnasio, me han tratado como si fuera de la familia y lo he agradecido siempre en forma de publicidad para el gimnasio.

  • Canon EF 70-200 mm / 1:2,8 L IS USM II - EUR 2.164,45
  • Canon EOS 5D MARK III - EUR 2.690,00
  • Comisión 9% campaña (esta página) - EUR 436,90


El impacto

Con tu ayuda no solo podré mejorar la calidad de mi trabajo, sino que vas a causar un efecto en el mundo del JiuJitsu Brasileño, tanto a nivel nacional, como internacional.

  • A través de las fotos conseguimos una mayor difusion de nuestro valioso deporte y que los atletas y los miembros de esta comunidad puedan tener buenos recuerdos inmortalizados gratuitos.
  • Realmente esto no es un nuevo proyecto, pues el esto lleva en marcha mucho tiempo, pero sí nos va a ayudar a que la difusión y el poder del BJJ sea mayor, llegue más lejos.
  • En las competiciones, soy el primero en llegar y el último en irme. Y el trabajo no termina ahí, pues cada dia invierto al menos una o dos horas en retocar alguna foto y subo contenido a diario. SOLO CONTENIDO CREADO POR MI.
  • Es una forma de apoyarme y valorar mi trabajo!

Riesgos y desafíos

Se que es un proyecto ambicioso al que no puedo hacer frente yo solo, es una muestra de lo que me importa el impacto y la mejora en la comunidad BJJ.
Este equipo me va a permitir hacer realidad muchas ideas, ahora imposibles, que con vuestra ayuda, por muy pequeña que sea, van a hacerlo posible.

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Hoy en día, compartir importa tanto como aportar. Compartelo y ¡¡gracias por leer esto!!

story:
About The Project

Third Space Art Collective is a group of independent artists, performers, and educators striving to further enrich the culture of our community by making the creation and exhibition of art and music accessible to people regardless of age or economic standing.

We emphasize the ideals of DIY philosophy (Do It Yourself): empowering people by providing access to tools, materials, and knowledge necessary to become active participants in their creative community. Another essential aspect of DIY is recognizing the power of creatively repurposing materials which would conventionally be perceived as waste. We also emphasize DIT philosophy (Do It Together) – which acknowledges the benefits of applying DIY ideas to a collaborative group.

Our goal is threefold: One: to maintain a space to be used as a shared and dedicated art studio for collective members. Two: to provide a space where our community members can learn and practice skills and share ideas. Three: to operate a venue where art and music are showcased

What We Need & What You Get

To continue offering these amenities, and to ensure that all of our facilities are completely secure and ADA compliant,  3SPAC is reaching out to our community to cover the maintenance and accessibility costs we could not afford otherwise. After nearly two years of just breaking even on the rent, utilities and insurance, 3SPAC believes that with the crowdfunded support of it’s community to cover these initial costs, 3SPAC can make the necessary improvements to build a sustainable cooperative for the community of Davis and beyond.

The Impact

Art supplies are expensive, studio rentals are expensive, engaging and supportive artistic communities can feel exclusive and impossible to penetrate. 3SPAC strives to strip all of these challenges away, and provide our community the tools necessary to find your creative voice, whether it's through art, music, movement, or community building it needs to find it's creative voice. We are artists helping artists, and now we need your help to realize our dreams and make this the venue for emerging artists, musicians, and community members of Davis!

Other Ways You Can Help

Your financial donations are greatly appreciated but we understand a lot of you are probably starving artists like ourselves. If you can't donate financially please share this around.

Can't support us financially? Volunteer by getting involved with a local collective organization! Third Space Art Collective is 100% volunteer run and is ready and willing for you to come and help shape the face of the organization.

thirdspacedavis.com
facebook.com/thirdspaceartcollective
instagram.com/thirdspaceartcollective

story:
Hello Project Gallery: We Need A New Home!

Hello Project Gallery is a small art gallery in Houston, Texas focused on fostering emerging contemporary artists with a Texas connection.

We started by carving out a gallery space in what was once an art storage room in the back of McMurtrey Gallery on Colquitt St, in the middle of Houston's venerable "Gallery Row". 


In the past year, we have received a tremendous amount of support from the Houston art community - from reviews at Glasstire.com and Arts and Culture Magazine to the hundreds if not thousands of of you that turn out at our opening receptions. 

However, we recently learned that we are losing our current space - after 35 years McMurtrey Gallery's director, Roni McMurtrey, is retiring and closing the doors on one of Houston's oldest and most respected art galleries. 


The time is now! Hello Project Gallery must quickly find a new home and we need your help to raise the emergency capital we need to secure a permanent place for our future!  

Reaching our goal will help us fund our down payment and afford the necessary buildout of our new space, to keep our momentum going, and secure future exhibits that bring fresh talent to Houston! Your contribution will help Hello Project continue highlighting artists from across the state and beyond, programing innovative and exciting exhibitions, public programs, and more!


HPG: What We Need and What You Receive 

In our search for new spaces, we have found some great locations in Houston. We are looking to buy a building to secure a permanent home for the future and we are almost there but need your help to fully finance our down payment and build out our new space!


In exchange for your support, contributors may receive everything from social media shout outs, to HPG swag, to private gallery previews or their name engraved on our Founder's plaque.

In addition, a number of artists have generously contributed their artworks as incentive for your contribution to Hello Project Gallery. Everyone wins! Each artist will be compensated for their work! A portion of your contribution will go directly back to each of the artists.
 


HPG: Perks

Be sure to revisit our page regularly! We will be adding information and perks regularly as our campaign progresses!

Here are a few of the many perks we have to offer:

Hello Project Gallery Baggu Bag*



Custom Full Color All-Over Printed Hello Project Gallery T-shirt*



Angel Oloshove vase*




Heath West
Teen Age Riot, 2015
Stretched and sewn handwoven acrylic and wool fabric, stained pine frame
27 × 17 in.



Michelle Rawlings pigment print on silk*


Paul Kremer
Door (study), 2014
acrylic on canvas
26 x 20 in.




Lane Hagood snake painting*



HPG: Who We Are

Jonathan Hopson
Director


Debra Barrera
Assistant Director



HPG: We Can't Do it Alone

Although we have had a tremendous amount of support and success in our first year, Hello Project Gallery is still a young business and we need your support to take this giant leap forward.  Hello Project needs your help to continue exhibiting artists and curating innovative exhibits! 


HPG: What Happens If We Exceed Our Goal?

All funds that exceed our goal will be set aside to help emerging artists with future exhibitions at Hello Project Gallery. Whether they need a can of paint, a pedestal, or a set of headphones, we want to ensure that emerging artists at Hello Project are able to make their best work in our space!


HPG: Other Ways You Can Help

We know that a lot of our friends are, well, artists! We understand that a monetary contribution may not be the best way you can help out. You can also help us by helping us get the word out to as many people as possible. Use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out on social media and email to link this fund to your friends! 

You can may also be a part of the new Hello Project space by contacting director Jon Hopson about helping with build out tasks like painting or minimal construction. We need all the help we can get, so anything you can do - we appreciate!


HPG: Risks And Challenges

We are looking forward to a long future in Houston and understand that nothing great was built in a day. The space considering will require minor renovations, some permitting and, as always, a well considered curatorial practice to develop a stellar line up of artist exhibitions and events. With such an ambitious project there might be a need for revision, whether born of necessity or creative impulse. We will do our very best to give you - our contributors - the attention you deserve and our small team will personally handle the allocation of all rewards.


*images are meant as representations and do not specifically reflect the final products.

 We know that a lot of our friends are, well, artists! We understand that a monetary contribution may not be the best way you can help out. You can also help us by helping us get the word out to as many people as possible. Use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out on social media and email to link this fund to your friends! 
You can may also be a part of the new Hello Project space by contacting director Jon Hopson about helping with build out tasks like painting or minimal construction. We need all the help we can get, so anything you can do - we appreciate!


HPG: Risks And Challenges
We are looking forward to a long future in Houston and understand that nothing great was built in a day. The space considering will require minor renovations, some permitting and, as always, a well considered curatorial practice to develop a stellar line up of artist exhibitions and events. With such an ambitious project there might be a need for revision, whether born of necessity or creative impulse. We will do our very best to give you - our contributors - the attention you deserve and our small team will personally handle the allocation of all rewards.

*images are meant as representations and do not specifically reflect the final products.

story:
WE WERE SHUT DOWN BY KICKSTARTER WITH NO EXPLANATION AFTER RECEIVING DONATIONS: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/confederateflagco/hand-crafted-confederate-flags-made-in-the-usa

WE WERE NOT VIOLATING ANY OF KICKSTARTER'S RULES AND THEY WILL NOT RESPOND TO OUR INQUIRIES. WE HAVE BEEN FORCED TO MOVE OUR PROJECT TO INDIEGOGO.

In the wake of a recent tragedy, media outlets have been involved in an ongoing smear campaign against the traditions and heritage of the South. Cowardly politicians and retailers have been complicit in this attempt to eradicate not only our history but our way of life.

It's time to fight back. Those who oppose us are endeavoring to silence our voices but it is time to show them we will not be silenced.

The Confederate Flag Company will create high-quality Confederate Flags and Confederate Flag accessories and apparel so that people are allowed the choice to show their dedication to the history of way of life of the South.

We will begin in Fall 2015 by creating high quality Confederate Flags made of heavyweight 2x2-ply mercerized cotton as well as a limited run of Confederate Flag Company Confederate Flag lapel pins. This initial run will be of limited quantity and offered exclusively to our Kickstarter backers.

If we are fully funded at $50,000, we will begin production on these high-quality battle flags right here in the South. The money will be used for our materials - we plan to use 100% locally-sourced cotton grown here in the South. We will establish a production facility and create jobs making these high-quality handmade flags. The remainder of the money will be used for distribution, storage, and advertising.

STRETCH GOAL

We are also proposing a stretch goal of $1,000,000 which would be used to open the Confederate Flag Company flagship store right here in the heart of Dixie - Nashville, Tennessee. There are very high costs associated with opening a storefront, but doing so would allow us to expand our product line to include clothing, lunchboxes, and more.

If Amazon, Target, Walmart and others will not offer the products we desire, maybe it's time for us to open a store of our own. With your support, we may be able to do just that.

story:
With burn camps just around the corner, Kelly Falardeau is looking for individuals, sponsors and corporations that will buy 1, 10, 250, 500 blankets to donate them to burn survivors. "It would be wonderful if someone wanted to adopt a burn camp and give a blanket to every burn child there," Kelly said.

A  soft warm loving blanket can make burn kids feel loved and wanted. They will know there is hope and they are not alone.  Blankets of Love would be very grateful for whatever contribution you can give to help these burn kids.  

Kelly Falardeau's story: 

Imagine this: your children are playing outside, their squeals and giggles of delight comforting to the soul.

Then the pitch changes. Screams of fear and pain. In an instant you are beside the baby, ripping burning clothes off her, not even remembering how you got from the house, not even feeling the flames on your hands.

Kelly Falardeau was just two-years-old when she was burned over 75% of her body. Months of agony in hospital followed – then more hospitalizations every other summer when other kids enjoyed the outdoors. In many ways, Kelly missed a normal childhood. Scar tissue does not stretch or grow like normal skin, so what remaining skin was normal had to be 'cultivated' to replace scar tissue to the degree possible. Every second year to age 20.

But there were still terrible scars. And as if summer hospitalizations weren't enough, the rest of the year in school brought taunts and name-calling from classmates and others.

Such experiences break thousands of children and adults worldwide every year, bringing isolation and depression and, later, so often poverty. In poorer countries small children are sometimes deserted by parents and left to die in hospital.

But not Kelly Falardeau; in adversity she found inner strength. She endured the countless hospitalizations, the bullying, being treated as an oddity. Instead of buckling under the pressure she used it to gain strength most of her tormentors from childhood would never know.

Now, as an international speaker and four-time bestselling author she gives strength and encouragement to other burn victims, helping them to see that what's inside the package is far more valuable than the wrapping.

And now, with her painting, she wants to bring comfort and encouragement to 1,000 burn survivors in the form of blankets decorated with one of her paintings and slogans offering affirmations designed to instill pride in place of despair.

Now a single mother with her own three children, she has her own successful motivational speaking business and travels all over the world sharing her message of “you are loved, you are needed, you are wanted.”

Kelly has known more adversity than most and emerged stronger for it. She teaches others how to do the same.

story:
THE SHOW MUST GO ON

Monoxide is at a critical point.

We have a cash flow problem threatening our immediate future!  The onslaught of recent changes to the company has brought a sudden barrage of unexpected financial demands. We need help NOW to avoid closure within the next month and to rebuild a strong, vibrant and caring circus community. 

This is devastating news for our community who have loved the creativity, fun and friendship that our local professional circus has brought to us for over 15 years. It's hard to think of Wollongong without Circus Monoxide. We have all have watched our kid’s faces light up as they swing in the air, juggle, balance and hoop. We have loved the passion and commitment of our circus trainers, the involvement and interest of our parents. We treasure the non-conformity, the teamwork and the belief that everyone can participate.

Circus provides something unique and special in the landscape of sports and arts in our city. 

Because of this, we all need to band together, invest in circus and keep the space open.

Every donation and fundraiser counts. The company is a not-for-profit organisation so donations are tax deductible.

Yes, it IS possible! This is not the first time the company has gone through difficult times...... and survived! We have strong new leadership, a committed and highly skilled team of trainers, class enrolments are stronger than ever, and our outreach program is expanding. We just need to overcome this major financial bump in the road to become brighter and better than ever.

As we all work together to get over this hump and rebuild from the ground up, both the company and our circus community will grow and flourish.
