story:
We're a crew of really good friends mostly from The San Francisco Bay Area who share a common vision.  After a couple years of going to Burning Man we knew we had to bring something magical to the playa.  And ever since finding that thing, we've poured our hearts into it.  We've collaborated to merge beautiful sound with a truly powerful art piece: a striking 48' tall Pyramid with a DJ Booth at its 12x12' base.  DJs will interact with the crowd through the all-seeing Eye of Horus.  All this comes together to create a truly unique inclusive experience. 



We need about $43K for this project to happen, and we're asking for a little less than half of that.  The rest we've been able to pool together from our immediate community and active fundraising efforts which go on year-round(parties).  The money we raise will go directly to crucial expenses like:

Materials and fabrication ($10,000)

Sound ($15,000)

Power ($5,800)

Laser and Lighting Production ($5,400)

Transportation ($7,000)

*Funds received go ONLY towards the production of the project, NOT towards the camp itself.*

In the past we've always put our heads together and pooled our resources and skill sets to throw killer fundraising parties, because we always wanted to make sure people are getting some value, and that hasn't changed.  This time around our campmates have come together create some really unique perk packages for our contributors, like a couple private rooftop events in Downtown San Francisco with dope DJs, excellent wines, oysters, and more.  We're offering professionally catered Greek feasts for 25 people. And quite a few other great perks.

We really want to make this happen, and as much fun as it is, its not really just about us, its about sharing with everyone.  This is the best gift we know how to give.  We truly believe that this beacon of light and sound acts as an antenna for positive vibrations, and we know this to be true because we've witnessed it in action.  



In 2013 we not only raised the money in 6 weeks, but we actually managed to design and build the initial Kazbah Pyramid and sound stage-in the desert- with virtually zero experience.  But all the right people seemed to pop up at exactly the right times.  A wise man (our friend, artist Robert James), told us going in, "never compromise your vision," but we also knew that building our final product wasn't going to happen our first year.  That's why along with our welder, Sergio Vega, we designed the aluminum frame in a way that we could expanded upon.  This year we called up Sergio about "Phase 2" of The Kazbah Pyramid and he was stoked, but when the first week of July rolled around and we were waiting for word from Burning Man about our placement, we got the news that Serge had a stroke and had slipped into a coma, and sadly just a few days later he passed away.  Serge was the guy that didn't quit, he made it happen on year 1.  He was truly dedicated.  This year we dedicate to him.



With the 11th hour upon us, we stay up late night nights revising the AutoCad designs, consulting with structural engineers, and planning 3 (possibly 4) Fundraiser parties in these 4 short weeks before leaving to The Burn.  We put it all on the line, because that's what you do when you believe in something. 

We hope you can see it too.

If Burning Man has left your pockets empty, please share this with your friends, and check us out at 10:00 & Arcade in Black Rock City for some great vibes, great tunes and a fresh drink!  Follow us online at Facebook.com/thekazbah to stay up to date with our fundraising parties, future designs & fabrications and with the latests from our resident DJ's.

THANK YOU!

THANK YOU!

story:
My name is Sami and I am creating Detroit’s first portable art supply, Jivehouse. I am an artist on a mission to change the way other artists get their supplies.  

                                      


 I have been enamored by the world of graffiti and street art since I was younger and wanted to create something that would give back to the subculture I grew so fond of. Creating an art supply was the solution I came up with to help out not just graffiti or street artists but all artists. I didn’t want to just open a store that sold art supplies. I wanted to create something more, something better than what is already out there. One of the biggest challenges was finding a location; nothing I found fit for what I wanted to do. Then my super smart and amazing wife suggested “what if we put it in a truck”?  

               

                                                       (not the actual truck)

Brilliant! Since then, we have been working towards making this dream a reality and are asking you to help us.

Jivehouse will be Detroit’s first portable art supply. My goal is to make art supplies more accessible and affordable for artists so they can focus on creating, rather than juggling their time between school and/or work to try and make it to the art supply before they close. To do this, I’m combining the convenience and awesomeness of a food truck with an art supply. We will offer a very diverse selection of supplies from brands artists know and trust. In addition to being an art supply, the truck will function as a mobile mural featuring work form local artists on a rotating schedule. But we need your help to make this happen.

Asking strangers to donate their hard earned money over the internet is tough, but what if I told you those few bucks you were gonna spend on a latte or a new shirt could change people’s lives. Think about it. If everybody donated a little and helped this project to get going, it would affect the lives of working artists and the community they live in by offering better and more affordable options for them. 


What We Need & What You Get

We’re asking for $40,000. All of this goes towards getting this idea up and running with a strong start.

$7-10K for a step-van

$2-3k for outfitting the truck inside and out to be a store.

We will need to maximize the limited space inside the truck and keep it easy to move around. We would like to use lightweight yet sturdy materials for the shelving. Installing the electric work such as lighting is also necessary; using solar panels would be ideal but are always looking for a cost efficient way to power the truck while keeping it as green as possible.

$10-15k for inventory

Inventory is a very large expense. Our aim is to have enough inventory on hand

$5k advertising, marketing, promotion

$3-4k working capital

$3k Indiegogo fees

If we don’t reach our goal, it’s not the end of the world because we’re still pushing through. We will just have to adjust. We can’t let ourselves or everyone rooting for us down.

Perks

$1 an emailed thank you for your support!

$5 your name listed as a supporter on the website

$20 a Jivehouse T-shirt and the previous two rewards

$30 Limited edition hand made spray can plushie

$30 Limited edition spray can dog toy

$50 a JIVEHOUSE screen print designed by The Heavenly Dogs art Collective

$100 your name will be put on the actual truck as a supporter (limited to 10)

$200 a piece of artwork created by a detroit local

$500 prize pack full of art supplies and previously mentioned rewards

$2000 we will drive out and cater an event in the truck along with previous rewards provided to the pledger (Michigan only limited to 3)

The Impact

With your contribution, you’re taking part in creating a new and exciting way for artists to get their supplies. Art is one of our strongest tools for social change. We change entire communities with it, we engage and inspire our youth with it, and we surround ourselves with it to give our lives meaning and purpose. You can be a part of that change and help artists by helping us.

Detroit’s art scene is exploding right now with no signs of letting up. World renowned artists are paying closer attention to Detroit. Shepard Fairey had even decided to do the largest mural in his career here. This means many opportunities for our own local artists and our city as a whole. The creative economy attracts all sorts of people from around the country and even the world. This benefits everyone in our city and help's bring change to Detroit on our own terms.

Risks & Challenges

As with anything, there are always risks and challenges. Thankfully, we have been able to meet every challenge with a solution and am certain we will be able to handle anything the future can throw at us.

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for taking the time to check us out. We can't do it without you. We hope you feel inspired to join us on our journey, even if you don't have the dollars to donate, donating a few minutes of your time would be just as helpful. Below is a list of how you can help.

  • Make some noise and get the word out about us!
  • Use the IndieGoGo share tools
  • Follow us on social media and keep up to date with what we're doing.
  • Tell your local news outlets about us

story:
Short Summary

My name is Samantha A. Christian. I am a 31 year old entrepreneur with a deep passion for art and the joy it can bring to people's lives. I finished college, got my Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, got my Master's Degree in Clinical psychology, and did well as a professional gamer,  but something was still missing. I needed a creative outlet. Something unique in my life that I could express myself while bringing joy to other people through my creations. That was when I had the idea to make Premium Puzzles.  I have completed over seven 3000pc puzzles in 1 year and professionally framed 3 of them. Looking at them I thought that this would make a great business idea. I love the way they came out and want to share them with the world.  I have always considered finished puzzles as an artform. There is just something unique about completed puzzles that allows a deeper appreciation of the image. Please help me spread the word about this underappreciated artform. Together we can share the brilliance of high quality framed finished puzzles with the world! 

This is the 3rd 3000pc puzzle I completed and framed. Doesn't the frame make all the difference? 

What We Need & What You Get

At Premium Puzzles everything we do is of premium quality from the quality of the puzzles, to the puzzle saving techniques, framing and especially customer service. Here is my dilemma. I am very good at completing puzzles, better than the average person anyway. I finish them pretty quickly but I don't have the funds to get each of them custom framed. I don't want to put junky frames on these puzzles. Only the highest quality frames. I will not settle for less! This is where I need your help. I need at least $2000 dollars to get the other 3000pc puzzles professionally framed. Each 3000pc puzzle is 48 X 32 inches, which is very expensive to custom frame. I actually want all my puzzles professionally framed but the 3000pc ones are of top priority. If I cannot reach my funding goal then I will get some of the smaller 1000pc puzzles framed instead. If I don't have enough to frame the 1000pc ones I will use whatever funds raised to spread the word about Premium Puzzles and puzzles as art & decor. For a new business and revolutionary product I definitely need a significant advertising budget.  Any contributions will also go to a new laptop. My personal laptop is so old. Since I am starting a new business I will definitely need to upgrade my tech. 

This is my favorite 3000pc puzzle I completed that needs a frame. 

I have completed over 17 puzzles so far. 7 of them are 3000pc, 2 of them 1500pc, and the rest 1000pc. There are many perks of supporting Premium Puzzles. Depending on how much you contribute you will get a unique look into my work studio where I complete the puzzles and watch me put them together in action. You might also get one of the limited edition 1000pc puzzles I just completed as a show of thanks. If you contribute over 50USD I will make a puzzle of any image you want, complete it for you and send it on your way! How cool is that? ^__^ Other perks include inside updates, a handwritten thank you, a personalized smilebox, a chance to interview me (I will answer honestly), and a chance to meet me, see my puzzle studio and I will show you around town.

A 1000pc cat shaped puzzle. Aren't they cute? :3 

The Impact


This is my only creative outlet. I cannot draw, or paint, or sculpt or write music or take photographs. Putting puzzles together and making them more sophisticated is the only thing I can do and do well. This is my art. The only creation I can make that can bring joy to people's lives. This is why your help is so important. Not only are you helping to bring a new artform to the world, you are sending a message. A message to all other non-artists like me that we can do something creative. That we can create something brilliant that people will love even without having artistic talents. That the art is in their process, their vision, their passion. By helping me make Premium Puzzles a successful business, you inspire a whole population to be their best and be proud of who they are.

You will help me bring my revolutionary artform to people all over the world. This is whole new artform, an entirely different way of seeing and appreciating jigsaw puzzles. They make fabulous wall decor that anyone of all ages can appreciate. I want this to become one of the top 3 artforms alongside paintings and photography.  I cannot do this alone. I need you. 

Another 3000pc that needs a frame. 

Risks & Challenges

I think I am better at completing puzzles than the average person. This means I finish them faster, which means I have more inventory to stock and frame (each with its own costs). It will be an uphill battle but I hope this business can really take off so that I can cover the framing costs on my own. If there is any point where I don't have enough to frame a puzzle I will save up until I can frame it. Another thing, people don't know about puzzles as art & decor. Even when I complete and frame a puzzle, who will buy them if people do not know that my products exist? How will I cope with increasing inventory if none of them are bought? Even if you cannot contribute any funds, you can help spread the word about Premium Puzzles and puzzles as art & decor! I am trying to set up business relationships with custom framing companies, and advertising any place I can to help get the word out. I am also trying to connect with HGTV and Houzz to really promote puzzles as decor. Even if you own your own business or have an office, decor really sets the mood. Why not get a finished puzzle that matches your taste and your business' vibe? No matter what happens, I will try my best to overcome any challenge I may face. I do have many ideas. I am sure I can think of a solution, not matter what the challenge is. :)

Other Ways You Can Help

As always you can help spread the word about Premium Puzzles or even just finished puzzles as decor. When people think of ways to decorate their home or office, finished puzzles don't come to mind. Help me change that! Spread the word!
https://www.etsy.com/shop/PremiumPuzzles

I am also looking to ultimately build my own website. If you have any tips or recommendations please let me know. 

I also need funds to buy a new laptop/tablet for my business. I have been using my personal computer. If you have any recommendations for which ones are best for business use, let me know.

story:
Imagine a beautiful and eclectic art studio featuring quality body arts like decorative and cosmetic tattooing, life casting, the healing arts of esthetics and manicuring, intuitive arts like Tarot and astrology and featuring the crafts of local artisans all set in the hills of western Massachusetts on the scenic Mohawk Trail in Shelburne. 

A haven for anyone seeking the creative unique talents of being human, Sybil's Leaf will offer seekers a safe and luxurious haven in which to receive a quality tattoo, permanent make-up, intuitive card reading, a life cast or a place to simply browse the ideas and input of an artists mind in the comfort of a beautiful, welcoming studio.


Services provided include;

Decorative & Cosmetic Tattooing 

Reba has been practicing the craft of tattooing since 1992. She's owned and operated two different tattoo studios where  she was head artist and body piercer. She's worked with and for dozens of incredible tattooers all over the country.  With over 20 years experience in the craft of tattooing and certification in advanced esthetics, Reba is the most qualified skin practitioner in Franklin County. For more information about her tattoo biography and to view her portfolio please visit her website, www.sybilsleaf.com

Life Casting

Working with alginate and plaster, Reba can create a mold then cast virtually anything! Have your face, hands, pregnant belly or feet cast to live a lifetime frozen in time! 

Oracle Readings

Reba has been a reader of many oracles since she was a child. She specializes in Tarot cards and considers herself a master reader. She enjoys listening to people and strives to help them find solace and guidance in the cards. 

Services by Donation 

The healing arts of esthetics, manicuring and pedicuring will be offered by donation. You may request facials, waxing, manicures & pedicures by appointment and make a suggested donation before receiving your service. 50% of all donations go into Reba's daughter's savings account to be used for her education and the other 50% will be donated to organizations that help animals.

Campaign needs

Acquiring the space at 1105 Mohawk Trail in Shelburne falls incurred the overwhelming costs of starting a business. Although Reba has everything needed to start tattooing as soon as possible  financial resources have been exhausted while we wait for the town inspectors to allow us to open. There are many items that the studio still needs to reach it's fullest potential in serving the community and we need your help!. 

Why you should support this Campaign

Sybil's Leaf provide's  a clean, creative space needed for a single parent to produce several artistic services in which to sell and make a living. Sybil's Leaf is an important addition to the tattoo industry being that Reba is highly educated as a certified aesthetician; a skin specialist. This is especially important today when tattoo studios are opening everywhere, employing practitioners with little or no experience. Sybil's Leaf provides the community with an alternative to these parlors and a place to have botched tattoos repaired under the caring hand of a seasoned artist. It's important because it will provide a space to fully utilize many artistic potentials and participate in the community as an economic, cultural and healthy asset. 

Sybil's Leaf will provide artistic services and inspiration for everyone who walks through the doors. Compassionate, spiritual, experienced and playful, Reba will strive to make a positive, nurturing impact on everyone who seeks her services. 

Sybil's Leaf will also provide a beautiful retail space for local artisans to sell their quality crafts and art from the studio. 

Sybil's Leaf is a harbor for creativity and a life sustaining force for a small family and a necessary addition to a creative and supportive community.

Please donate now and help Sybil's Leaf reach her fullest potential!

Thank you for considering this campaign for your support. If you can't contribute financially please consider the barter system. The studio can use many items that Reba is willing to barter her services for. 

Please, take a moment to pass this link on to folks who might be interested in this campaign.

Blessed Be.

Sybil's Leaf

story:
Short Summary

GA3 is back at it and this time we are smarter, stronger and all around better!  Better men, better students of life and better artists.  The growth of "Christian Hip Hop" since we've started making music has been unbelievable.  You see artists like LeCrae, Dee-1, Andy Mineo, Jin and so many others making great strides and while we'd love to be listed along with them, the truth is who knows?  All we know is that we love music, we love Jesus and we want to make it known to the world.

This is where YOU come in!  In order to make great music that glorifies the Most High and also competes with what so many of our young people are listening to, it takes money.  We serve an awesome God and we want to make Him known to the world, but He deserves our very best and GA3 wants to bring quality.  Quality in production, sound, packaging, promotion, etc.  

What We Need & What You Get

$5,000 is our goal and we are confident that with YOUR help we will reach it.  These funds will go towards the following: 
-Packaging: in the past we would all sit around and literally burn 100's of CD's and package them ourselves.  Needless to say the result wasn't as nice as something you would buy in the store.  CD duplications and packaging is a must! 
-Promotion: in order for people to purchase our music, they need to know that it's out there.  Promotion and marketing is very costly, but very necessary. 
-Music Video: a great way for people to recognize you and grow attached to your music is through videos.  Who doesn't like a good video? And we want the best quality--check out some of the videos we've in the past at our YouTube page, www.youtube.com/user/MrDarnellsapp/videos.

The Impact

Think about your favorite song.  That song can either make you smile, laugh, dance, cry, give you chills or make you simply nod your head. In some way or another music touches us.  It touches us deep down in our souls and it stays there for a while.  They call music "the universal language" because it's the only art form that can speak to anybody, anywhere.  Music doesn't care about your race, background or social class; it just wants to be heard. 

Here's the problem though.  When you turn on the radio there isn't much worth listening to, but many still do.  Between the 808's, high hat drums and hand claps are profane, misogynistic and violent lyrics.  These lyrics don't make us smile or give us chills, but they should make us cry.  GA3 is here to offer something different and sort of "unusual."

Other Ways You Can Help

GA3 understands that everyone is not in a position to make donations and we don't want anyone to strain themselves financially for our sake--we appreciate it though!  Listen, if you are not in a position at the moment to make a donation here are a few ways you can help us out: 
-Spread The Word: tell your family, friends, neighbors and strangers, not just about this campaign but our ministry as a whole. Tell them to check out our website gideonsarmyga.com for music, updates and news. We are on a mission to build the kingdom and every penny or dollar will help. 
-Open Your Doors: if you have a church or any venue don't hesitate to invite us.  We are more than willing to come out if our schedule permits. 
-Pray: most important thing you could do for us right now is to pray. Pray that God will use us however He chooses and that we will take a backseat to His agenda.  Pray for our strength as we boldly step out on faith. Pray for our humilty as our audience expands and grows.  Most importanly pray that souls will be reached through our music.

Pray for our humilty as our audience expands and grows.  Most importanly pray that souls will be reached through our music.

story:
Short Summary 

You're a writer? A painter,  photographer or  poet? You  are an artist without decent attention? This is the right place for you.

Imagine if you could, from the comfort of your chair, send a message to the world. If you could with just few mouse clicks present your pieces of art to the public. We already did it... and we like the idea.

We present you Art in Shadows. A book were you are the main character.

We want to give an opportunity to everyone, no matter where you are from, no matter what is your social status, to present your talent, to shout out loud and to leave a mark in history.

Help us in this project, so we could help you. It's a win-win situation.

Let us step out from the shadows.

Let us become legends.

(sample image) 

What We Need & What You Get

Here's the thing. We really want to promote artist all over the world. To do that, we need your help.

What we want is to collect your art, put it in a hardcover book, which will be printed in a large number.

Of course, it's not easy to create a book, design it, print it and deliver it all over the world. That's why we need you. Share your art with us, add some money and help us to launch this project. 

As a side of gratitude, we'll give you rewards. The more you help, the better you'll be rewarded. See list of perks for more info. :)

 Art In Shadows will look great in your portfolio, it's a perfect gift for your loved ones... or simply a beautiful memory to have.


If you take a place in our book, you'll need to send us your address so we could send you terms and conditions. Contact us via kraljevicdavid@gmail.com

Risks & Challenges 

The biggest potential risk is that one or more of the books will be slightly late, due to unexpected production issues. The books are expected to arrive before the end of the of the july 2015.

Other Ways You Can Help 

You can help us by making some noise about our campaign.

Share this project on social networks or simply email it to your friends.

Thank you!

story:
Hi! My name is Jamel, and I have set up this campaign for my boyfriend, Damien, who has been hand-making and designing real butterfly jewelry for over a decade. His jewelry is extremely unique and ecologically conscious, and will make wonderful holiday gifts for your loved ones. He preserves over 30 of the most stunning butterfly species, supporting small butterfly observatories around the world that raise and study butterflies. This self-taught process took him over two years to perfect the 30 species that he now preserves. His butterfly busines, in turn, helps these observatories with funds needed to keep their doors open. These small observatories also hire indigenous people that live in and around these remote areas, providing much needed sustainable jobs in these regions. For more info, check the FAQs.

Most recently, Damien and I spent a month in Taxco, the silver capital of Mexico, with the goal of finding a small, family-based silversmith to custom make some of his settings. This was an extreme success with the meeting of Masiel, an extremely talented silversmith who lives in the hills of Taxco. Masiel hand mixes and custom makes silver settings for Damien’s higher-end jewelry line. Masiel and his family's main goal is to send their very bright daughter to Canada for college, and Damien would love to be a part of making this happen by being in a position where he can purchase more custom settings from Masiel to preserve his butterflies. By supporting this campaign, Damien can build a stronger partnership with Masiel, along with supporting butterfly observatories that are instrumental in keeping butterfly species flourishing.

For over a decade, Damien has been doing art and craft fairs all over the nation. He's a bit of a luddite, and you will not find his work anywhere on the Internet but here. He very much enjoys doing art and craft fairs across the nation, talking to people about butterflies, preservation and his ecologically conscious goal. Of course, like many artists across the nation, this all ended with Covid, and he has an amazing stock of butterfly jewelry that he would love to share with people.

The funds raised from this campaign will allow Damien to continue working on his butterflies and ride out this year's cancelled shows, so his business can survive until outdoor art and craft shows resume. Of course any donation is greatly appreciated, but he would love to offer one of his amazing butterflies in return for your support, and he can make this work through perks starting at $45.  He also will have a $75 and $125 perk, with the higher price points being some of his most complicated and intricate work to date, most of which incorporate Masiel’s custom settings.

Most recently, Damien and I were living and working at Breitenbush Hot Springs, which was decimated by Oregon’s worst wildfires in history, losing both our housing and our jobs (Damien works p/t at the hot springs during the Winter months when he is not doing shows) putting another unforeseen twist in both of our lives.

Your support during these uncertain times will help keep Damien's business alive, while also supporting the butterfly kingdom and keeping Masiel's small family silversmith tradition and business going. Damien will do his best to get your perks delivered by Christmas, if he receives your order within the first two weeks of December. Thank you so much your support, and we hope you enjoy these unique and lovingly crafted pieces!
story_txt:
Hi! My name is Jamel, and I have set up this campaign for my boyfriend, Damien, who has been hand-making and designing real butterfly jewelry for over a decade. His jewelry is extremely unique and ecologically conscious, and will make wonderful holiday gifts for your loved ones. He preserves over 30 of the most stunning butterfly species, supporting small butterfly observatories around the world that raise and study butterflies. This self-taught process took him over two years to perfect the 30 species that he now preserves. His butterfly busines, in turn, helps these observatories with funds needed to keep their doors open. These small observatories also hire indigenous people that live in and around these remote areas, providing much needed sustainable jobs in these regions. For more info, check the FAQs.

Most recently, Damien and I spent a month in Taxco, the silver capital of Mexico, with the goal of finding a small, family-based silversmith to custom make some of his settings. This was an extreme success with the meeting of Masiel, an extremely talented silversmith who lives in the hills of Taxco. Masiel hand mixes and custom makes silver settings for Damien’s higher-end jewelry line. Masiel and his family's main goal is to send their very bright daughter to Canada for college, and Damien would love to be a part of making this happen by being in a position where he can purchase more custom settings from Masiel to preserve his butterflies. By supporting this campaign, Damien can build a stronger partnership with Masiel, along with supporting butterfly observatories that are instrumental in keeping butterfly species flourishing.


For over a decade, Damien has been doing art and craft fairs all over the nation. He's a bit of a luddite, and you will not find his work anywhere on the Internet but here. Your support during these uncertain times will help keep Damien's business alive, while also supporting the butterfly kingdom and keeping Masiel's small family silversmith tradition and business going. Damien will do his best to get your perks delivered by Christmas, if he receives your order within the first two weeks of December. Thank you so much your support, and we hope you enjoy these unique and lovingly crafted pieces!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Lindsey Shaw, and I  am a freelance writer, actor and comedian based in Chicago. For the past two years I have been developing a web series called Mid-to-Late. It's a dark comedy about a (relatively) young woman who is bogged down by life as a struggling creative. She is constantly running from responsibility by way of booze, chasing after unrequited love and excuse-making.

Her struggles are compounded by a feeling of inadequacy compared to younger, more accomplished women. She feels left behind, and an unhealthy preoccupation with social media exacerbates it all. 

The series' story arch has been heavily inspired by my real-life struggles with clinical depression and anxiety. As my 30's tick on, and as my mental illness is treated but never eradicated, I am faced with societal pressures—both overt and implicated—financial distress and my ever-present and dwindling biological clock. 

Once produced, the series will not only help myself and other passionate, diligent artists achieve a dream, but will also lend much-needed dialogue to topics targeting mental illness and addiction.

Your donation will be an integral and much-appreciated contribution to art, and potential installment to pop culture, that carries messaging around topics that are continuously in need of destigmatization. 

To invest time, creative energy and blind, yet visceral belief into an idea that cannot happen until properly funded, is both grueling and exhilarating. I have enough faith in this project to put its future in the  hands of others' donations. 

I'm collaborating with Kyle Leland (Kalopsia Films, Cannes Film Festival) who's helping direct and produce, and Noah Laufer (DePaul Theater School graduate, Victory Gardens Theater) as co-writer and director. Both artists continue to generously share their creative input and talents, and I am truly honored to be working with them. 

Why It's So Important to Myself and the World

Mental illness has been a driving force in the narrative of my life since I was a toddler. From struggling with sharing my mom with her illness and hospital stays, to meeting with school social workers and living a nomadic life when my parents weren't able to care for me—much of who I am and what I identify with has been rooted in self-doubt and fear. Some are drawn to purchasing a house and having perfect credit when mapping out their lives. I've typically been drawn to chaos. It's what I know. Regardless of how unhealthy that path of familiarity has been. 

With this web series, I've found a way to transform ongoing mishaps, self-deprecation and mental illness into something resonating and inspirational. 

Growing up adjacent to the adverse effects of bipolar disorder and schizophrenia, I often felt alone and afraid. With a sick mom and absentee dad, I was in a marginalized group, never really having anyone outside of my family to relate to when it came to the personal trauma I endured. Any time I saw mental illness depicted in the media, it always felt sorely misrepresented. This web series gives me an opportunity to provide the public with the kind of art I would have been eager and relieved to view so to not feel so ostracized. I want others who suffer from mental illness to know they're not ever alone. 

Why Funds are Needed and How Contributions Will be Spent

As a proverbial "starving artist" (literally would take you up on lunch at Chipotle if you offer to buy. There's one right by my therapist's office), funding is needed to professionally produce Mid-to-Late. Once enough money is raised, the series can be shot and edited in order to enter festivals, competitions and even be submitted to executives at major streaming networks. 

To shoot this in a worthwhile manner, I need to pay for :

Canon C200 RAW Cinema Camera

Ronin Steadicam

Slider

Tripods + grip materials

Zacuto Shoulder Rigs

Kino Flo lights 

Rokinon Cinema Lenses 

Intellytech 2x2 Panels

Intellytech Fresnel 1k

(If you don't know what any of this stuff is, don't worry. Just know it costs money to rent and operate!)

Sound editing 

Director's cut 

Actors' pay and onsite snacks (we definitely need snacks).

Compensation for the stellar film crew I've teamed up with (they've done work that's been featured at the Cannes Film Festival, which is chic and legit!). 

Another Way to Help 

If donating isn't possible, you can share this video to help spread the word of this crowdfunding effort. Tell your friends! Post on your wall (I promise to like it)!

Thanks for Visiting!

Ronin Steadicam
Slider
Tripods + grip materials
Zacuto Shoulder Rigs
Kino Flo lights 
Rokinon Cinema Lenses 
Intellytech 2x2 Panels
Intellytech Fresnel 1k
(If you don't know what any of this stuff is, don't worry. Just know it costs money to rent and operate!)
Sound editing 
Director's cut 
Actors' pay and onsite snacks (we definitely need snacks).
Compensation for the stellar film crew I've teamed up with (they've done work that's been featured at the Cannes Film Festival, which is chic and legit!). 
Another Way to Help 
If donating isn't possible, you can share this video to help spread the word of this crowdfunding effort. Tell your friends! Post on your wall (I promise to like it)!
Thanks for Visiting!

story:
Artist Singer/songwriter Silka is raising money to complete a musical short.  A film set in Africa created around original compositions that tell a vivd story of love and adventure.  Directed by Wanlov The Kubolor.  Shooting January 8th-20th in Accra, Ghana.  We bring you a documentary style, experimental, and improvisational scripted creative project.  

This is the visual accompaniment to a five song musical collaboration entitled "Last Shall Be First". The music is drawing near completion and we are preparing to travel to Africa in January to shoot the film.  

It's important to show warmth and the ways we love each other in the mist of the chaos.  This film intends to create a healing space, a way to teach through art that we are truly safe within ourselves.  An Afro futurist diasporic love story.  Examining radical self approval through our own lens. Telling the story of Black Womanhood against all odds.  

The contributions sought  will help us bring this film to the landscape of reality.  It will support  hours of labor, equipment, and traveling. Your contribution will help foster the future of sound and film. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need 3,500 dollars towards production cost. Which include... 

  • Equipment rental 
  • Two weeks worth of lodging(Airbnb/Hotel) for cast to live while filming 
  •  Travel, Car rentals, Bus 
  • Extras, Actors, Set design 
  • Donate one hundred dollars or more and get exclusive streaming of the film and music, along with premier access to events surrounding the release date in the NYC area.  

Your support makes all the difference! We are creating more vision to gift ourselves with.  More space to dream.

With trust, compassion, and community we can reach our financial incentive.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share this campaign and get the word out.  
  •  Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
100% of the profits from these charity enamel pins will be donated to Wildlife Victoria which in then will be distributed to wildlife shelters and carers to assist with countless animals, including pets, wildlife and livestock that have been impacted by these terrible bushfires. 

Record-breaking temperatures and months of severe drought have fuelled a series of massive bushfires across Australia. They have taken an enormous toll on wildlife, with huge numbers of mammals, birds, reptiles, insects and other species killed. It has been estimated more than a billion animals have died around the country.

 "That's Lovely Dear", is a accessories business located in Melbourne, Victoria, Australia. The impact of these fires has been absolutely devastating to the community surrounding us. Since this is a cause so incredibly close to our heart and our home, we have designed these two exclusive enamel pin designs of a Koala and a Kangaroo (the animals that often represent Australia's vast wildlife) to help generate funding in order to support our wildlife that have been impacted by this horrible fire season. 

100% of the profits of this campaign, (which are also within the costs of each pledge) will be donated to Wildlife Victoria. (https://www.wildlifevictoria.org.au)

Koala Hard Enamel Pin

Gold Plated

34mm

Double Butterfly Clutch Backing

Kangaroo Hard Enamel Pin

Gold Plated

35mm

Double Butterfly Clutch Backing

(We just know that we are going to reach our funding goal with the support of all of you! However, if there is a chance that we do not, we aim to donate the funds to Wildlife Victoria.)

Once we hit our funding goal of $750 AUD, we will have a successful amount of funding to produce both enamel pins with 100% of profits of each enamel pin order going towards Wildlife Victoria. 

 

Timeline

January 20th 2020 - 30 Day Campaign Begins

Mid - February - Campaign Finishes

End Of February - Enamel Pins Begin Production

#1  First Donation - 100% of Profit Is Donated To Wildlife Victoria

Mid - March - Production of Enamel Pins Complete

End Of March - Enamel Pins Are Sent Out 

2# Second Donation - 100% of Profit Is Donated To Wildlife Victoria

Risks & Challenges

  • Production Delays: Pins manufacturers usually take about a month to make a batch of pins, so we aim to receive them by the beginning of March and ship as soon as possible. However, it is possible that due to vacation periods and other production delays, the pins may ship towards the end of March.  We will do our best to keep you updated on the timeline and production of the pins. 
  • Shipping:   Please make sure to double-check your shipping information and email. To make sure that your pins arrive safely to the correct addresses and that I may easily contact you for future updates.
  • Colours: Colours may be slightly different to the image provided, however, colours will be pastel based.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • If you click "Back It", you can pledge any amount as a contribution to the project. 100% of this pledge will go straight to Wildlife Victoria to assist them with impact of the Australian bushfires. 
  • If you would like to donate directly to the production of the enamel pins without receiving them, you can choose "$5 Donation" perk to support us.
  • If goals are reached, both of these pins will be available on our website (thatslovelydear.com) and on Etsy (Etsy.com/shop/thatslovelydear) where we will continue to sell them and give 100% profits to the Australian bushfire crisis.
  • If you are unable to donate funds, there are free ways to support Australians and wildlife in bushfire zones. Have a look:  https://au.finance.yahoo.com/news/free-ways-to-...
  • Otherwise, share this campaign around to your friends and family.

story:
Home Gravity est une start-up française et familiale, qui développe une grande diversité de produits design en lévitation. Notre art décoratif est issu de la meilleure technologie électromagnétique. Pour cette aventure mère & fils, Home Gravity a besoin de vous pour vous faire découvrir une grande diversité de produits en lévitation ET surtout créer de nouveaux prototypes innovants ! 

 

 

Toute la presse parle de la lévitation ! Suivez notre actualité, nous allons être publié chez plusieurs blogueurs et journaux reconnus dans les prochains jours !

Presskit

 

 

Home Gravity s’est construite autour de la passion du design et de l’art. En effet, la lévitation est un mystère car c’est un art décoratif incontestable dès le premier coup d’œil !

 

Notre équipe 

Léo est le fondateur du projet. Il a obtenu un DUT Techniques de Commercialisation, une Licence Economie et Gestion et un Diplôme Universitaire Entrepreneur. De par sa formation, il s'occupe de la partie digitale (site internet, campagne de crowdfunding, logo, vidéos, photos etc.) et de toute la partie commercialisation, marketing et communication.

Patricia a été initiée par son fils et elle est tombée amoureuse de la lévitation. Elle a toujours été passionnée par l'art et l'artisanat. Longtemps, elle a exprimé sa créativité pour l'élaboration de nombreux vitraux alsaciens avec un maître verrier. Patricia conseille sur le choix des coloris, la forme des produits, les vases et les plantes...

Mais elle a toujours eu un tempérament bien trempé avec son passé de chauffeuse de poids lourd, convoyeuse de fonds armé, pilote de prototypes automobile ou encore marchal en aéroport (placement des avions). Son expertise dans la logistique/distribution sera très importante pour Home Gravity.

 

 

Home Gravity est le premier distributeur français de produits en lévitation. Son objectif est de rassembler l’ensemble des produits en apesanteur sur une même plateforme en ligne (www.home-gravity.com).

Nous proposons dès maintenant de nombreuses gammes :

Gamme GARDEN GRAVITY

 

Gamme LIGHT GRAVITY

 

A chaque toucher vous aurez le choix entre 3 modes différents d'éclairage :
- Eclairage de l'abat-jour
- Eclairage du pied en aluminium
- Eclairage de l'abat-jour et du pied en aluminium

La lampe reste en lévitation même éteinte !

 

Gamme SYSTEM GRAVITY

Vous voulez voir plus de nos produits ? Alors allez dans la rubrique "CONTREPARTIES" ou visitez notre première version de notre site internet : www.home-gravity.com

 

 

Nous avons pour ambition d'élargir en 2017 notre gamme en créant de nouveaux produits jamais vu en collaborant avec les ingénieurs spécialisés dans les sciences de la technologie électromagnétique. 

Nous sommes actuellement en recherche & développement pour développer de nombreuses nouveautés. Dans un premier temps, nous allons travailler de nouvelles matières pour les bases, les abats-jour et les vases. Dans un second temps, nous allons associer la technologie par induction afin de pouvoir faire léviter des objets électrique dans les airs comme une recharge pour vos manettes (PS4, XBOX...), smartphones, tablettes etc. Nous allons déclinez cette association technologique en produit design hi-tech pour toujours aller plus loin dans la lévitation !

N.B.: Nous ne pouvons pas encore vous en dire plus mais suivez nous sur les réseaux sociaux pour être informé de nos nouvelles créations !

 

 

La qualité d'un produit commence par son emballage ! Nous avons fait le choix de sélectionner la boite en bois comme deuxième peau de la plante en lévitation. En effet, le côté nature est visible au premier coups d’œil !

Idéal pour un cadeau : l'emballage est la première chose que l'on voit !

La boite est également très solide et permet de laisser l'air bonsaï intact !

 

 

Le principe de la lévitation électromagnétique est de chercher à compenser le poids de l’objet par une force créée par un très grand aimant, un circuit intégré servant de coordinateur et des bobines électriques servant de stabilisateur. Cette compensation de la gravité permet la lévitation – élévation et le maintien de l'objet en l’air sans l'intervention d'un quelconque appui.

Les bénéfices de la technologie :

  • Complètement silencieux
  • Système enfin abordable (les premiers prototypes s'élevaient à plus de 500€/unité)
  • Technologie simple d'utilisation (mamie peut le faire, vous aussi !)

 

 

Suivez l'avancement de notre start-up depuis ses débuts. Nous avons déjà fait du chemin et c'est avec vous que nous allons continuer l'aventure!

 

 

Vous pouvez voir dans ce graphique comment se répartit votre financement.

Par exemple, pour 100€ récoltés, 58€ sont utilisés pour fabriquer votre contrepartie, 4€ pour l'emballage, 6€ pour le transport etc.

 

 

 

C'est grâce à vous que nous pourrons avancer ! A chaque pallier de financement, nous pourrons développer pas à pas notre start-up, voici nos objectifs et ce que nous ferons avec votre aide !

 

 

Suivez-nous sur Facebook (cliquer ici)

 

 

Vous voulez en savoir plus sur nos collections ? Voici toutes les contreparties en images pour faire votre choix !

Pour les professionnels : la lévitation est fascinante et est encore un mystère ! Placer ces appareils en vitrine vous permettra d'augmenter votre visibilité : la surprise des passants augmentera sensiblement le taux d'occupation de votre magasin !

Avec le système de lévitation magnétique, vous aurez la possibilité de mettre en avant vos best-sellers, vous augmenterez considérablement leurs visibilités !

 

Gravity bonsaï standard (blanc, noir, effet poterie, gris/noir, rouge et noir bicolore) :

  • Taille de la base: 16.5x16.5x6.5 cm
  • Lévitation maximum : 400g
  • Distance de lévitation variable selon le poids : 5-25mm
  • Adaptateur secteur : DC Sortie 15 V, 1500mA
  • Prise compatible pour chaque pays (indiquer quelle prise il vous faut)

 

Gravity bonsaï gris et lumière bleu :

  • Taille de la base: 17x17x7cm
  • Lévitation maximum : 300g
  • Distance de lévitation variable selon le poids : 5-25mm
  • Adaptateur secteur : DC Sortie 15 V, 1500mA
  • Prise compatible pour chaque pays (indiquer quelle prise il vous faut)

 

Gravity bonsaï imitation bois et lumière :

  • Spécificité : ultra simple d'utilisation
  • Taille de la base: 13.8x13.8x2.5cm
  • Lévitation maximum : 300g
  • Distance de lévitation variable selon le poids : 5-25mm
  • Adaptateur secteur : DC Sortie 15 V, 1500mA
  • Prise compatible pour chaque pays (indiquer quelle prise il vous faut)

 

Gravity system :

  • Spécificité : faites léviter ce que vous voulez !
  • Taille de la base: 13.8x13.8x2.5cm
  • Lévitation maximum : 500g
  • Distance de lévitation variable selon le poids : 10-30mm
  • Adaptateur secteur : DC Sortie 15 V, 1500mA
  • Prise compatible pour chaque pays (indiquer quelle prise il vous faut)

 

Gravity lamp - lampe en lévitation :

  • Pied en aluminium
  • Différentes couleurs d'abat-jour (noir, blanc, bleu et orange)
  • Abat-Jour flottant et tournant dans l'air grâce au système magnétique
  • Dispositif de mise en lévitation simplifié (mise en lévitation en 1 minute)
  • Interrupteur tactile, un seul toucher suffit
  • Prise compatible pour chaque pays (indiquer quelle prise il vous faut)

 

Vous voulez avoir plus de choix ?

Visitez notre première version du site internet : www.home-gravity.com

 

 

Plusieurs livraisons sont disponibles en France : mondial relay, DHL et Chronopost. 

La livraison est possible à travers le monde mais des frais supplémentaire peuvent apparaître. Par exemple, la livraison vers la Russie est obligatoirement par point relais pour 49€ minimum et donc comme chaque pays a sa spécificité, contactez-nous !

Nous ferons tout pour livrer vos produits le plus rapidement possible !

 

 

Merci à vous tous pour votre confiance, vos messages et votre soutien ! Nous vous remercions de partager avec nous cette aventure !

N'hésitez pas à nous suivre sur les réseaux sociaux et à visiter notre site internet !

www.home-gravity.com

 

 

Nous avons tous peur d'acheter ce que l'on ne connaît pas et notre défis principal sera de vous rassurer devant cette technologie encore inconnue. Nos vidéos et nos photos nous aiderons mais il y aura toujours des sceptiques ! Mais puisque nos produits sont de qualité et fonctionnent, nous arriverons à pallier ce problème !

Nous devons exposer nos produits mais créer un magasin est beaucoup trop coûteux au départ... Nous mettrons en place un système d'ambassadeur dans les plus grandes villes de France afin que vous puissiez visualiser le produit proche de chez vous !

 

 D'autres façons d'aider

Vous êtes tombé amoureux de ce nouveaux style de design innovant ? Suivez-nous sur les réseaux sociaux, faites-en part à votre entourage !

Si vous souhaitez allez plus loin, contactez nous afin de devenir ambassadeur de la marque : contact@home-gravity.com
story_txt:
Home Gravity est une start-up française et familiale, qui développe une grande diversité de produits design en lévitation. Notre art décoratif est issu de la meilleure technologie électromagnétique. Pour cette aventure mère & fils, Home Gravity a besoin de vous pour vous faire découvrir une grande diversité de produits en lévitation ET surtout créer de nouveaux prototypes innovants ! 
 

 
Toute la presse parle de la lévitation ! Suivez notre actualité, nous allons être publié chez plusieurs blogueurs et journaux reconnus dans les prochains jours !
Presskit
 

 
Home Gravity s’est construite autour de la passion du design et de l’art. En effet, la lévitation est un mystère car c’est un art décoratif incontestable dès le premier coup d’œil !
 
Notre équipe 
Léo est le fondateur du projet. Il a obtenu un DUT Techniques de Commercialisation, une Licence Economie et Gestion et un Diplôme Universitaire Entrepreneur. De par sa formation, il s'occupe de la partie digitale (site internet, campagne de crowdfunding, logo, vidéos, photos etc.) et de toute la partie commercialisation, marketing et communication.
Patricia a été initiée par son fils et elle est tombée amoureuse de la lévitation. Elle a toujours été passionnée par l'art et l'artisanat. Longtemps, elle a exprimé sa créativité pour l'élaboration de nombreux vitraux alsaciens avec un maître verrier. Patricia conseille sur le choix des coloris, la forme des produits, les vases et les plantes...
Mais elle a toujours eu un tempérament bien trempé avec son passé de chauffeuse de poids lourd, convoyeuse de fonds armé, pilote de prototypes automobile ou encore marchal en aéroport (placement des avions). Son expertise dans la logistique/distribution sera très importante pour Home Gravity.
 

 
Home Gravity est le premier distributeur français de produits en lévitation. Son objectif est de rassembler l’ensemble des produits en apesanteur sur une même plateforme en ligne (www.home-gravity.com).
Nous proposons dès maintenant de nombreuses gammes :
Gamme GARDEN GRAVITY

 
Gamme LIGHT GRAVITY
 
A chaque toucher vous aurez le choix entre 3 modes différents d'éclairage :- Eclairage de l'abat-jour- Eclairage du pied en aluminium- Eclairage de l'abat-jour et du pied en aluminium
La lampe reste en lévitation même éteinte !
 
Gamme SYSTEM GRAVITY

Vous voulez voir plus de nos produits ? Alors allez dans la rubrique "CONTREPARTIES" ou visitez notre première version de notre site internet : www.home-gravity.com
 

 
Nous avons pour ambition d'élargir en 2017 notre gamme en créant de nouveaux produits jamais vu en collaborant avec les ingénieurs spécialisés dans les sciences de la technologie électromagnétique. 
Nous sommes actuellement en recherche & développement pour développer de nombreuses nouveautés. Dans un premier temps, nous allons travailler de nouvelles matières pour les bases, les abats-jour et les vases. Dans un second temps, nous allons associer la technologie par induction afin de pouvoir faire léviter des objets électrique dans les airs comme une recharge pour vos manettes (PS4, XBOX...), smartphones, tablettes etc. Nous allons déclinez cette association technologique en produit design hi-tech pour toujours aller plus loin dans la lévitation !
N.B.: Nous ne pouvons pas encore vous en dire plus mais suivez nous sur les réseaux sociaux pour être informé de nos nouvelles créations !
 

 
La qualité d'un produit commence par son emballage ! Nous avons fait le choix de sélectionner la boite en bois comme deuxième peau de la plante en lévitation. En effet, le côté nature est visible au premier coups d’œil !
Idéal pour un cadeau : l'emballage est la première chose que l'on voit !

La boite est également très solide et permet de laisser l'air bonsaï intact !

 

 
Le principe de la lévitation électromagnétique est de chercher à compenser le poids de l’objet par une force créée par un très grand aimant, un circuit intégré servant de coordinateur et des bobines électriques servant de stabilisateur. Cette compensation de la gravité permet la lévitation – élévation et le maintien de l'objet en l’air sans l'intervention d'un quelconque appui.
Les bénéfices de la technologie :

Complètement silencieux

Système enfin abordable (les premiers prototypes s'élevaient à plus de 500€/unité)
Technologie simple d'utilisation (mamie peut le faire, vous aussi !)

 

 
Suivez l'avancement de notre start-up depuis ses débuts. Nous avons déjà fait du chemin et c'est avec vous que nous allons continuer l'aventure!

 

 
Vous pouvez voir dans ce graphique comment se répartit votre financement.
Par exemple, pour 100€ récoltés, 58€ sont utilisés pour fabriquer votre contrepartie, 4€ pour l'emballage, 6€ pour le transport etc.

 
 

 
C'est grâce à vous que nous pourrons avancer ! A chaque pallier de financement, nous pourrons développer pas à pas notre start-up, voici nos objectifs et ce que nous ferons avec votre aide !
 

 
Suivez-nous sur Facebook (cliquer ici)

 

 
Vous voulez en savoir plus sur nos collections ? Voici toutes les contreparties en images pour faire votre choix !

story:
My name is Elena Cremona; I am an environmental and landscape photographer graduated from the Arts University Bournemouth and currently based in London. My latest project, scheduled to launch in early January, is a collaborative print publication that focuses on the intersection between fine art and environmentalism. My aim is to launch a platform for both emerging and established artists to express their thoughts on current environmental issues, through a wide range of creative media.

Our first print publication, “The Earth Issue,” will be created in collaboration with Archive Collective Magazine, a multidisciplinary digital magazine founded in Montreal with a readership of over 10,000 artists and creative professionals. Together, we have identified the growing interest amongst young artists to to awaken society’s complacent consciousness; to inspire, and harness the power of community to drive social change. There is a shared desire amongst the global creative youth to ignite a sense of urgency in regards to the environment, and our relationship to it. We believe this desire must be nurtured and cultivated, in the common pursuit of preserving nature for the generations to come.

We are currently seeking sponsorship from organizations and individuals to expand our launch into a series of exhibitions, educational conferences and workshops. 


Description of the contents of the publication:
The Earth Issue will include the writings and images of 29 artists, with a common goal of honouring nature through their works, and inspiring other artists to use art as a channel for environmental activism. The projects featured in this issue span across various creative disciplines, from photography to painting, ceramic sculpture, poetry, and illustration.

Why we are asking for sponsorship:
The worlds needs to engage in healthy debate about Climate Change and we believe art is the best way to encourage that.
With a little help from like-minded organizations, readers, and friends, we hope to expand our issue launch into a hub for learning, sharing, and empowering. The launch event will be held in London, where we aim to put together conferences on climate change, activism, photography, and creative impact.

story:
Founded in 1999, Wigtown Book Festival is now one of the UK's best-loved literary events. From 21-30 September, we celebrate our 20th anniversary and we're having a 10-day party. With more than 250 events, including some of the nation's most interesting writers, as well as theatre, film and music, there's something for the whole family. As well as events for adults, we have two dedicated programmes for children 0-13 and for young people aged 14-25.

“Wigtown may only have a population of 1000, but Wigtown doesn’t just punch above its weight when it comes to attracting big-name authors to its annual book festival, it punches above pretty much everybody else’s weight, too.” Roger Cox, The Scotsman

Events for children are at the heart of Wigtown Book Festival. In our 20th year we want to introduce the new face and mascot of Wigtown Children’s Festival. Drawn by illustrator Claudia Boldt, the legendary beast is large, hairy, friendlier than the related Yeti and above all inquisitive. But we have a problem – our Big Wig is stuck on the page. We need him brought to life and able to interact, entertain and inspire the youngest of our festival-goers. We have our illustration but we need your help to bring our mascot to life with a custom-made costume.

What We Need & What You Get

We need £1,500 to make our mascot costume and create some custom Big Wig goodies including t-shirts, button badges and fridge magnets so that children and families can take a little piece of Big Wig Festival home. Our mascot will be available throughout the festival for photographs as a great reminder of the joy of reading and experience of authors bringing characters to life at Wigtown Book Festival.

We'll keep backers up to date over the 30 days with Big Wig rhymes and stories and and promise each backer who donates £2 or more their very own Big Wig badge to wear with pride. Backers will be invited to Big Wig Festival on Sunday 30 September to meet Big Wig for themselves.

If we don't reach the goal, we'll prioritise the mascot and the backer pin badges. If we exceed our goal, we'll put any additional funds towards future children's and young people's events to continue to inspire our youngest readers and writers.

The Impact

Your contribution will help bring this lovable, huggable character to life for all our festival visitors. Meeting our authors, hearing their stories and seeing them bring their characters to life from the page has a huge impact on children, developing their imagination and their sense of what is possible. We know that Big Wig will help us achieve this more and more each year.

Wigtown Festival Company has never run a crowdfunding project before - this is all new territory for us - but we have won a number of awards, including: the Sunday Herald Scottish Culture Awards 2018 Cultural Event of the Year; an Arts & Business Scotland Award; and a Scottish Thistle Award.  We also promise to spend your contribution responsibly for the purposes detailed here, with any excess funding dedicated to supporting literary projects for young readers and writers.

Risks & Challenges

Without your support, we won't be able to bring Big Wig from the page and create a lovable, huggable character for children to meet, read to and experience Wigtown Book Festival with. We know that bringing characters to life has a huge impact on imagination and wealth of experience and hope you'll support us to bring Big Wig to life.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can afford to support financially, but you can still help by spreading the word about our Big Wig mascot campaign and about the festival itself. We want to maximise the number of children, young people and families who can experience the festival for themselves and would be delighted if you'd share our website (www.wigtownbookfestival.com) and Facebook details so no one misses the opportunity to take part and meet Big Wig for themselves. You can also share our campaign directly from Indiegogo share tools too!

story:
The Background

My name is William Goetz and I run a small business in Washington State that focuses on recreating historical crafts from the Viking Era as well as sourcing high quality historical textiles for reenactors and those who simply appreciate the beauty and history of these crafts. I personally have been blacksmithing for about six years and silversmithing for the last two. I've found my passion in these crafts in addition to my living history pursuits, and I am wanting to take the next step in expanding my business to further establish myself.

This campaign is for several purposes: I want to build out my stock of items while having more freedom to work with new techniques and styles, I want to upgrade my shop with new tools and equipment, I want to build my own website and I want to travel to Scandinavia to get a first-hand look at some of the artifacts that I am faithfully reproducing while seeing some historical sites and potentially networking with other crafters in the living history community. These are things that I aim to accomplish regardless of anything else, but with a boost from those who support my work I can accomplish these goals and take my business to the next level much sooner than without.

 

To see more examples of my work and the history behind each item, check out the following link: www.etsy.com/shop/hearthfirenordicware 

 

Desires and Rewards

I am looking to raise $2000 to cover the costs of these pursuits. This will cover my goals in order of:

$525 for buying silver and other crafting materials as well as historical reproduction silks,

$150 for outfitting my shop with better tools as well as a better casting setup,

$200 for setting up my own independent website,

$700 for making a trip to Scandinavia to go to museums and historical sites and get a close-up and in-person look at these ancient sources,

$425 to cover taxes, fees and perk materials. This obviously scales down if total contributions are lower.

Any donation is much appreciated and goes to help my cause, and for those who feel like donating more they will get the following tokens of my thanks. For style choices, see the photos at the top.

$10 or more gets a 15% off coupon to my shop which can be applied to any item.

$50 or more gets a pendant of your choice in sterling silver.

$70 or more gets a ring of your choice in sterling silver and sized to your preference.

$140 or more gets a flat style arm ring (bracelet) of your choice in fine silver.

$150 or more gets an open style arm ring (bracelet) of your choice in sterling silver.

$180 or more gets a closed style arm ring (bracelet) of your choice in sterling silver. This requires a measurement around the hand to make sure that it fits correctly.

These rewards do not stack, but third tier or above may choose to add a pendant onto their reward at no cost. Please provide shipping address. For international shipments, please be aware that there may be import taxes collected upon pickup. I do not collect them so I cannot say for sure. Depending on volume of rewards, please allow up to 6-7 weeks for shipment.

While raising enough to finance my stock building and travel would be amazing, even a lower amount would still greatly help. If I do not meet the total goal I will still be putting the money raised into buying materials and upgrading my shop and, depending on the amount, setting some aside as a boost for my travel and research goal.

The Impact

My art brings history to the modern world in a way that allows people to have and wear pieces of the past. I highly value education and I always share my research, so the customer knows that what they're getting is genuine and gets to know the story behind it. With your support and my goals met I can greatly increase the effectiveness of these endeavors. 

My quality speaks for itself with regard to my commitment to authentic reconstruction. My solid 5-star Etsy rating and work with several shops as well as the Nordic Museum in Seattle are examples of this. Supporting my project means helping to keep historical crafts alive in the here and now.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to support my project, but don't have the ability to contribute financially, sharing this and helping to bring it to more people's attention is still incredibly helpful and appreciated. Every bit helps!

Desires and Rewards
I am looking to raise $2000 to cover the costs of these pursuits. This will cover my goals in order of:
$525 for buying silver and other crafting materials as well as historical reproduction silks,
$150 for outfitting my shop with better tools as well as a better casting setup,
$200 for setting up my own independent website,
$700 for making a trip to Scandinavia to go to museums and historical sites and get a close-up and in-person look at these ancient sources,
$425 to cover taxes, fees and perk materials. This obviously scales down if total contributions are lower.
Any donation is much appreciated and goes to help my cause, and for those who feel like donating more they will get the following tokens of my thanks. For style choices, see the photos at the top.
$10 or more gets a 15% off coupon to my shop which can be applied to any item.
$50 or more gets a pendant of your choice in sterling silver.
$70 or more gets a ring of your choice in sterling silver and sized to your preference.
$140 or more gets a flat style arm ring (bracelet) of your choice in fine silver.
$150 or more gets an open style arm ring (bracelet) of your choice in sterling silver.
$180 or more gets a closed style arm ring (bracelet) of your choice in sterling silver. This requires a measurement around the hand to make sure that it fits correctly.
These rewards do not stack, but third tier or above may choose to add a pendant onto their reward at no cost. Please provide shipping address. For international shipments, please be aware that there may be import taxes collected upon pickup. I do not collect them so I cannot say for sure. Depending on volume of rewards, please allow up to 6-7 weeks for shipment.
While raising enough to finance my stock building and travel would be amazing, even a lower amount would still greatly help. If I do not meet the total goal I will still be putting the money raised into buying materials and upgrading my shop and, depending on the amount, setting some aside as a boost for my travel and research goal.

The Impact
My art brings history to the modern world in a way that allows people to have and wear pieces of the past. I highly value education and I always share my research, so the customer knows that what they're getting is genuine and gets to know the story behind it. With your support and my goals met I can greatly increase the effectiveness of these endeavors. 
My quality speaks for itself with regard to my commitment to authentic reconstruction. My solid 5-star Etsy rating and work with several shops as well as the Nordic Museum in Seattle are examples of this. Supporting my project means helping to keep historical crafts alive in the here and now.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you want to support my project, but don't have the ability to contribute financially, sharing this and helping to bring it to more people's attention is still incredibly helpful and appreciated. Every bit helps!

story:
Short Summary

Gangsapura was founded in 2016 with a sole mission to promote, to elevate the value and to bring awareness about the existence of our traditional Malay gamelan. With that in mind, Gangsapura started reaching out to the public community through workshops and showcases and started to spark the interest of the young generation.

Keeping up the momentum is the key to making Malay gamelan be a part of our norm, and we need your help to make this possible.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking for supporters to help us achieve USD 25,000 to purchase Malay gamelan instruments from Solo, Indonesia. Currently, we are struggling to keep Malay gamelan alive without having our own space and instruments.

We work with organizations, schools, and individuals that already own Malay gamelan instruments within their compound. However, our vision is to make Malay gamelan as easily accessible as possible. We vision our space to be publicly available for the public to access and learn about Malay gamelan that once was kept hidden from the public eyes.

The Impact

On the 22nd March 2019, we released two Malay gamelan albums on international music streaming platforms and it was the first ever Malay gamelan album to ever made it to platforms like Spotify, iTunes, Amazon Music, Youtube and many more.

This is a huge milestone for Malay gamelan as it can be the point of reference for all Malay gamelan musicians and easily accessible tracks for all lovers and enthusiasts, all over the world.

We plan to give more, year in and year out. With our own space and instruments, we are looking into creating more contemporary songs and albums, collaborating with multiple artists across the nation.

Risks & Challenges

Malay gamelan instruments are handmade from bronze and it can only be made by the masters in Solo, Indonesia, making it a very expensive and exclusive set of instrument to own. We are looking forward to making it more open to the public, to ensure more public awareness of the artform, and further elevate the value of Malay gamelan in our culture.

story:
A Home after 40 years!

Imagine a non-profit arts association which provides its members with community, networking, education and public representation opportunities - all without a physical space - for 4 decades! No more! In October of 2018, Toronto Potters is setting up a studio in Artscape Youngplace, a clay-hub in the heart of downtown Toronto!

This 1000 sq. ft. space will offer individual artists the opportunity to focus on their work. It will allow Toronto Potters to host artists’ workshops, presentations and engage with the local community through classes and programming.

What We Need:

We are fundraising $15,000 to cover the studio start-up expenses. Our volunteers are collecting donations of tools and materials, but we need financial support to assist with the expenses of additional equipment and skilled trade services needed to set up the studio, first and last month rent deposit and materials to begin running classes. With your generosity, once the studio is up and running, Toronto Potters will be able to sustain this endeavour by generating income from studio memberships, workshops and classes.

The budget:

$7000 rent (first and last month deposit)
$750 Shelving
$750 Worktables
$2500 Electrician, Plumbing & Carpenter services
$1250 Kiln rewiring to 208volt
$500 Glazes for Classes
$500 Clay for Classes
$150 Small Tools for Classes
$800 Indiegogo Fee
$800 Transaction processing fees

TOTAL: $15,000


What You Will Receive:

Our membership has gathered a collection of exquisite handmade ceramic items as a ‘thank you' for your contributions! Toronto Potters is also offering pottery classes and private pottery workshops among our rewards!! Take a look through the list of perks and donate generously!


The Results

Creating this new clay studio in the heart of Toronto will have an immense positive effect! With unaffordable overheads, many artists are unable to have their own spaces and maintain studio practices. Your contribution fosters the future of the arts with a shared studio that is not only advantageous to clay artists, but also to the community as a whole. Toronto Potters wants to ensure that the quality of life experienced through the arts survives the education cutbacks and high cost of living.

Toronto Potters Studio will provide communal studio space for over 20 artists. It will run classes and workshops for the public ranging from introductory level to advanced, open to all ages. A year-round micro gallery featuring work from our members, plus opportunities for exhibitions and pop up markets throughout the year will add to the programming Toronto Potters already offers. With your help, we will craft a studio where creativity and community will flourish.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share the news of our studio and this campaign with your friends, family and community. If you have ceramic equipment or tools you would like to donate to the studio send us an email with the details: TorontoPotters@gmail.com or visit us at www.TorontoPotters.com

story:
About Cathy Hill

I am an artist, who has been living, working, raising children and exhibiting in Egerton, Kent, for over 25 years. With a sock-knitting needle and a tin of wax-oil crayons I create pictures that are intended to uplift and inspire my viewers about “What is magical in our every-day lives?”

It is extremely exciting  for me, to be having this big exhibition of my work, in the beautiful town of Whitstable this October (5th-14th 2018)

The Show is interactive, providing free art workshops for school children. Visitors will be creating a collaborative, community artwork with me and will visit the special space to contemplate the 'magical'.

It is time that I burst forth, with my colourful artwork, into the wider world because I have a plan... and am passionate about helping non academic children realise their own unique talents, potential and possibilities for creating a happy and successful life.

During my work with children, I was deeply moved by a 7 year old boy, who believed that he was a total failure. He couldn't learn academically and said to me "I'm no good at nuffink", but the two of us would sing together and he had an amazing voice and ability to dance!  No-one knew, he didn't even know himself, however when told, no-one was able to take any action.

Through sharing my ideas  for "It's a Magical Life!" and about this young lad, I found a sponsor and a singing/dancing tutor for him. There are many children out there, with talents that need some nurturing and I would like to help.

I aim to raise £7,777  to fund the exhibition and this campaign; from Gallery fees and insurance to printing and posting; from staffing and running the show, to workshop materials and wine for the preview.

I have great PERKS!!:  vibrant T-shirts, mugs, tea towels and prints to offer you, for your financial support + 10 places on my special Art Workshop Day  (Date TBC), and even a unique original artwork of your own 'magical place'!

Every contribution will help me fund this show, even if I don't make my target, and any extra will help further the progress of "It's a Magical Life!", the community Interest company. Even just sharing my crowdfunding site with everyone you know, will help enormously. Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

To raise money this way is a challenge for me. The organisational skills I am developing are surprising! Please donate now and I promise to send you colourful prizes in November (or before if I possibly can).

Thank you all, for your support.

Cathy
