story:
ARTHUB needs you!

We are probably the largest independent visual artist communitiy in Bucharest with a venue of it’s own. We run a beautiful, luminous space of 600 sqm in the heart of the city. We are proud to host and represent 23 resident artists and 10 active permanent guests. 

We need your help to pass through the hardest part of our journey so far. We are in a point where all our personal resources are gone, our organization is in debt and our space is not yet fully functional in order to be self sustained. After two years of investment and one year of working, the fate of our hub is in your hands. It's activity could continue in order to serve artistic community and the public in Bucharest or it may just stop because of the lack of resources. 

Buy our works of art (it really is a great investment!), our prints, books, catalogues or calendars. Attend our guided tours and our art classes for children or adults (they are probably the best in town), come to our talks and lectures, have fun at our parties! Choose one of the so many means to get connected to our cause and, stick to us, we are going to make real, good quality contemporary art something friendly and easy to relate to. 

 

Want to know more?

ARTHUB was established in march 2013 by Associatiation for Contemporary Art Promotion. Starting june 2016 we began our activity at our present address: 61, Carol I Blvd, Bucharest, the 4th floor (Latin Market Building). We run 11 individual art studios, 2 shared spaces for art and art related activities and a small coffee shop for events only.

When entering our venue, in June 2016, there was no running water, no electrical net nor an electrical connection. For six long months we have made the empty deserted place a space for art. We have done the repartitioning of the space, the electric network, a water installation and many other things like painting the walls. Except the elements that needend professional authorisation, we did most of the work ourselves. The total investment in ARTHUB is 78.000 euro so far (rent costs included). 97,6% of the money came from the initiators of the project and from ARTHUB members while just 2,4% came from public funding.  During the whole period of working no member of the Associatiation for Contemporary Art Promotion did receive sallary nor any kind of fee for running the project. So it is a 100% volunteer work project. 

We hope you understand why ARTHUB is so valuable for all of us, in here. All the artists who run their studios in ARTHUB consider it their home away from home. It is a place where we meet and we have real dialogues. It is a great opportunity for public to meet the artists in their environment. We are an art school, an art gallery, a place to hang out and a co-working hub, all together. 

When fully functional ARTHUB has tens of services and art products to offer to the market in order to increase it's sustainability. But for each and every product or service we want to offer there is something not woring yet that still needs a little more investment. We are 85% done but the 15% left is keeping us down. 

Why does it matter so much?

All these are things that matter for us. But there is also a bigger picture, maybe the most important thing about ARTHUB's survival is the fact that it's existance is and will be a precedent. Artistic public policy in Romania will have to take it's case in consideration when talking about the art studio issue. If ARTHUB works, it means that it's model could become successful and replicated or scaled to other venues by other organizations in order to solve the  problem of art studios vacancy in Bucharest. 

This is why by supporting ARTHUB, in fact you support the entire system around visual art in Romania, a system that does not work but could be fixed by initiatives like ours. So buy our art, order our collectibles, reserve your seat at our events and subscribe to our educational programs. 

All of us here at ARTHUB thank you so much and will keep you in our hearts and on our walls in order to be charished for the rest of our existance as a cultural venue. 

What We Need & What You Get

In 2017 we began with 3 rented studios in February to get to ”no vacancy” in November. All the months in which we were still developing our space we paid a huge rent.  From now on we are able to pay the rent but we need to get up to date. It is important and urgent! 

Since we started ARTHUB, 98% of the funds we invested were from personal funds of initiators and members and 2% came from a public grant. Meaning we invested our salaries in this project for the last two years.  But at the end of last year we did not receive the salaries for the last 6 month of work in 2017. It was friends and collaborators that borrowed us the money we needed in order to keep the space alive and continue. Now we have to get to zero in order to continue our project and our lives. 

The two most important things we miss are the two facilities without which we cannot move further. We have tree studios with no opening windows. We have to install opening systems in order to be able to ventilate all our spaces.  And the second bathroom. It is almost done. We have the room for the toilets and the sanitary installation but we need to bring the water in the rear part of the building, create a water reserve and install a water heating device. 

Next things on our list are finishing our common spaces. It includes insulating the sealing, installing electricity to those areas and gallery lights. There are projects that we need specialists for. Everything we could do ourselves we already did. Working materials and work hand is what we need the money for in order to finish our building site. 

And the last but not the least important is a little help in paying our last electricity and accountancy bills. After the long and difficult year of 2017 we had difficulties in paying these running costs that no grant accepts covering. 

What's in this for you?

If you got so far reading you are sure asking yourself what is it in this for you.

Well, we thought of this campaign as a huge pre-sales for our services and artistic objects. So no matter if your contribution is big or small you will get an art related service to go along your investment. 

Briefly, our campaign aims both natural persons as much as companies.

- As a person you can buy an art calendar, an art coloring book, a print or an original work of art.

- If you are in Bucharest you can also join our art courses, tours, art lectures or any other event that may occur in the next 50 days. 

As a company you may claim your perks in the form of tailor made courses for your employees, team building programs in our art space or even valuable art objects to match your collection. 

For all the folks abroad, any work of art would it be an original or a print, can be shipped anywhere in the world. Please, check up our art collection and pick your your favorite.

story:
Short Summary

Hi!  We're Amy and Andy Shears, and we're the owners of Muncie Map Co., LLC, which includes Amy Kay Photography - Newborn Portraiture, Fur in Focus Pet Portraits, and the Muncie Map Company.  We're raising money because our businesses have outgrown our garage and we need to move to a bigger and better space ASAP.

After celebrating one year in business, we are needing to move our company to a new space.  Though our company already profitable, we have to move ASAP because we've outgrown our current space, and we're having a hard time with our logistics in fulfilling orders because of those limitations.

We've found what we think is the perfect place, 111 E. Adams St. in Downtown Muncie, right behind Toys Forever.

This space will allow us the space we need to:

  • Host a dedicated photographic portrait studio for Amy Kay Photography and Fur in Focus​
    • comfortable setting for newborns and new moms
    • enclosed, specialized area for family pet portraits
    • flexibility with the space to adapt for special events
  • Allow production, consultation, and a retail gallery floor for Muncie Map Company​
    • would be (apparently) the only independent map shop in the state of Indiana
    • showcase producers of the Muncie Makers Market and our own local pride products
    • enough production space to hire interns and further develop eCommerce

It's ideally located in the revitalized and walking-friendly downtown, right along the First Thursday Gallery Walk and just a couple of blocks from Canan Commons and all of its summer events.  

But only with your help can we really pull this together in the timeline we're facing!  Luckily, we only need about ten grand after our investment... which to launch a new place, I feel like that's pretty respectable.

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for $10,101.  We plan to spend it like this:

  • $3500 for additional inventory and product samples
  • $1300 for retail fixtures, furniture, POS equipment, and gallery display
  • $1449 for studio equipment, computers and production equipment
  • $1652 for IngieGoGo fees and perk fulfillment
  • $2200 for other contingencies

For your support, we're offering a number of "perks."

 

The Impact

Supporting our efforts for this space does more than just help our young business get started.  Here's a walk-through of a 3D model of our vision for the space:

We're hoping that by the end of the year, this upgrade to our space will allow us to give back to our hometown and the world in the following ways:

  • Hire one full-time employee and two part-time employees
  • Host two interns per semester from the Ball State Department of Geography
  • Showcase a selection of goods from the local makers of the Muncie Makers Market, a display specially curated by market master Moth Danner
  • Bring more shopping traffic to downtown by offering:
    • Downtown's first pet-centric business in Fur in Focus
    • A new child-focused business in Amy Kay Photography
    • The only independent map shop in Indiana
    • The Muncie Makers Market showcase
    • A must-stop for any Muncie visitors wanting souvenirs or local pride gear

We're excited to contribute these things to our community, but we can't pull it off without your help.  We are completely out of room for our existing business and literally could not fathom doing any of these things from our current space, our (shared) garage.

Who We Are

Amy Shears is an award-winning photographic artist focusing on newborn babies and family pets.

  • Operator, Amy Kay Photography - Newborn Portraiture and Fur in Focus Pet Portraits
  • Business Manager, Muncie Map Company.
  • Ten years of experience as a professional photographer and sole proprietor
  • Named the Best Pet Photographer in the Cleveland, Ohio area (2009 and 2010)​
     

Andrew Shears PhD GISP is an award-winning professional cartographer, graphic designer and geographer.

  • BS, MS in Geography from Ball State, PhD in Geography from Kent State
  • Now Map Dude at Muncie Map Company after 12 year career in higher education
  • Has published hundreds of maps in various publications for a number of audiences
  • Muncie born and bred

We moved back to Muncie in May 2017 after 12 years away to start these businesses in our hometown and to contribute in any small way we can to the city's continued renaissance. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that's TOTALLY OKAY.  We know asking you to support a campaign like this is asking a lot, and god knows we've been too broke to give much help to a friend out a number of times in our lives, let alone an acquaintance or total stranger.  We won't take it personal in any way shape or form. Honestly, we're pretty stoked that you read this far down!

You can STILL help by:

  • Coming to see us when we open!
  • Showing us your art, what you make, or the Muncie-centric goods you've got on offer
  • Sharing this campaign with your friends on social media, or just telling other folks about what we're up to
  • Sending words of support -- this is not as easy as it looks!
  • Practicing various spiritual rituals, but please don't sacrifice anything
  • Coming to our GRAND OPENING EXTRAVAGANZA! We'll have live music, treats, give-aways and all kinds of fun

So, we'd love it if you helped us out!  Thanks for reading!
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hi!  We're Amy and Andy Shears, and we're the owners of Muncie Map Co., LLC, which includes Amy Kay Photography - Newborn Portraiture, Fur in Focus Pet Portraits, and the Muncie Map Company.  We're raising money because our businesses have outgrown our garage and we need to move to a bigger and better space ASAP.
After celebrating one year in business, we are needing to move our company to a new space.  Though our company already profitable, we have to move ASAP because we've outgrown our current space, and we're having a hard time with our logistics in fulfilling orders because of those limitations.
We've found what we think is the perfect place, 111 E. Adams St. in Downtown Muncie, right behind Toys Forever.
This space will allow us the space we need to:


Host a dedicated photographic portrait studio for Amy Kay Photography and Fur in Focus​
comfortable setting for newborns and new moms
enclosed, specialized area for family pet portraits
flexibility with the space to adapt for special events



Allow production, consultation, and a retail gallery floor for Muncie Map Company​
would be (apparently) the only independent map shop in the state of Indiana
showcase producers of the Muncie Makers Market and our own local pride products
enough production space to hire interns and further develop eCommerce



It's ideally located in the revitalized and walking-friendly downtown, right along the First Thursday Gallery Walk and just a couple of blocks from Canan Commons and all of its summer events.  
But only with your help can we really pull this together in the timeline we're facing!  Luckily, we only need about ten grand after our investment... which to launch a new place, I feel like that's pretty respectable.

What We Need & What You Get
We are asking for $10,101.  We plan to spend it like this:

$3500 for additional inventory and product samples
$1300 for retail fixtures, furniture, POS equipment, and gallery display
$1449 for studio equipment, computers and production equipment
$1652 for IngieGoGo fees and perk fulfillment
$2200 for other contingencies

For your support, we're offering a number of "perks."
 

The Impact
Supporting our efforts for this space does more than just help our young business get started.  Here's a walk-through of a 3D model of our vision for the space:

We're hoping that by the end of the year, this upgrade to our space will allow us to give back to our hometown and the world in the following ways:

Hire one full-time employee and two part-time employees

Host two interns per semester from the Ball State Department of Geography
Showcase a selection of goods from the local makers of the Muncie Makers Market, a display specially curated by market master Moth Danner
Bring more shopping traffic to downtown by offering:
Downtown's first pet-centric business in Fur in Focus
A new child-focused business in Amy Kay Photography
The only independent map shop in Indiana

The Muncie Makers Market showcase
A must-stop for any Muncie visitors wanting souvenirs or local pride gear



We're excited to contribute these things to our community, but we can't pull it off without your help.  We are completely out of room for our existing business and literally could not fathom doing any of these things from our current space, our (shared) garage.

Amy Shears is an award-winning photographic artist focusing on newborn babies and family pets.

Operator, Amy Kay Photography - Newborn Portraiture and Fur in Focus Pet Portraits
Business Manager, Muncie Map Company.
Ten years of experience as a professional photographer and sole proprietor
Named the Best Pet Photographer in the Cleveland, Ohio area (2009 and 2010)​ 

Andrew Shears PhD GISP is an award-winning professional cartographer, graphic designer and geographer.

BS, MS in Geography from Ball State, PhD in Geography from Kent State
Now Map Dude at Muncie Map Company after 12 year career in higher education
Has published hundreds of maps in various publications for a number of audiences
Muncie born and bred

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute, that's TOTALLY OKAY.  We know asking you to support a campaign like this is asking a lot, and god knows we've been too broke to give much help to a friend out a number of times in our lives, let alone an acquaintance or total stranger.  We won't take it personal in any way shape or form. Honestly, we're pretty stoked that you read this far down!
You can STILL help by:

Coming to see us when we open!
Showing us your art, what you make, or the Muncie-centric goods you've got on offer
Sharing this campaign with your friends on social media, or just telling other folks about what we're up to
Sending words of support -- this is not as easy as it looks!
Practicing various spiritual rituals, but please don't sacrifice anything

So, we'd love it if you helped us out!  Thanks for reading!

story:
What is "Art Fortunes" ?

That's a good question! In fact, the concept is simple, but it's kind of hard to explain. The video above should give you a good idea of the process and the product, and I’ve written about it several times on my blog (for example, here https://deborahsemeldemirtas.com/2015/12/30/predictions-predictions/ , here https://deborahsemeldemirtas.com/2016/07/12/prognostication/) and here https://deborahsemeldemirtas.com/2018/02/05/pick-a-card/).


As I explain in my blog posts, I started telling fortunes by “reading” my collages because I found that people were more interested in looking at the artwork when I could help them to find “a way in” through fortunetelling.

Sadly, most of us are so busy with the dramas of our daily lives that art is something we think of as a luxury rather than something that satisfies a fundamental human need. Art can be inspirational, but it can also be challenging, especially when it is artwork that demands our thoughtful time and attention.

I think this has a lot to do with the fact that most of us have lost any expectations that a work of art – particularly a work of so-called “contemporary art” – might hold any relevance for us in our daily lives. By contrast, we tend to be thrilled when someone - a fortuneteller, for example - can tell us something about ourselves. (Of course, good art does that, too!) So, I decided to “change the paradigm” from one of “finding meaning in an image as a work of art” to one of “finding meaning in an image as a fortunetelling card”. And by this very simple change in approach, I’ve been able to make connections, through art, with people who were complete strangers, and to build closer relationships with people who I knew, but not necessarily very well, and to create a situation that would allow them to get the pleasure of looking at artwork in a way that was meaningful to them.

So, in other words...

Art Fortunes is an object. To be precise, it’s 52 collages, each 10x15cm. I started making them when I noticed the incredible amount of paper that was accumulating in my studio: invitations to past exhibits, colour photocopies of old work, sketchbooks filled with sketches from museums, travels, etc., and the ever-growing pile of “junk” papers, from advertising bills stuck on my car windshield to “interesting” packing and packaging materials. I thought it would be ecologically beneficial to make artwork that recycled all this old paper instead of consuming new and sometimes hazardous material, and I also liked the idea of “cannabalizing” my old work to make new work.

Art Fortunes is an action. So, once you’ve got the cards, what do you do with them? Well, you could frame them and hang them on your walls, or give them away as presents for other people to hang on their walls. But if you ask me, the best thing to do with them is to put them into action as a tool for communicating with other people. So, in fact...

Art Fortunes is an interaction. You can use the deck of Art Fortunes to ‘read’ someone’s future. It’s really very simple and fun and extremely rewarding because it lets you enter into a one-on-one conversation with someone you might not know very well or even at all. Ideally, it’s a non-commercial interaction with another person in a public space – which is important, considering how few opportunities we have left for this!.

You can check out the links above to find out more about how I’ve done ‘readings’, and I’m including an informative (although brief and abstract) ‘User’s Guide’ with most of the campaign ‘perks’. What’s more, when you look over the ‘perks’, you’ll see that one of them is a ‘reading’ via Skype. (In keeping with the non-commercial spirit I’ve described, rather than ask for the reading for yourself, I'd rather you give it to a friend. And on this point, full disclosure: I have been given money for doing readings at an event, but the payment was from the organizer, so that none of the people who got readings had to pay for them; I’ve done readings for charity, so while the people being ‘read’ had to pay, they didn’t pay me; and recently I have had a few people voluntarily chip in to subsidize a beer or a coffee at a local cafe in exchange for readings, but I wouldn't want to make it a habit...)

What's this campaign about?

I like this work so much that I want to share it with as many people as possible, and I decided the best way to do this (beyond simply performing “readings” myself) would be through an Indiegogo crowdfunding campaign that will allow me to print and distribute a limited edition of 60 “decks” of “Art Fortunes” for other people to use.

I can think of three reasons why you might want to support this project: 1. You get to enjoy the artwork on your very own deck of Art Fortunes; 2. You can use the deck of “collage cards” to “tell fortunes” and connect with other people; and 3. You’ll be helping me to share my work and support me in creating more of it.

The 3 things you 'get' when you support this project:

  • To enjoy the artwork on your very own deck of Art Fortunes;
    A meaningful experience for you.
  • To connect with other people by "telling fortunes" using your deck of Art Fortunes;  A meaningful experience for you and for others.
  • 3. To support me in creating and sharing my work;
    A meaningful experience for you and for me.

(For an artist who works pretty much outside the "art world" and "gallery system", knowing people appreciate your work and are willing to help you make more of it is incredibly meaningful.) 

    Why a "limited edition of 60"?

    • Having a limited edition of "Art Fortunes" digital images created by an HP-certified printer maintains the value of this art object while making it accessible to more people.
    • Printing multiples of the entire deck rather than just individual cards lets other people use "Art Fortunes" as a form of non-commercial interaction rather than just as an object to be looked at and enjoyed.
    • Limiting the edition to 60 maximizes my time and energy so that I can share this work with others and then move on to new (and hopefully just as interesting) projects.

    So, Check out the Perks,

    and once again,

    Thank You For Your Consideration!

    Thanks to a previous Indiegogo campaign, I was able to complete another favorite project of mine, an installation that began life under the title "Have Your Photograph Taken as an Ottoman Princess" (https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/the-ottoman-princess-and-her-sisters/x/11441102#/). I hope you'll consider funding "Art Fortunes" yourself and/or sharing this campaign with others. If you've got any questions, just drop me a line...

story:
LE FESTIVAL

Après 5 ans d'organisation (Battles, Spectacle Nuit de la danse), une  forte mobilisation du public lors des dernières éditions de l'officielle Nuit de la danse, l'association Sénégal Battles met en place en décembre 2014, la première édition du Festival des arts d’attraction . C’est un événement annuel qui rassemble des artistes émergents de tout horizon le temps d’une semaine afin d'y valoriser leurs expressions artistiques. 

La programmation du Fest'Art-tracks évolue autour de quatre grands volets :

  • La formation : faire découvrir au grand public le monde de la danse, et renforcer sa pédagogie, sa créativité et ses techniques chez les danseurs professionnels.

        Workshop 2014: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1gYI2oJ809k

  •  La compétition : permettre aux danseurs de se faire juger, se comparer aux autres, améliorer des techniques et se remettre en question pour devenir meilleur.

       Battle Team All Style FAT 2016: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iIuvyh8l0uc

  • Le spectacle : proposer une scène professionnelle d’envergure, donnant l’exclusivité aux groupes émergents de toutes régions.

      Nuit de la danse 7ème édition FAT 2016: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zJevfjB14rQ

  • Photographie/ vidéo: donner la possibilité aux danseurs et au grand public d’obtenir une visibilité en termes d’image (Photos, vidéos).

Autres : discussion, exposition, jeux etc...

LES OBJECTIFS DU FESTIVAL

  • Mettre en lumière des capacités des artistes locaux
  • Faciliter l’accès à la danse  pour tous et par tous.
  • Inciter les artistes à entreprendre dans leur domaine afin de renforcer la promotion de l’art.
  • Permettre la mise en commun de ce qui fonctionne (et ce qui ne fonctionne pas) dans la danse.

Le  Festival s'est imposé au fil des années comme l’un des rendez-vous culturels majeurs. Il donne une opportunité unique aux artistes danseurs de tout horizon, d’apprendre, de compétir, de se produire et même aussi de construire leur propre image. Crée dans le but de rallier la danse aux autres formes d’art, d’où le nom festival des arts d’attraction,  il est devenu un évènement tant attendu et pas seulement par les danseurs mais aussi par d’autres artistes comme les photographes, Dj afin d’y présenter leurs œuvres.


Après une édition encore dans toutes les mémoires, nous mettons tout en œuvre pour que cette 4e édition soit à la hauteur de vos attentes.

L’ÉDITION 2016 EN CHIFFRE

  • Plus de 100 artistes professionnels et amateurs durant 3 jours de formations intenses
  • Plus de 60 participants pour 3 jours de battles
  • Un spectacle rassemblant 60 artistes (locaux et internationaux) sur une même scène
  • Environ 30 interlocuteurs dialoguant autour d’un sujet culturel, social et politique.
  • Environ 50 participants venus pour une rencontre photographique
  • 10 bénévoles durant tout le festival
  • Plus de 1500 festivaliers

QUI SOMMES-NOUS?

Présidée par Kirsner Tsengou Dingha (Danseur chorégraphe et entrepreneur), l’association SéNégal Battles SNB  est une association de danse créée le 19 septembre 2009 par l’initiative d’un groupe de jeunes danseurs de différentes nationalités,  animés par une même passion artistique. Elle a pour buts de promouvoir et d’aider des artistes danseurs du Sénégal et de tout horizon à se faire connaître et reconnaître, via l’organisation d’événements.

Après sept ans d’existence, elle a pu développer nombre d’activités autour de la danse dont l’officielle Nuit de la danse,  les cercles danse, la SNB Gladiator (Survivor battle), la Battle online. Tous ces  projets ont fini par la mener à l’organisation du FEST’ART-TRACKS (festival des arts d’attraction)  en 2014.

PROGRAMMATION 2017 4ème EDITION DU FEST'ART-TRACKS

4 JOURS TRÈS RICHE EN DANSE, ECHANGE, EMOTIONS, EXPRIENCES

20 DECEMBRE 

  • Conférence de presse
  • Workshop Grand Public pour tous et par tous (un moment d’échange et d’interaction entre le grand public et les artistes dans une ambiance dansée et sportive)
  • 5ème édition du Survivor Battle (compétition 1 vs 1 en danse debout et breakdance)

21 DECEMBRE

  • STAGE DE DANSE ouvert à tout public professionnel et amateur amoureux de la danse
  • Instant Shooting Dance (Impro Danse, jeux, photo, vidéo, appéritif).

22 DECEMBRE

  • STAGE DE DANSE ouvert à tout public professionnel et amateur amoureux de la danse
  • 8ème édition  L’OFFICIELLE NUIT DE LA DANSE (soirée de spectacle 2H – minimum 12 groupes sont prévus)

23 DECEMBRE

  • 4ème édition de la Battle Team All Style (compétition 3 vs 3 all style)

NB:

**Nous avons aussi prévu, une semaine de formation professionnelle destinée aux danseurs pro en amont du festival avec une restitution prévue à la Nuit de la danse (Impro Danse, jeux, photo et vidéo).

** Deux organisations de la Nuit de la danse sont prévues cette année, dans les régions de Thies et Saint Louis ainsi qu'en Afrique centrale (Cameroun) dans le but de sélectionner un groupe par région/pays pour participer à l’Officielle Nuit de la danse qui se tiendra à Dakar.

***

LE FEST'ART-TRACKS c'est aussi un échange multiculturel, et ils ont hâte d'y prendre part; aidez-nous à les faire venir:

HIRO    du Japon

YOUNES de la Belgique

MIRIAM  de l'Espagne

Et plein d'autres de l'afrique de l'ouest (Benin) et centrale (Cameroun)                     

MAIS OU PLUS PRECISEMENT ? 

Dakar, notre capitale détient un grand patrimoine culturel et a même aujourd’hui une notoriété mondiale, accueillant de nombreux touristes, artistes en tout genre tout au long de l’année. En 2016, Le Fest’Art-Tracks a su reconquérir cette ville, en occupant des lieux différents et en proposant un spectacle bien organisé.  

             

Chaque année nous occupons des sites différents afin de faire participer le public de chaque localité et faire venir d'autres dans les localités voisines. Nous avons plusieurs fois occupé des sites historiques, accessibles et sécurisés comme le Théâtre National Daniel Sorano, l'Institut Français de Dakar, la Place du souvenir etc. Cette année vous pouvez nous rejoindre au monument de la Renaissance, au Centre culturel Blaise Senghor, The Dancehall etc... 

A QUOI SERVIRA LA COLLECTE?

Les fonds récoltés lors de cette collecte  nous permettrons de couvrir une partie de nos besoins  de réalisation :

500 Dollars - Une installation technique de qualité et sécuritaire : l’espace spectacle du monument ainsi que l’esplanade arrière du Centre culturel blaise senghor doivent être aménagé pendant trois jours pour l'occasion, avec la mise en place d'une scène spectaculaire pour la NUIT DE LA DANSE. Un prestataire technique local avec ses équipes interviendront pour ce travail.                                        

780 dollars - La communication et la diffusion du festival, qui représentent toujours des coûts importants afin de promouvoir l'événement et de le faire rayonner régionalement et internationalement auprès du plus grand nombre. Nous souhaiterions également engager un prestataire dans le but de monter, d’éditer et de lancer les vidéos pendant le festival.     

556 dollars - Prix meilleur spectacle GROUPE Nuit de la danse

350 dollars - Prix meilleur spectacle SOLO Nuit de la danse                                           

925 dollars - Cachets artistiques Nuit de la danse                                                        

600 dollars - Perdiem 3 intervenants formations locales        

1289 dollars - Cachets,  transports et la restauration des artistes invités, venus de différents pays et régions qui dispenseront les cours, les conférences, spectacle et assureront le programme de qualité durant cette édition du festival.

Si notre collecte dépasse les 100%, nous pourrions ainsi remettre a niveau certains points tout aussi importants, tels que:

Ø  Les prix des deux battle

Ø  Une partie de Ressources Humaines (Speaker, DJ, photographe) en notant que nous comptons aussi faire appel  à certains bénévoles

Ø  La décoration des lieux

La programmation du Fest'Art-tracks évolue autour de quatre grands volets :
La formation : faire découvrir au grand public le monde de la danse, et renforcer sa pédagogie, sa créativité et ses techniques chez les danseurs professionnels.
        Workshop 2014: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1gYI2oJ809k
 La compétition : permettre aux danseurs de se faire juger, se comparer aux autres, améliorer des techniques et se remettre en question pour devenir meilleur.
       Battle Team All Style FAT 2016: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iIuvyh8l0uc
Le spectacle : proposer une scène professionnelle d’envergure, donnant l’exclusivité aux groupes émergents de toutes régions.
      Nuit de la danse 7ème édition FAT 2016: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zJevfjB14rQ
Photographie/ vidéo: donner la possibilité aux danseurs et au grand public d’obtenir une visibilité en termes d’image (Photos, vidéos).
Autres : discussion, exposition, jeux etc...

LES OBJECTIFS DU FESTIVAL

Mettre en lumière des capacités des artistes locaux
Faciliter l’accès à la danse  pour tous et par tous.
Inciter les artistes à entreprendre dans leur domaine afin de renforcer la promotion de l’art.
Permettre la mise en commun de ce qui fonctionne (et ce qui ne fonctionne pas) dans la danse.

Le  Festival s'est imposé au fil des années comme l’un des rendez-vous culturels majeurs. Il donne une opportunité unique aux artistes danseurs de tout horizon, d’apprendre, de compétir, de se produire et même aussi de construire leur propre image. Crée dans le but de rallier la danse aux autres formes d’art, d’où le nom festival des arts d’attraction,  il est devenu un évènement tant attendu et pas seulement par les danseurs mais aussi par d’autres artistes comme les photographes, Dj afin d’y présenter leurs œuvres.

Après une édition encore dans toutes les mémoires, nous mettons tout en œuvre pour que cette 4e édition soit à la hauteur de vos attentes.
L’ÉDITION 2016 EN CHIFFRE

Plus de 100 artistes professionnels et amateurs durant 3 jours de formations intenses
Plus de 60 participants pour 3 jours de battles
Un spectacle rassemblant 60 artistes (locaux et internationaux) sur une même scène
Environ 30 interlocuteurs dialoguant autour d’un sujet culturel, social et politique.
Environ 50 participants venus pour une rencontre photographique
10 bénévoles durant tout le festival
Plus de 1500 festivaliers

QUI SOMMES-NOUS?
Présidée par Kirsner Tsengou Dingha (Danseur chorégraphe et entrepreneur), l’association SéNégal Battles SNB  est une association de danse créée le 19 septembre 2009 par l’initiative d’un groupe de jeunes danseurs de différentes nationalités,  animés par une même passion artistique. Elle a pour buts de promouvoir et d’aider des artistes danseurs du Sénégal et de tout horizon à se faire connaître et reconnaître, via l’organisation d’événements.
Après sept ans d’existence, elle a pu développer nombre d’activités autour de la danse dont l’officielle Nuit de la danse,  les cercles danse, la SNB Gladiator (Survivor battle), la Battle online. Tous ces  projets ont fini par la mener à l’organisation du FEST’ART-TRACKS (festival des arts d’attraction)  en 2014.
PROGRAMMATION 2017 4ème EDITION DU FEST'ART-TRACKS

4 JOURS TRÈS RICHE EN DANSE, ECHANGE, EMOTIONS, EXPRIENCES
20 DECEMBRE 

Conférence de presse
Workshop Grand Public pour tous et par tous (un moment d’échange et d’interaction entre le grand public et les artistes dans une ambiance dansée et sportive)
5ème édition du Survivor Battle (compétition 1 vs 1 en danse debout et breakdance)

21 DECEMBRE

STAGE DE DANSE ouvert à tout public professionnel et amateur amoureux de la danse
Instant Shooting Dance (Impro Danse, jeux, photo, vidéo, appéritif).

22 DECEMBRE

STAGE DE DANSE ouvert à tout public professionnel et amateur amoureux de la danse
8ème édition  L’OFFICIELLE NUIT DE LA DANSE (soirée de spectacle 2H – minimum 12 groupes sont prévus)

23 DECEMBRE
4ème édition de la Battle Team All Style (compétition 3 vs 3 all style)
NB:
**Nous avons aussi prévu, une semaine de formation professionnelle destinée aux danseurs pro en amont du festival avec une restitution prévue à la Nuit de la danse (Impro Danse, jeux, photo et vidéo).
** Deux organisations de la Nuit de la danse sont prévues cette année, dans les régions de Thies et Saint Louis ainsi qu'en Afrique centrale (Cameroun) dans le but de sélectionner un groupe par région/pays pour participer à l’Officielle Nuit de la danse qui se tiendra à Dakar.
***
LE FEST'ART-TRACKS c'est aussi un échange multiculturel, et ils ont hâte d'y prendre part; aidez-nous à les faire venir:
HIRO    du Japon
YOUNES de la Belgique
MIRIAM  de l'Espagne
Et plein d'autres de l'afrique de l'ouest (Benin) et centrale (Cameroun)                     
MAIS OU PLUS PRECISEMENT ? 
Dakar, notre capitale détient un grand patrimoine culturel et a même aujourd’hui une notoriété mondiale, accueillant de nombreux touristes, artistes en tout genre tout au long de l’année. En 2016, Le Fest’Art-Tracks a su reconquérir cette ville, en occupant des lieux différents et en proposant un spectacle bien organisé.  
              
Chaque année nous occupons des sites différents afin de faire participer le public de chaque localité et faire venir d'autres dans les localités voisines. Nous avons plusieurs fois occupé des sites historiques, accessibles et sécurisés comme le Théâtre National Daniel Sorano, l'Institut Français de Dakar, la Place du souvenir etc. Cette année vous pouvez nous rejoindre au monument de la Renaissance, au Centre culturel Blaise Senghor, The Dancehall etc... 
A QUOI SERVIRA LA COLLECTE?
Les fonds récoltés lors de cette collecte  nous permettrons de couvrir une partie de nos besoins  de réalisation :
500 Dollars - Une installation technique de qualité et sécuritaire : l’espace spectacle du monument ainsi que l’esplanade arrière du Centre culturel blaise senghor doivent être aménagé pendant trois jours pour l'occasion, avec la mise en place d'une scène spectaculaire pour la NUIT DE LA DANSE. Un prestataire technique local avec ses équipes interviendront pour ce travail.                                        
780 dollars - La communication et la diffusion du festival, qui représentent toujours des coûts importants afin de promouvoir l'événement et de le faire rayonner régionalement et internationalement auprès du plus grand nombre. Nous souhaiterions également engager un prestataire dans le but de monter, d’éditer et de lancer les vidéos pendant le festival.     
556 dollars - Prix meilleur spectacle GROUPE Nuit de la danse
350 dollars - Prix meilleur spectacle SOLO Nuit de la danse                                           
925 dollars - Cachets artistiques Nuit de la danse                                                        
600 dollars - Perdiem 3 intervenants formations locales        
1289 dollars - Cachets,  transports et la restauration des artistes invités, venus de différents pays et régions qui dispenseront les cours, les conférences, spectacle et assureront le programme de qualité durant cette édition du festival.
Si notre collecte dépasse les 100%, nous pourrions ainsi remettre a niveau certains points tout aussi importants, tels que:
Ø  Les prix des deux battle
Ø  Une partie de Ressources Humaines (Speaker, DJ, photographe) en notant que nous comptons aussi faire appel  à certains bénévoles
Ø  La décoration des lieux

story:
"Made together, weaving links between artisans and creative practitioners"

Your impact

Support the power and niceness of handmade with natural materials as it has been done for millennia and their efforts to preserve and revitalize their textile traditions.  

New York will receive an ancestral knowledge and in exchange their community will develop their own entrepreneurship abilities and will open new collaborations with designers, artists, and creative practitioners.

Timothy Ccarita Sacaca is a master weaver, natural dyes researcher and a weaver trainer from the district of Pitumarca, Cusco, Peru.

For decades, Timoteo has formed groups of weavers in natural yarning, weaving and dyeing techniques. He has trained weavers in a mothers' club in Ccapacchapi. He has founded weavers' associations in several communities. In Pitumarca: Munaik Tiklla, Inka Pachacutec, Ñaupa Away Karwi Association, Uchu Llukllu, Wasa Pampa and Labraco. In Sant Pablo the association of Santa Barbara; And in Lares, Chokecancha. In these associations of weavers continues to participate teaching to spin, to weave and to dye.

Albert Gomà Sala, from Social innova, met Timoteo in 2014 introduced by Francesco, the son of Timoteo who is living in Italy. Afterwards, we decided to make a better promotion for their products together thanks to our friendship.

We need your support to  build a network of people who share common values on both sides of the World.

Values of perseverance, sustainability, transparency, effort and humility, the same values that I was inspired and I've learned by timoteo and his community.

What We Need & What You Get

The workshop

Timoteo will run a workshop in the Textile Arts Center in Manhattan. 26 W. 8th Street New York, NY 10011.

http://www.textileartscenter.com/

INFO ABOUT THE WORKSHOP AND THE ATELIER

The workshop will be an experience that stays with you for a lifetime.

The workshop includes demonstration of:

-Spinning, twisting and making the yarn using natural wool and alpaca from Peru.

-Dyeing with natural Andean dyes (plant-based dyes brought from Peru).

Colors include: Cochineal (pink, violet, red), Qolli (yellow and orange), Chillka (green).

-Weaving on a waist loom, a small-size loom that weavers use to produce work will be used to demonstrate and experiment.

You will discover that symbols and patterns in Andean textiles it's something more than a design, you will know their true significance and importance.

We will perform the Andean ritual “pago a la tierra”  (payment to the land), an offering to Pachamama or Mother Earth thanking for the product she has given us.

The last part of the workshop allows for collaborative design with Timoteo with the methodology of Social innova for co creation. Participants will have the chance of discussing and hands-on try the process of weaving and creating patterns.

The atelier is a shorter workshop, without dyeing.

TEXTILE ARTS CENTER

Textile Arts Center (TAC) is a NYC-based resource facility dedicated to raising awareness and understanding of textiles through creative educational programs for children and adults. We are thrilled to be hosting this workshop with Timeteo.

At TAC, we aspire to unify the textile community and advocate for the handmade by providing accessible, skills-based classes that reinvigorate engagement with traditional crafts. Techniques like weaving, sewing, and dyeing are practical, connective, and process-driven -- common denominators for designers, artists, and creative practitioners around the world. Because these activities are so widely used, they help to foster community and bring creativity back into our daily lives. They are part of our collective history and vital to our ongoing expressions of design, art, and culture. Textile Arts Center aspires to unify and empower the textile community, and advocate for the handmade.

The art pieces

All their works starts in hand-spinning natural fibers into yarn. “Spinning” is simply twisting fibers together so they make a strong, usable cord.

They dye the yarn with natural dyes. Cochinilla for pink, violet and red (Dactylopus coccus); Qolli for yellow and orangev (Buddleja coriacea); chillka for green (Baccharis latifolia) or indigo for blue (Indigofera).

Thanks to Timoteo and his community, rich, earthy reds, purples, greens and gold again suffuse the natural fibers spinned by hand. When you see their works, you are surrounded by colors reminiscent of hues achieved by the Inca and even older Peruvian civilizations.

They patiently weave in a waist loom.

A Lliklla done by the ligui technique in 30 days. Natural yarn and dyes. Alpaca and sheep wool. 60cm. x 80 cm.

Chalina (scarf) done by the patapayay technique.  Natural yarn and dyes 20 cm x 180 cm. Alpaca wool.

Tapiz, natural yarn and dyes. 150 cm x 80 cm. Done in 30 days. Alpaca wool.

Poncho. Natural yarn and natural colors without dyes. 140 cm x 180 cm. Alpaca wool. 60 days of work. Alpaca wool.

The exhibition

 There will be an exhibition of their pieces of art in the Ggrippo art + design gallery in New York. http://ggripposhop.bigcartel.com

The problem

The textile industry has a huge impact on the environment from blenching, dyeing, to manufacturing process.  Neverthless, the imperative of Timoteo is to use natural dyes and alpaca wool.

The  increase in demand for alpaca wool products and the impact of the tourism industry in Cusco has given rise to many counterfeits and blends making it almost impossible to distinguish between the actual and fake. Also, almost everybody in Cusco is using industrial yarns.

In addition, in spite of the demand, very little has trickled down to the alpaca communities and artisans who are the backbone of this industry, and a lot for the Peruvian big industries of yarn and the middlemen who takes advantage of the communities and their art.

Where the funds go?

All the funds raised by this campaign will be used to afford the travel costs to New York for 8 days.

"*we will neutralise the carbon footprint of our trip/flight by supporting natives communities and contributing to the conservation of the Peruvian Amazon through REGENERA" 

link:

https://www.natureservicesperu.com/regenera-en

Risks & Challenges

New York is the first destination. Depending on the result of this campaign we will repeat the campaign travelling to Paris, Milan or Barcelona.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please if you can't contribute just get the word out and make some noise about our campaign in the social networks and to your relatives.

Creative Team

Timoteo Ccarita Sacaca and the association of Munay Tiklla.

Albert Gomà Sala. The Coordinator, from Social innova  http://socialinnovacio.com

Andrea Delgado Céspedes: Photography

GGrippo, Creative Director of GGrippo art+design

Textile Arts Center: The place where Timoteo will teach his lesson 

Director: Kelly Valletta

Director of Artist Programs + Outreach: Isa Rodrigues

General Manager: Kira Silver

Maria-Saroja Ponnambalan: Video edition

Eusebio Huahuarunta, Municipality of Pitumarca: Video recording

The backstage

 

Maria, Albert and Andrea, the creative design team in the Monkey temple with our ridiculous hats, Cusco

Albert, working hard

Eusebio, our camaraman from the municipality of Pitumarca

story:
Short Summary

We are STEAMROLLER Dance Company, we have been producing high quality dance performance in the Bay Area for the past 20 years.  Our dances share a queer, Asian American perspective that shatters mainstream notions of identity. We fill this vacuum in our representation with a fierce voice.

Your support goes towards compensating our collaborating artist, who we see as critical in fufulling our creative vision. This campaign is part of the company's ongoing priority in fairly compensating our collaborators because we know that this is key in being able to continue our long term goal of organizational stability.
story_txt:
Short Summary
We are STEAMROLLER Dance Company, we have been producing high quality dance performance in the Bay Area for the past 20 years.  Our dances share a queer, Asian American perspective that shatters mainstream notions of identity. We fill this vacuum in our representation with a fierce voice.
Your support goes towards compensating our collaborating artist, who we see as critical in fufulling our creative vision. This campaign is part of the company's ongoing priority in fairly compensating our collaborators because we know that this is key in being able to continue our long term goal of organizational stability.

story:
It all started as any crazy, almost impossible idea would...with a question:

 “What if we built the World's Largest Bong?"

Going big isn’t necessarily new; from the World’s Largest Ketchup Bottle to the biggest Idaho Potato ever grown, upping the ante when it comes to size is a time-honored tradition. So why not commission the world’s largest glass bong?

Timing is everything, especially when it comes to cannabis. Our team realized that turning an idea like this into reality would be tricky because up to a few years ago, this kind of shi*t could put you in handcuffs (and not the fun ones).

We knew if we built it, they would come (we sure as hell would), but where is the best place for the world’s biggest bong? California and Colorado seemed too obvious, but then Las Vegas, with its bigger than life reputation, paved the way for us by legalizing recreational cannabis.

Every year, people from all over the world flock to the ‘City of Sin’ to indulge and make their dreams a reality, making it THE perfect home for The World’s Largest Bong. As more pieces fell into place, the seed of our idea blossomed to include a fully built out, multi-sensory cannabis experience that celebrates cannabis by bringing together art, culture, and history.

With this venture, our team is taking you from seed to sack in a way that has never been experienced before: an enormous cannabis seed cross-section waterbed, larger than life LED grow room, a 6' slide into a nug pool, a climbable topper buds. The list goes on.

We called it, Cannabition, an Immersive Cannabis Museum. 

Making a space for the world’s biggest bong in Las Vegas

After months of planning, making phone calls, and looking at dozens of sites, we finally found a home for Cannabition and the World’s Largest Bong: Downtown Las Vegas. Located right in the center of the Fremont Street Experience, we discovered  10,000 sq/ft of space and a two-story staircase perfect for housing our 24-foot Bongzilla. With more than 18 million tourists stopping by each year, the historic Downtown area of Las Vegas is the perfect place for Cannabition.

Blowing our bong into existence with Jerome Baker Designs

Next we had to figure which artist could handle the nearly impossible feat of building a massive glass bong that is beautiful, hittable, and unforgettable. That was when we realized, we would have go to the very best glass blowers in the world: Jerome Baker Designs.

Jerome Baker creates the most iconic glass pieces in the world

When we met with Jerome and his team, we asked them our million-dollar question:

"What if we built the World's Largest Bong?"

"How big?"

"24 feet."

"Holy. Shit."

The excitement was palpable and, just like that, our journey to creating the World's Largest Bong began.

Cannabition Floor Plan - World's Largest Bong

Building Bongzilla and getting it to Las Vegas

So now we've got the right people, the location, the time, and the materials we need to make turn Bongzilla into a reality.

To help complete this project, our new friends at Jerome Baker Designs and Chihuly Glass are getting ready to build Bongzilla in Seattle over 4/20 weekend. With more than 50 years of collective glass blowing experience, they’ll be working around the clock to carefully craft this one-of-a-kind, glass monster. The bong will be built in large sections and shipped to Las Vegas for assembly just in time for the Grand Opening of Cannabition on the July 1, 2017.

An ode to all that is cannabis-related

From commissioning Bongzilla to building out our space, Cannabition has been a serious undertaking, requiring lots of time, politicking with government officials, and more than $3 million dollars invested in to building an experience people around the world can immerse themselves in.

How to stake your claim on a piece of cannabis history

Through Cannabition, we are creating an experience that will transcend the way people experience the world of legal cannabis. Since this is such a unique, never-been-done-before project, we need the help from the global cannabis community to make our vision a reality.

Spanning from simple weekly updates on construction progress and exclusive Cannabition merchandise to naming rights to the World's Largest Bong (!!) and a VIP trip to Vegas (flight included), you have a chance to be a part of something that will expand the world’s understanding of cannabis history, the art of glass blowing, and new cultural norms through experiences.

Thanks for joining us on this ride - we're excited to have you!

That was when we realized, we would have go to the very best glass blowers in the world: Jerome Baker Designs.Jerome Baker creates the most iconic glass pieces in the worldWhen we met with Jerome and his team, we asked them our million-dollar question:"What if we built the World's Largest Bong?""How big?""24 feet.""Holy. Shit."The excitement was palpable and, just like that, our journey to creating the World's Largest Bong began.Cannabition Floor Plan - World's Largest BongBuilding Bongzilla and getting it to Las VegasSo now we've got the right people, the location, the time, and the materials we need to make turn Bongzilla into a reality.To help complete this project, our new friends at Jerome Baker Designs and Chihuly Glass are getting ready to build Bongzilla in Seattle over 4/20 weekend. With more than 50 years of collective glass blowing experience, they’ll be working around the clock to carefully craft this one-of-a-kind, glass monster. The bong will be built in large sections and shipped to Las Vegas for assembly just in time for the Grand Opening of Cannabition on the July 1, 2017.An ode to all that is cannabis-relatedFrom commissioning Bongzilla to building out our space, Cannabition has been a serious undertaking, requiring lots of time, politicking with government officials, and more than $3 million dollars invested in to building an experience people around the world can immerse themselves in.How to stake your claim on a piece of cannabis historyThrough Cannabition, we are creating an experience that will transcend the way people experience the world of legal cannabis. Since this is such a unique, never-been-done-before project, we need the help from the global cannabis community to make our vision a reality.Spanning from simple weekly updates on construction progress and exclusive Cannabition merchandise to naming rights to the World's Largest Bong (!!) and a VIP trip to Vegas (flight included), you have a chance to be a part of something that will expand the world’s understanding of cannabis history, the art of glass blowing, and new cultural norms through experiences.Thanks for joining us on this ride - we're excited to have you!

story:
Our Project: MythoFutuRiddim

I'm A.C. Evans a Brooklyn based curator, artist and designer. MythoFutuRiddim is a self-funded pop-up exhibition featuring the work of a select group of emerging artists who explore ritual, cultural mythology, Afrofuturism and constructed identity.  The name, MythoFutuRiddim, evolves from the term Afrofuturism and is also a combination of Mythology, Futurism, and Riddim/music.  The exhibition creates a conceptual dialogue to explore the ways these ideas contribute to the creative process. With this exhibition and those that follow I'm hoping to help artists actively develop and maintain creative careers on their own terms. 

This exhibition will be the first in series of self-funded exhibitions with a focus on connecting emerging/early-career artists and new collectors in hopes of creating long-standing sustainable relationships between artists and patrons.

Your patronage will make a direct and tangible impact on the careers of the artists involved. Our overall goal for this exhibition is to provide a platform for artists to discuss, exhibit, promote and potentially sell their work to individuals interested in developing the long-term growth of early-career artists.

Meet the Artists

Bree Person

Raised in the South Bronx, Bree Person is a double-major in Anthropology and Media Society at Purchase College.  Combining her lifelong passion for Art and construction, Bree has taught herself to build the things she wants to see and experience.  At MythoFutuRiddim, Bree will be displaying Urban Renewal, an installation that will shed light on the disenfranchisement and social stigmas that go along with life in the inner-city projects.

Follow Bree on Instagram

Harlan Ballogg

Originally from Chicago, Harlan Ballogg moved to New York in 2013 to study Illustration at
the School of Visual Arts. After obtaining a BFA degree, Harlan remained in New York to begin
developing a body of paintings. His work often depicts portraits of people of color and those
who have been marginalized by general society. Harlan's portraits serve as a direct response to art history’s habit of defaulting to whitewashed portraiture. Aside from his personal work, Harlan also works part time as an Artisan for Louis Vuitton and muralist for Overall Murals.

Follow Harlan on Instagram

PIXEL the Artist

PIXEL the Artist is a Jamaican-American Surrealist Artist, Illustrator, Animator and Installation Artist from Tampa, Florida. Known for her constant use of shapes in her acrylic paintings, PIXEL’s themes are often inspired by electronic and hip-hop music, aliens, and outer space. She enjoy's creating hidden worlds and secret codes often brought on by introspection.

PIXEL attended Pratt Institute in Brooklyn, NY where she studied Illustration and Animation. She has been featured on Afropunk and Revolt TV and has painted for Adult Swim comedian Eric Andre and Actor Shia Labeouf.

PIXEL is currently making artwork for the people of Planet Earth until she returns to her home planet.

Follow PIXEL the Artist on Instagram , Twitter or FB

 

Wi-Moto Nyoka

Wi-Moto Nyoka is invested in how the qualities of cinematography can be fused with live performance, as well as how film and episodic/web narratives can be deepened with corresponding live performances and immersive installations. My primary means of exploring this is through diasporic narratives in film, theater and music. I feel that transmedia, and by that I mean story world creations, provides opportunities and points of entry for communities that have been combating erasure for centuries. Incorporating new media technologies into my artistic cultural practices has been an act of resistance, survival and self-care. My goal is to continue to create hybrid performance projects with artists around the world.

At MythoFutuRiddim Wi-Moto will perform, Hair Did  a durational performance art piece that explores the matriarchal tradition of hair braiding within the African Diaspora. The piece currently operates on three levels:

  • Audio- a crowdsourced audio composition of women telling the story of the first time they got their hair braided. 
  • Visual- a textile creation comprised of gauze as a metaphor for healing.
  • Performance- actual hair twisting. The performance is over when my hair is 'did'.

Hair Did has been presented at the 5th Annual Black Artstory Month, The Altar: Rituals of Healing In The African Diaspora. 

Follow Wi-Moto on Instagram

Become an Art patron

We are aiming for an initial goal of $4,000, to cover the expenses of self-funding this pop-up exhibition, which will run from Friday July 13 until Sunday July 15 2018.

Here is a breakdown of our budget:

Donations will result in the direct patronage of some very talented emerging artists who are building the important groundwork for their careers.  We aim to create a community minded, all encompassing space where artists, collectors, and art lovers from all cultural and financial backgrounds can fellowship and build an atmosphere of support.

The Venue

The gallery space at 100 Bogart in Bushwick, Brooklyn is an 1800 sq. ft. multi-purpose event space featuring educational and cultural programming.

 

 

Schedule

Friday July 13 - Gallery Hours 6PM - 10 PM

6 PM - Opening Reception

8PM - Hair Did, a duration performance by Wi-Moto Nyoka

Saturday July 14 - Gallery Hours 12PM - 8 PM

9:30 AM - 12:30 PM - MythoFutuRiddim is for the Kids!

On Saturday morning from 9:30 AM - 12 PM,  the gallery will be made available to parents with children between the ages of 2yrs - 12yrs for a special children's tour and Design Gym.

Children will be given a curator led tour through the exhibition, followed by an activity time where children will be allowed to create, display and discuss their works of Art. Using examples from the exhibition, attention will be given to how Basic Elements of Design (Line, Shape, + Space) have been employed to create the work featured in the exhibition.

**Materials and Snacks will be provided**

Sunday July 15 - Gallery Hours 12PM - 6 PM

4 PM - 6PM - Artists Presentations + Discussion

Participating artists will give ten-minute lightning talks about the foundational concepts of their art practice.  After the presentations, there will be an open public discussion around how the concepts of mythology, futurism, and riddim/music influence the making of art.

6PM - Closing Ceremony

Impact & Traction

Your contribution to this project will make a direct impact on the lives of the artists involved.  By participating in helping us bring this concept to life, you are showing that there is demand for artist-created, patron-driven projects.  By becoming a patron, you are illustrating that there is a vibrant community wiling to help artists who want to build their careers on their own terms.  In the future, we hope to increase the length of shows, include more artists and offer more creative opportunities for artist patronage.

Risks & Challenges

Personally, this project represents the manifestation of an idea I’ve long hand on how to create opportunities for artists to share their special gifts.  Furthermore, this project is so very important because it represents risk, fear, challenges and most importantly opportunity.  Risk is an important component of all our lives. If we don't risk change, we take the chance of never realizing the things we're meant to accomplish. This project also represents a direct challenge to fear, and a more direct confrontation to the idea that Art should only be produced and experienced by individuals with a certain level of "knowledge", "education" and/or financial means.

Donor Perks, Original Art and V.I.P’s

All donors at any level will have their name included in the Patrons of the Arts list which will be prominently posted at the exhibition.  Your name will also be included on the MythoFutuRiddim website as a Patron of the Arts.

Along with the chance to make a quantifiable difference in the life of a living artist we’re also offering limited edition posters, screen-prints, and sticker-packs.  We are also offering a chance to acquire original works of art. If demand is strong and we’re able to surpass our goal we plan to offer a private V.I.P viewing for the exhibition on July 12, where each donor will be able to meet the participating artists and discuss direct patronage opportunities.

Money ain't everything

Last but definitely not least, currency or money is simply a tangible form of energy.  Your energy patronage of our project will be directly transformed into making more Art. Sometimes though, you just don't have it and we get that.  Never fear, you can still help immensely by:

  • Sharing our campaign with your Email Contacts or connections on LinkedIn
  • Liking and Posting on Facebook
  • Following us and the individual artists on Instagram and/or Twitter. DM them and tell them how much you like their work
  • Use the hashtag #MythoFutuRiddim on your platforms to help us spread the word
  • Tell a colleague, family member, friend, or significant other about MythoFutuRiddim;
  • and probably the most important thing of all, BECOME A PATRON OF THE ARTS in your surrounding community in any capacity you can

Thank you kindly for your time, attention and consideration.

A.C. Evans, Bree Person, Harlan Ballogg, Pixel the Artist and Wi-Moto Nyoka

story:
Hey there! My name is Shauna (aka Cat), and I'm an Irish artist yearning to go home. Will you join me? 

YOU. ME. AND THE WEST-COAST OF IRELAND!

Even though I currently live and create in the Austrian hills of the sound of music – in the company of my man, his mam, and our three cats - I cannot shake the feeling of "homesickness", whenever my gaze wanders across the landscape that surrounds me.

It’s beautiful, but it doesn’t feel like home. The kind of home, where even the thought of litter on the street gives you a nostalgic pang…

To me, Ireland is not only my ancestral home, but my emotional home as well. And I know that many of you feel the same way. As an Irish person gallivanting around Europe, I have come across two reactions to me being from Ireland:

1)      OMG! I love Ireland and I can’t wait to get back there!

2)      OMG! I’ve never been there, but I can’t wait to go there in the future!

This proves to me that there is something about the Irish landscape, the people, the way of life, and the constant dampness [just kidding…sort of] that makes it a place many feel drawn to on a very emotional level.

That’s why, with your support, I’ve decided to turn my month-long vacation in August into an artist residency. By doing that, I have the funds to not only explore the ruins and the cliffs of Kerry [and find the best bakery], but I can use all of my creative skills to share the experience with you and make you feel like you were there with me!

WILL YOU SPEND ALL THE MONEY ON CAKE?

First of all, no. But I know how scary it can feel to support a stranger on the internet, so let me tell you what your contribution will help me do:

  • Finance a share of the flight and accomodation costs
  • Allow me to pay for ferries, museums, and other cultural explorations that I want to share with you
  • Pay for a share of my material expenses
  • Pay for a share of the production costs of your perks

and, maybe, a slice of rhubarb crumble....

ARE YOU EVEN ABLE TO PAINT?

You're going to have to trust me on this one, but if you still feel like you want to make sure, you can have a look at some of my work here: http://www.catdepillar.com/artwork/

And, in case you feel curious but also too lazy to check my website [I think we're soulmates], here are some examples of my work,

and the type of abstract landscapes I do [this piece is done in watercolours on wood].

WHAT'S IN IT FOR ME, YOU ASK?

I know that you're not interested in financing my passion of finding and eating the best scones in Dingle....which is why I have a plan B that I think you might find a little more interesting!

In exchange for your contribution to my artist residency, I offer many different perks that I think you might enjoy. And: If you can think of anything else you'd like, I am open to suggestions! [No, I'm not going to send you sausage-rolls Mam.....]

5 € // A BIG Thank You + Access to My Secret Blog

For 5 € you are not only the recipient of the biggest virtual hug ever, but you also get access to my secret blog, where I document my artist residency and take you behind the scenes. 

10 € // The Above + A Postcard Sent to You From Ireland  

In addition to the 5 € perks, I will send you a postcard from Ireland via snail-mail!

  • Access to secret artist residency blog
  • A postcard sent to you via snail-mail

15 € // Secret Blog + A Postcard Set 

For this tier you have access to my secret blog and receive a pack of 4 postcards with illustrations from my trip to Ireland. 

  • Access to secret artist residency blog
  • A set of 4 postcards with my Ireland illustrations 

20 € // Ireland on Postcards Package

For 20 € you receive access to my secret artist residency blog, a postcard sent to you from Ireland via snail-mail, and a set of 4 postcards with illustrations from my trip. 

  • Access to secret artist residency blog
  • A postcard sent to you via snail-mail
  • A set of 4 postcards with my Ireland illustrations 

25 € // Ireland on Postcards Package + A Fine-Art Print

For 25 € you receive all the perks from the previous tier, plus a DIN A4 fine-art print of one of my Ireland illustrations.

  • Access to secret artist residency blog
  • A postcard sent to you via snail-mail
  • A set of 4 postcards with my Ireland illustrations 
  • A DIN A 4 fine-art print of one of my Ireland illustrations [your choice]

30 € // The Real Deal Package + PDF

For the "Real Deal Package" you receive an original illustration the size of a postcard sent to you from Ireland, plus the PDF version of the artist residency book. The book will be filled with my best photographs, sketches, illustrations and stories from the residency and will available to you as a PDF.  

  • Access to secret artist residency blog
  • An original watercolour painting the size of a postcard sent to you via snail-mail
  • Access to the PDF version of my artist residency book

35 € // The Collector Package

This package is for real art and Ireland lovers. Not only will you receive a wonderful collection of illustrations as prints, but you'll also receive an original watercolour painting. In addition, you will have access to the PDF version of my artist residency book, which is filled with even more illustrations, sketches, photographs and stories of my trip to Ireland. 

  • Access to secret artist residency blog
  • A set of 4 postcards with my Ireland illustrations 
  • A DIN A 4 fine-art print of one of my Ireland illustrations [your choice]
  • An original watercolour painting the size of a postcard sent to you via snail-mail
  • Access to the PDF version of my artist residency book

40 € // The Book + Postcards

For 40 €, you will receive the printed version of my artist residency book in addition to a set of four postcards with my illustrations. You will also have access to my secret blog. 

  • Access to secret artist residency blog
  • A postcard sent to you via snail-mail
  • A DIN A 4 fine-art print of one of my Ireland illustrations [your choice] 
  • The printed edition of my artist residency book 

45 € // The Book Collector Package

For this package you will receive my artist residency book, full of illustrations, stories, and photographs of my trip, in addition to 4 postcards printed with my work and a fine-art print of an illustration of your choice. 

  • Access to secret artist residency blog
  • A set of 4 postcards with my Ireland illustrations 
  • A DIN A 4 fine-art print of one of my Ireland illustrations [your choice]
  • The printed edition of my artist residency book 

    50 € // The "Were You There?" Package

    This package will make you feel like you were there with me in Ireland and you will receive all of the above perks in one glorious package:

    • Access to secret artist residency blog
    • A set of 4 postcards with my Ireland illustrations 
    • A DIN A 4 fine-art print of one of my Ireland illustrations [your choice]
    • An original watercolour painting the size of a postcard sent to you via snail-mail
    • The printed edition of my artist residency book 

    60 € // The Art Collector Package 

    For this package you will receive a DIN A 5 original painting in addition to access to my secret blog, the postcard set and fine-art print, and the PDF edition of my artist residency book. 

    • Access to secret artist residency blog
    • A set of 4 postcards with my Ireland illustrations 
    • A DIN A 4 fine-art print of one of my Ireland illustrations [your choice]
    • An original DIN A 5 watercolour illustration
    • Access to the PDF version of my artist residency book

    65 € // The Art Collector Package + Book 

    For this package you will receive a DIN A 5 original painting in addition to access to my secret blog, the postcard set and fine-art print, and the PDF edition of my artist residency book. 

    • Access to secret artist residency blog
    • A set of 4 postcards with my Ireland illustrations 
    • A DIN A 4 fine-art print of one of my Ireland illustrations [your choice]
    • An original DIN A 5 watercolour illustration
    • The printed edition of my artist residency book + PDF

    (Most of this perk ships from Austria/Ireland, international duty taxes may apply upon arrival when shipping outside the EU)

    105 € + shipping // The Ultimate Experience Package + Surprise

    For this package I will stalk you with my gratitude forever....oh, and you'll get ALL other perks, too. In addition, you will receive a tea cup made by an Irish potterer with your name on it. 

    • Access to secret artist residency blog
    • A postcard sent to you via snail-mail
    • A set of 4 postcards with my Ireland illustrations 
    • A DIN A 4 fine-art print of one of my Ireland illustrations [your choice]
    • An original DIN A 5 + DIN A 6 watercolour illustration
    • The printed edition of my artist residency book + PDF
    • A tea cup made by an Irish potterer with your name on it

    (Most of this perk ships from Austria/Ireland, international duty taxes may apply upon arrival when shipping outside the EU)

    150 € + shipping // The Ultimate Art Experience Package + Book + Surprise

    For this package I will - also - stalk you with my gratitude forever....and instead of the smaller watercolour paintings on paper, you will receive a DIN A 4 watercolour painting on wood!

    • Access to secret artist residency blog
    • A postcard sent to you via snail-mail
    • A set of 4 postcards with my Ireland illustrations 
    • A DIN A 4 fine-art print of one of my Ireland illustrations [your choice]
    • An original DIN A 4 watercolour illustration on wood
    • The printed edition of my artist residency book + PDF

    (Most of this perk ships from Austria/Ireland, international duty taxes may apply upon arrival when shipping outside the EU)

    200 € // The Mother of Packages 

    At this stage, I have died of gratitude. Even so, you will still receive the following perks:

    • Access to secret artist residency blog
    • A postcard sent to you via snail-mail
    • A set of 4 postcards with my Ireland illustrations 
    • A DIN A 4 fine-art print of one of my Ireland illustrations [your choice]
    • An original watercolour painting the size of a postcard sent to you via snail-mail
    • An original DIN A 4 watercolour illustration on wood
    • The printed edition of my artist residency book + PDF
    • A tea cup made by an Irish potterer with your name on it

    (Most of this perk ships from Austria/Ireland, international duty taxes may apply upon arrival when shipping outside the EU)

    Thank you so much for considering supporting this campaign and my artist residency - it would be my greatest pleasure to go to Ireland and share the experience with you!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Your love has no monetary value. It doesn't matter if I raise less than 5 €, or surpass my goal amount by a thousand €,  please know that I cannot even express my gratitude to those who have taken the time to read about my artist residency in Ireland. Money is not the only way you can give, and you can help me raise the funds for this co-created adventure by sharing this campaign, and spreading the word to friends and family.

I love Ireland and I can’t wait to get back there!2)      OMG! I’ve never been there, but I can’t wait to go there in the future!This proves to me that there is something about the Irish landscape, the people, the way of life, and the constant dampness [just kidding…sort of] that makes it a place many feel drawn to on a very emotional level.That’s why, with your support, I’ve decided to turn my month-long vacation in August into an artist residency. By doing that, I have the funds to not only explore the ruins and the cliffs of Kerry [and find the best bakery], but I can use all of my creative skills to share the experience with you and make you feel like you were there with me!WILL YOU SPEND ALL THE MONEY ON CAKE?First of all, no. But I know how scary it can feel to support a stranger on the internet, so let me tell you what your contribution will help me do:
Finance a share of the flight and accomodation costs
Allow me to pay for ferries, museums, and other cultural explorations that I want to share with you
Pay for a share of my material expenses
Pay for a share of the production costs of your perks
and, maybe, a slice of rhubarb crumble....ARE YOU EVEN ABLE TO PAINT?You're going to have to trust me on this one, but if you still feel like you want to make sure, you can have a look at some of my work here: http://www.catdepillar.com/artwork/And, in case you feel curious but also too lazy to check my website [I think we're soulmates], here are some examples of my work,and the type of abstract landscapes I do [this piece is done in watercolours on wood].WHAT'S IN IT FOR ME, YOU ASK?I know that you're not interested in financing my passion of finding and eating the best scones in Dingle....which is why I have a plan B that I think you might find a little more interesting!In exchange for your contribution to my artist residency, I offer many different perks that I think you might enjoy. And: If you can think of anything else you'd like, I am open to suggestions! [No, I'm not going to send you sausage-rolls Mam.....]5 € // A BIG Thank You + Access to My Secret BlogFor 5 € you are not only the recipient of the biggest virtual hug ever, but you also get access to my secret blog, where I document my artist residency and take you behind the scenes. 10 € // The Above + A Postcard Sent to You From Ireland  In addition to the 5 € perks, I will send you a postcard from Ireland via snail-mail!
Access to secret artist residency blog
A postcard sent to you via snail-mail
15 € // Secret Blog + A Postcard Set For this tier you have access to my secret blog and receive a pack of 4 postcards with illustrations from my trip to Ireland. 
Access to secret artist residency blog
A set of 4 postcards with my Ireland illustrations 
20 € // Ireland on Postcards PackageFor 20 € you receive access to my secret artist residency blog, a postcard sent to you from Ireland via snail-mail, and a set of 4 postcards with illustrations from my trip.

30 € // The Real Deal Package + PDFFor the "Real Deal Package" you receive an original illustration the size of a postcard sent to you from Ireland, plus the PDF version of the artist residency book. The book will be filled with my best photographs, sketches, illustrations and stories from the residency and will available to you as a PDF.

Access to the PDF version of my artist residency book
35 € // The Collector PackageThis package is for real art and Ireland lovers. Not only will you receive a wonderful collection of illustrations as prints, but you'll also receive an original watercolour painting. In addition, you will have access to the PDF version of my artist residency book, which is filled with even more illustrations, sketches, photographs and stories of my trip to Ireland.

40 € // The Book + PostcardsFor 40 €, you will receive the printed version of my artist residency book in addition to a set of four postcards with my illustrations. You will also have access to my secret blog.

45 € // The Book Collector PackageFor this package you will receive my artist residency book, full of illustrations, stories, and photographs of my trip, in addition to 4 postcards printed with my work and a fine-art print of an illustration of your choice.

50 € // The "Were You There?" PackageThis package will make you feel like you were there with me in Ireland and you will receive all of the above perks in one glorious package:

60 € // The Art Collector Package For this package you will receive a DIN A 5 original painting in addition to access to my secret blog, the postcard set and fine-art print, and the PDF edition of my artist residency book.
