story:
Hi! My name is Chelsea Ling, and I own Papercakes Pretty.


YAY! We secured funding!

Update!
We secured an investor who is providing us with enough to guarantee expansion. However, we can still use all the help we can get as we are working w a tiny budget! Funding is a loan, so we also need t repay it. Any money raised now is going directly to stock - we are buying from many small businesses and artists. We are also creating jobs in the community for women and anything we raise will go to the first little bit of paying those we will employ!

My Story:

Papercakes pretty has been a seven year evolution of a dream I've had a for a very long time, pretty much since jr highschool. I started by making Paper crafts (that's where the name came from) and blogging. When I first started, I was a stay at home mom. I went through a really tough, messy split, and was left alone in a province w no family, no job, no income.. etc. I kept at papercakes, selling jewelry and doing photography and makeup, basically anything creative that I could make some money at. I continued to develop my online presence via social media. My life was beyond falling apart but I just kept pushing, and never stopped with papercakes. There were some very rough years, like almost homeless and a couple months without my kids years, and even an assault charge/weekend in jail for punching my ex husband. But I got through all that and came out the other side of it all stronger than I ever thought I could be. However, I still continue to struggle and hustle as a single mom running a business. We are doing amazing already, but I need to be making more to survive. I have a very solid plan to expand and solve that problem, but we can't get anywhere without money.

In August 2012, frustrated with my inability to find a job and refusing to sell my soul and work fast food and just barely survive, I tattooed my knuckles with the phrase "moonbeam". Seems counterproductive... it was... on purpose. I look at my hands constantly all day. This was my way of forever dedicating myself to this work, removing myself from those job prospects. People thought I was crazy. People always think I am crazy! haha... anyways by early 2013 I was taking a nail course and by summer of 2013 I was working full time doing nails. I had gone to makeup school at age 18 and I have worked for most major cosmetic lines out there so this transition went pretty naturally. I started in a small office and then in fall of 2013 I moved into our current location and started the boutique. We are currently about to launch online in a huge way with a new blog, website, and online store. Our online store will be the first of it's kind in canada and provide a way for people to order cool shit (PLUS SIZES, a big selection!!!!!!!!!!) from within their country and not pay duty. We aim to be a large scale online retailer that would be somewhat a combo of something like modcloth and forever 21.


I am in a unique position with my business. I am extremely well branded, and well known. I have marketed myself so well via social media the last 6 years that I have become somewhat of a local celebrity and almost a caricature of myself  (cheesy I know, and it isn't hard in PEI lol) and am well known online. I have 35.000 followers on twitter as Papercakes and almost 15,000 ppl on FB between my personal account and business pages. 


My network of people is loyal, and genuinely interested. I go far and beyond the typical social media marketing. I am my product. I allow customers and the online community complete access to my life, and i interact. I tweet 24/7 and have basically no filter. I am highly entertaining and I am good at drawing a crowd, as I am ridiculous and somewhat hard to ignore. I have soooo many rad people in my corner - just no banks! hahaha :) 



I have shitty credit due to my marriage splitting up, so everything has been done on cash, and not a lot. I have worked my ASS off for the last two years and the shop is now a huge community! I have tons of nail clients and I brought on a partner to help me run the shop. We support local and we consign used clothing. We are huge into providing income for fellow artists and recycling. 

We desperately need more space for the shop - we want to double the size locally. We are also expanding online in a major way right now. The other side of the building is perfectly set up to house a full salon with multiple estheticians and maybe a hair dresser, with the back being warehouse space. We can easily knock out a wall and have the whole bottom floor of the building. My business partner and I also live above the shop in an apartment so we are right on site. The other space comes available for May of this year. 

This is my current working space. It's amazing, but it would be so nice to be able to have a few more girls in, doing not just nails but waxing and facials and pedis etc. We have the clientele for sure! 


The Impact
  • The local economy here in PEI is pretty tough to say the least! We will be providing much needed jobs for women here and putting back into the economy. 
  • We will be buying wholesale directly from atisians
  • Anyone who has watched my journey over the last seven years knows that I have put my heart and soul into this, and I will never give up. 
  • We have real connection with our customers and clients. Not just locally, but all over the world. That is what has made me so successful on social media. Our supporters have been invested in following us now for many years and feel like they "know" me. They get to participate in this every step of the way. 

           


Risks & Challenges

  • PEI is an extremely interesting market. It is very hard for new business here, let alone "different" business and especially one run by a woman and a "come from away" (I am originally from Alberta) person - but I have developed such solid networking here and genuine relationships. So much so that when I almost had to close down last month due to the bad weather, those around me were scrambling to do all they could to help. We have a network that many businesses would KILL for - we just have no extra cash flow. 


Other Ways You Can Help

  • get the word out and make some noise about your campaign! be loud, in true Chelsea Ling fashion hehe... share w anyone you know who cares about the arts and about women in business! 
  •  use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
The SKC staff is proud to announce that we have finished the design and backdrop for our newest set of "Serial Killer Trading Cards".  The first edition is now sold out completely; all we have left is what we kept for ourselves.

This series is ultra-popular on the site, on ebay, on amazon and sometimes larger scale retail in other countries.

We are also proud to announce that we are prepping for a site re-launch with the inclusion of a new storefront and a compete modern social media connectivity. We also intend to include an opt in membership and offer member driven content uploaded directly to the site.

The Serial Killer Calendar concept is truly legendary. We have been featured in the AP, Reuters, Fox TV, Yahoo, PBS, Law and Order Special Victims.. and on and on. The site did 1,000,000 visitors the first year and it still goes  and goes and goes,....but, as is, it is not up to what we feel our best potential is. 

We are the largest true crime site in the world and include the "One and Only World Famous Serial Killer Calendar" and the “Serial Killer Magazine” as 2 of our staples. We even had a movie made about us.. and you might see in the not too distant future.

We have already designed the cards and are ready to go to print with the touch of a button. We want to do ASAP so they are completely ready for Xmas season. We are asking the IndieGoGO community to help us offset cost and bring forth and awesome compilation of art.

http://www.amazon.com/Saunders-Gilks-Serial-Kil...

story:
Hello! 

I just wanted to update you and Thank You for you support. Over two months ago I started a campaign on indiegogo to get a better and more pro equipment to create art. 

With help of you, lovely people, I was able to raise $675!  how crazy! With indiegogo fees and some fees from bank transactions I had $600 available to buy a new tablet and after days of thinking (it was a really hard decision to make! haha)  adding some one my earnings  I decided to buy Wacom Cintiq 13HD for €740 and I couldn’t be happier right now!

It arrived today (on my birthday! yay!) and after short time I got to try it I experienced a digital artist’s heaven on Earth! haha 

I am so thankful. There aren’t enough ‘thank you’ in the the world that could express how much I appreciate You helping me to get this tablet. I only hope to spam you with more of my art in the future ^^ (assuming that’s a good thing) 

Wish you all beautiful day! <3


Who am I?

Hello. My name is Monika I am 24 year old artist from Slovakia. I live in Prague, Czech Republic.  

You might know me because of my fan artworks of Arrow, The Flash, Glee, OITNB and many others:

I’m a starting freelance artist at this moment. I struggle with finding a job outside art to support myself and my passion, because I am physically disabled and on top of that I had to take a break in my studies (Japanese language and culture)  due to high levels of anxiety and depressions it caused me. I solely support myself with art and help of my (poor) family nowadays.  Unfortunately, I’ve never received any education in art and path of a self-taught artist is slow and long.

What do I need?

At this moment I’m creating all my art with Wacom Bamboo Fun Pen & Touch (Small) which is not only not very well suited for any Professional artwork, but also I had it for few years, replaced some part and I get more and more issues with it every day so I fear it might stop working soon.

I would like to get HUION GT-220 HD graphic tablet monitor. It’s not the most expensive or best one on the market, but I believe it will suit me well.

Even when I won’t reach my goal,  I’m still going to use the money raised here to buy myself any kind of graphic tablet so I can continue in my work.

If I reach the goal, not only will I get closer to becoming a better artist and professional, it will also give me a new powerful tool to provide living for myself and work more effectively on many of my art projects.


Other Ways You Can Help Me?                        

You can also help me by spreading the word about this f ‘fund raiser or my work on all social media.


Thank you so much!

story:
Hello my name is... Kristen Marin and I am a photographer based in Los Angeles. My past work focuses mainly on documenting families and births. However, last May I happened to meet members of the JS “Justicia Social” and JOR “Just Outta Rehab” and the notorious MTA "Metro Transit Assasins" graffiti crews and was fascinated by their long term friendships and artistry. The crew members have allowed me to follow their crew for the last few months documenting their story as a community. They have welcomed me with open arms and love that I am interested in their artwork. They’ve come to trust that I will capture their story honestly, objectively, and with great empathy.   One of my new friends and a crew leader is GOGO, so it is only fitting that I chose Indiegogo for this project. :)
For this next part of the project, members from the JOR crew as well as STP crew will be traveling to Art Basel Miami Beach, a huge yearly art community gathering. Each year at Art Basel the graffiti community gathering grows and graffiti artists come together to do the one thing they love: paint. I want to be there to capture how the JOR/STP crew members relate and interact with the graffiti and art world at large.
This is my first long term photography project and I am really excited about the images this trip will help make!

What We Need & What You Get

Funding:
  • $300 for round trip airfare from Los Angeles to Miami, December 4-8, 2015.
  • $600 for 4 nights accommodations in a three star hotel or below.
  • $150 car rental
  • $200 for food/daily expenses
  • $250 miscellaneous photo related/book making expenses
  • $1500 total
Perks:
  • $500 gets you a hand made photo book featuring the best images from this entire project, to be delivered upon completion of the project. Black book style, it will be signed by the photographer and tagged by the crew members featured in the project.
  • $100 donation gets you a signed 8x10 giclee fine art photo print of your choice from this Graffiti Crew Life project from up to now through December 2015.
  • $50 gets you an 8x10 graffiti marker tag on paper from one of the crew members.
  • $30 gets you a signed 5x7 giclee fine art photo print of your choice from this Graffiti Crew Life project from up to now through December 2015.
  • $20 gets you a tagged “Hello My Name Is” sticker from the artist of your choice.
  • $10 gets you a tagged “Hello my Name Is” sticker from a graffiti artist of our choice.

The Impact

"Graffiti art is about manifesting your mark on the world, whether others like it or not." -David Brafman

There are many graffiti books and photographers dedicated to documenting graffiti walls and tags because they are by their very nature temporary. To my limited knowledge, no one outside of the graffiti crew members themselves has documented the internal culture of crews, as well as their impact on each other and the art world.

My interest in graffiti stemmed from a one time collaborative project funded by Ed and Brandy Sweeney and compiled through the J. Paul Getty Trust called: LA Liber Amicorum, which literally translates to “LA Book of Friends” Graffiti artists use black art books to tag and network within and through various crews. This Liber Amicorum is popularly known as the Getty Graffiti Black Book. There was also an accompanying 2014 exhibit at ESMOA: Scratch.

Several members of the JOR and MTA crews that I have met were artists featured in the LA Liber Amicorum such as EDER, BLOSM and GASOLINE. You can page through the whole book here.

I could not believe my luck when I met the crew members themselves and they were so friendly and willing to answer my many questions. Over time they began to trust that I would capture their group with integrity and authenticity, while at the same time maintaining the anonymity of the members who do not wish to be known publicly. What I have seen and hope that I capture is the culture, camaraderie, and support for the creative endeavors of longtime friends and newcomers alike who crave artistic expression.

You can view some of the work from the last several months that I have featured on my photographer alter ego, AINE’s web journal:
Grace and Graffiti: Images from JS_JOR's 25th Reunion
A+D Museum Opening Gala: JOR members painted a mural
A+D Museum's Beyond Graffiti exhibit closing night
A+D Museum's Beyond Graffiti exhibit wall painting and How I Met the Crew

Other Ways You Can Help
I know not everyone can contribute monetarily. That is okay! Please spread the word by sharing this campaign through your social media channels by using the Indiegogo share tools!

They have welcomed me with open arms and love that I am interested in their artwork. They’ve come to trust that I will capture their story honestly, objectively, and with great empathy.   One of my new friends and a crew leader is GOGO, so it is only fitting that I chose Indiegogo for this project. :)For this next part of the project, members from the JOR crew as well as STP crew will be traveling to Art Basel Miami Beach, a huge yearly art community gathering. Each year at Art Basel the graffiti community gathering grows and graffiti artists come together to do the one thing they love: paint. I want to be there to capture how the JOR/STP crew members relate and interact with the graffiti and art world at large. This is my first long term photography project and I am really excited about the images this trip will help make!What We Need & What You GetFunding: $300 for round trip airfare from Los Angeles to Miami, December 4-8, 2015.
$600 for 4 nights accommodations in a three star hotel or below.
$150 car rental

$200 for food/daily expenses

$250 miscellaneous photo related/book making expenses 

$1500 totalPerks:$500 gets you a hand made photo book featuring the best images from this entire project, to be delivered upon completion of the project. Black book style, it will be signed by the photographer and tagged by the crew members featured in the project.
$100 donation gets you a signed 8x10 giclee fine art photo print of your choice from this Graffiti Crew Life project from up to now through December 2015.
$50 gets you an 8x10 graffiti marker tag on paper from one of the crew members.
$30 gets you a signed 5x7 giclee fine art photo print of your choice from this Graffiti Crew Life project from up to now through December 2015.

$20 gets you a tagged “Hello My Name Is” sticker from the artist of your choice.
$10 gets you a tagged “Hello my Name Is” sticker from a graffiti artist of our choice.The Impact"Graffiti
 art is about manifesting your mark on the world, whether others like it
 or not." -David BrafmanThere are many graffiti books and photographers dedicated to documenting graffiti walls and tags because they are by their very nature temporary. To my limited knowledge, no one outside of the graffiti crew members themselves has documented the internal culture of crews, as well as their impact on each other and the art world. My interest in graffiti stemmed from a one time collaborative project funded by Ed and Brandy Sweeney and compiled through the J. Paul Getty Trust called: LA Liber Amicorum, which literally translates to “LA Book of Friends” Graffiti artists use black art books to tag and network within and through various crews. This Liber Amicorum is popularly known as the Getty Graffiti Black Book. There was also an accompanying 2014 exhibit at ESMOA: Scratch.Several members of the JOR and MTA crews that I have met were artists featured in the LA Liber Amicorum such as EDER, BLOSM and GASOLINE. You can page through the whole book here. I could not believe my luck when I met the crew members themselves and they were so friendly and willing to answer my many questions. Over time they began to trust that I would capture their group with integrity and authenticity, while at the same time maintaining the anonymity of the members who do not wish to be known publicly. What I have seen and hope that I capture is the culture, camaraderie, and support for the creative endeavors of longtime friends and newcomers alike who crave artistic expression.You can view some of the work from the last several months that I have featured on my photographer alter ego, AINE’s web journal:Grace and Graffiti: Images from JS_JOR's 25th ReunionA+D Museum Opening Gala: JOR members painted a muralA+D Museum's Beyond Graffiti exhibit closing nightA+D Museum's Beyond Graffiti exhibit wall painting and How I Met the CrewOther Ways You Can HelpI know not everyone can contribute monetarily. That is okay! Please spread the word by sharing this campaign through your social media channels by using the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Polina Hryn and I am the Host aka Instigator of The PO SHO in Hollywood, CA broadcasting LIVE weekly from TradioV. I am also the producer of this show, which focuses on Promoting THE ARTS and Elevating THE CREATIVE CULTURE.

     Previously, I co-hosted "The Artful Undress" on TradioV, "Spoken Word / Spoken Song" at kx@onelaguna, and "The Love Lab" at kx@onelaguna, and am the Founder of "WET PUZZLE PIECE Productions." I am a Media Personality, Producer, Artist, Writer and Promoter of THE ARTS, elevating ARTISTS OF ALL GENRES AND MEDIA.

TradioV (Radio in TV) is a division of Zinna Media Group (ZMG), which currently reaches over 60 million people worldwide each month. The TradioV broadcast studio, located in Hollywood, CA, focuses on celebrity-driven long-form TV and Radio content, broadcast in HD across the internet. This cutting-edge broadcast network runs a lineup of celebrity hosts & guests including Dave Navarro, Gene Simons, Ozzy Osbourne, Sean Astin, Eric Roberts, E.D.I. Mean, Don Johnson, Alec Sulkin, Dr. Drew, James Marsden, Gabriel Byrne, Billy Idol, Kat Von D, Mark McGrath, Julian Lennon, Priscilla Presley, Melanie Griffith, Moby, Slim Jim Phantom and more! TradioV CELEBRITY REEL

The PO SHO is a show in which the Creative Cult discusses the Creative World in a wildly fun, funny, informative, controversial, inspiring and above all Entertaining way ... with a collaboration of talent ... from Painters & Musicians to Slam Poets & Shakespeare ... Chefs & Mixologists to Burlesque & Comedy ...


With a long awaited new renaissance, the Creative Culture, emerging from the depths ... and standing at the cusp of a defined movement and time period, I am hell bent on elevating the Creatives to their rightful place ... this is my passion!

My intent is to bring THE ARTS to the forefront, empowering communities, organizations and people to wield their innate creativity as a means to stimulate and achieve abundance and wellbeing.

       


What We Need & What You Get

This show has promoted a wide array of talent:

Painters, Art Models, Musicians, Photographers, Teachers, Videographers, Animators, 3D Modeling Artists, Visual Effects Artists, a Documentary Filmmaker, Street Art Promoters from the UK and Germany, a Location Scout, a Drone Videographer, Street Artists/Muralists from the UK and Germany, a Radio Host from Berlin, a Poet, Stage Actors, a Screen Actress, Comedians, a Performance Artist, a Nihilist, Fashion Models, Super Models, Fashion Photographers, Improvisational Jazz Performers, an Alternative & Holistic Health Practitioner, Ballet Dancers, a Burlesque Dance Troupe, Sculptors, a Designer and Creative Consultant and an Architect.

With the STRONG FOUNDATION that the show has established, it's now time to GO BIG!  

Money donated to this campaign will go to creating a larger presence.

  • Shows in front of a Live Studio Audience in a Theater setting with a Stage, allowing for a larger collaboration of talent
  • Syndication
  • Live Footage from Creative Events, including Interviews, to use on the show
  • Quarterly or Biannual Print Magazine highlighting and elaborating on show topics and guests
  • A Documentary on the Creative Culture

         


The Impact

The show, broadcasting from TradioV, has enabled Creatives to shine in a reputable and celebrity ridden studio right in the heart of Hollywood, and the production is now a respected and recognizable brand.

But there is much more blood, sweat and tears to add to the pot. This show is by and for the Creatives and supporters of the Creative Culture and has the ability to make a difference … with collaboration and banding together, The PO SHO will GROW … fo sho!

          

Risks & Challenges

Let’s face it, being SEEN IN THE CROWD can be difficult, but that is exactly the point. After spending the last 10 years promoting THE ARTS, it has become crystal clear that MEDIA, especially LIVE BROADCASTING with ARCHIVED LINKS is the most effective way for Creatives to be seen and recognized.  That said, the intent of this show is to broaden awareness of members of the Creative Culture, exposing them to a wider spread public eye than is possible with only specific venue appearances and exhibitions.

                          

I have been on the front line of art promotion, traveling around the US and abroad, for many years now. I have witnessed the strong desire of the artist. I have also witnessed the demise of the art world, on many counts. It’s not good enough to be amazing at your craft; the magic lies in the recognition and PROMOTION of that talent. That is what this show provides ... with the potential to promote on an even larger scale ... with a taller soapbox! 

       


Other Ways You Can Help

Being unable to contribute monetarily is completely understandable. The great thing is … you can still help LOADS by supporting the show … by watching, calling in, and SHARING. In media, views matter! SHOUT from the rooftops at the top of your lungs, “WATCH AND SHARE THE PO SHO!” and “HELP PO ELEVATE THE CREATIVE CULTURE … GIVE WHAT YOU CAN!

      


Clips! PO SHO I 05:23:15 
ARNO : PATTON : GOMEZ : GHOSTS 


Clips! PO SHO II 05.30.15 
DUBIN : LENKUS : CZECHOROSKY 


Clips! PO SHO III 06:06:15 
MAHONEY : MARION : GALIEOTE : ARNO 


Clips! PO SHO IV 06/13/15 
WOOD : ZIPPY : CARTER : DAC 


Clips! PO SHO V 06/20/15 
LOW BROS : BULLOUGH : WOOD 


Clips! PO SHO VI 06/27/15 
GARDINER : POHLHAMMER 


Clips! PO SHO VII 07/11/15 
WICHMANN : SHAPIRO 


Clips! PO SHO VIII 07/18/15 
DEPAUL : PEDRAZA

story:
WHO IS WRECK CITY?

Hi! We're WRECK CITY, an independent curatorial collective that organizes experimental art exhibitions in alternative and pre-demolition spaces. WRECK CITY is comprised of 8 "artist-curators" with an ongoing interest in DIY-subcultures and alternative spaces: Matthew Bourree, Caitlind r.c. Brown, Jennifer Crighton, Brandon Dalmer, Andrew Frosst, John Frosst, Natalie MacLean, and Shawn Mankowske. Between us, we've founded galleries, instigated long-term collectives, run festivals, toured art around the world, and played a humble but measurable role in shaping the foundation of independent art in Calgary.

You can find our full mandate on our website (www.wreckcity.ca) but essentially WRECK CITY believes in art’s radical potential to permeate familiar spaces, grow new communities, and continually create fresh understandings of our particular time and place. We're interested in critiquing the potentials of unused urban spaces and the role of art in expanding the way we look at our cities, communities, and art scenes.

Our previous projects, WRECK CITY: an epilogue for 809 and PHANTOM WING, collectively involved new works by over 150 artists, transforming (respectively) an entire neighbourhood of houses scheduled for demolition, and the 1960s wing of an abandoned school. Despite extremely humble beginnings and a roller coaster ride of trials and tribulations, both WRECK CITY's projects were met with voracious support from a diverse Calgary audience, gleaning viewership by 13,000+ visitors to date.


WHAT'S DEMO TAPE?

It's been two years since our last curatorial project, and WRECK CITY is finally ramping up to launch DEMO TAPE, a new site-specific art exhibition at the old Penguin Car Wash in Ramsay (Calgary). Presented in conjunction with Sled Island Music + Arts Festival, we've invited 50 artists, musicians, writers, and performers to respond to the defunct car wash, working onsite for one month. Within this raw, utilitarian, and malleable context (not unlike a garage jam-space), artists are free to significantly alter spaces, empowered by the understanding that their work will eventually be destroyed along with the surrounding building. Originally instigated to explore the intersections between music + art, DEMO TAPE has evolved into a broader examination of sound + image, action + object, transient + solid, invisible + visible. Just as the overall exhibition overlaps with Sled Island, DEMO TAPE artists explore the overlap between various disciplines, with a focus on ideas of change over time.

WRECK CITY exhibits work that is site-specific, experiential, subversive, immersive, interactive, and encompassing, and DEMO TAPE will certainly reflect that focus. This is NOT an exhibition where canvases are hung on walls, this is a place for rupturing previously-existing definitions of art and forging new territory, furthering contemporary dialogues while poking fun at dominant cultures. All of us - Artists & Curators alike - take this pursuit seriously... but we're totally down to joke about it.

The final form of DEMO TAPE will be a public experiment - we suspect that the artists will surprise us all!

WHO ARE THE ARTISTS BEHIND DEMO TAPE?

There are about 50 artists, musicians, and performers participating in DEMO TAPE, including: Aaron Moran; Alia Shabab & Michel Gignac; Ben Nixon & Rachelle Quinn; Chelsea Allard & Steele Duncan (#TROMGROP); Desiree Nault & Lane Shordee; Don Hill, Jayda Karsten, Ed Keeble, Sarah Proctor, & Alicia Yip; Ema Clarke & Igor Gvozdenovic; Geneva Haley; Guy Gardner & Liyan Wong; Hye-Seung Jung; Jake Klein-Waller; Jennifer Bassett & David Tyl; Joe Kelly & Jay Crocker; Kelly Pleau & Kerry Maguire; Lena Elliott & Gwen Morgan; Mackenzie Boyle; Miles Cooper Seaton; Palmer Olsen; Peter Redecopp; Rachael Chaisson; Sandrine Anna-Brigita & Eric Makwich; Sarah Storteboom & Lowell Smith; Sarah Van Sloten; Su Ying Strang; Svea Ferguson; Xan Hawes, Nina Hitzler, and Phil Wilson.

For the second time, we're delighted to include two Writers-in-Residence: Jenna Swift and JD Mersault. 

See here for bios & project descriptions (the projects are so awesome! Please take a look! Please do!)

WHY CROWD-FUND DEMO TAPE?

Obviously, the catch to instigating projects like this is that, at some point, we have to figure out a way to fund them. Because they're free and open to everyone (which is very important to us) crowd-funding plays a huge role in the sustainability of WRECK CITY, alongside grants, sponsorships, and larger donations - when we're lucky!

Subsequently, the future of WRECK CITY is always unknown, but this is actually kind of useful: we're flexible to react to situations as they come our way. It keeps us relevant.

As a curatorial collective we hold ourselves to a high standard - despite the fact that WRECK CITY is an independent group, we've always been dedicated to paying professional fees to participating artists. We know what it’s like to survive on an artist’s salary, and it’s insanely hard. We try our very best never to ask our peers to do something for nothing! Subsequently, Artist Fees take up a huge part of our budget - as they should! Similarly, we cover the basic necessities of these projects - onsite prep, health + safety, posters, print materials, administrative costs, some equipment, web presence, documentation, etc. The back-end of this thing is big and bulky, and powered primarily by the blood, sweat, tears, and stubbornness of WRECK CITY and Participants. Your funding will be used responsibly, but it will also make a BIG DIFFERENCE to us.

Luckily, DEMO TAPE is over 2/3 funded by Alberta Foundation for the Arts and Canada Council for the Arts. However, we still have a good deal of outstanding expenses. So we're taking advantage of both interpretations of the phrase "Change Machine" and asking for your change! We're trying to raise $7,500 by the time we have to vacate Penguin Car Wash --- July 1, 2015!

Most of the people in our social circles can't give a lot - and we totally understand this! - but whether you help spread the word of this campaign, give us a few of your hard-earned dollars, or attend the DEMO TAPE events, you're helping support us more than you know. Thank You! Thank you for even looking at our Crowd-Funding Campaign page!! That's half the battle.

There’s also this thing about shared ownership. If you decide to help fund this project, you’re not buying anything - you’re making a statement. One of WRECK CITY’s Curators recently said “every dollar is a vote.” While she was talking about how people should spend their money in general, that idea translates to this campaign perfectly. By investing in WRECK CITY, you’re saying that you want to see more projects like DEMO TAPE, PHANTOM WING, and WRECK CITY: an epilogue for 809. You’re saying that you believe WRECK CITY does a valuable thing in Calgary, and you'd like to see it continue. You’re investing in an experimental subversion of civic space and the perpetuation of an awesome community. You're also supporting an all-ages, free, public experience! At the end of the day, we like to think that you're investing in the future...

WHAT HAPPENS IF OUR CAMPAIGN EXCEEDS ITS GOAL?

If WRECK CITY's Crowd-Funding Campaign exceeds $10,000, we'll commit to a 4th project. That is, we'll make ourselves a nest egg so we can take on new alternative spaces sometime in the future with less warning and more preparation. If this crowd-funding campaign SOMEHOW exceeds $50,000, we'll commit to a 4th project within the next year!!! Not to get ahead of ourselves, of course - we're crossing our fingers for 7.5 grand - but we'll take what we can get!

The value of art is often intangible, and it’s impossible to measure within traditional value systems. You plant art like a seed in the underground, and it grows, branches out, and develops into something that was once unimaginable.  Artists are peddlers of culture, reflectors of the present, and bellwethers for the future. Despite the fact that the work commissioned by WRECK CITY is often ephemeral, we truly believe in its value. Come see DEMO TAPE! It's sure to show you something entirely new...

When: June 19 - 28, 2015

Where: Old Penguin Car Wash, 1001 8th Street NW, Calgary, Canada

For a full list of hours, bands, and events, visit: www.wreckcity.ca

Illustration by: Kelsey Fraser

Not to get ahead of ourselves, of course - we're crossing our fingers for 7.5 grand - but we'll take what we can get!The value of art is often intangible, and it’s impossible to measure within traditional value systems. You plant art like a seed in the underground, and it grows, branches out, and develops into something that was once unimaginable.  Artists are peddlers of culture, reflectors of the present, and bellwethers for the future. Despite the fact that the work commissioned by WRECK CITY is often ephemeral, we truly believe in its value. Come see DEMO TAPE! It's sure to show you something entirely new...When: June 19 - 28, 2015Where: Old Penguin Car Wash, 1001 8th Street NW, Calgary, CanadaFor a full list of hours, bands, and events, visit: www.wreckcity.ca Illustration by: Kelsey Fraser

story:
This campaign is to fund the completion of the half finished Wallaby Wall mural located on the Northern Rivers Community Gateway building at 76 Carrington Street in Lismore, NSW, Australia. The mural was started as part of the Arts vs Science Festival at City Hall in August this year.

We are looking for funds to hire a scissor lift & get some more paint and materials to see the mural through to completion.

story:
The Faces Project

Shootings take place daily in the US. We seem to accept them as a general public. Certainly we’re outraged when we hear the victims are children and young adults under 21. 

Then time passes. . .

Can we remember the individual names of those children? Can we recall their faces?

I couldn’t. And then I suffered a personal loss to gun violence; my dear friend, Fr. Lorenzo Rosebaugh, OMI, was gunned down. His life had been devoted to the resistance of violence and injustice. He had just officiated at the funerals of two teen victims of gun violence. All of my planned art work at that time came to a halt.

My name is Christine Ilewski and I began the “Faces Project,” painting the portraits of children, 20 and under, who have died as the result of gun violence. An artist friend, Jane Linders, got us organized as I was becoming overwhelmed by the numbers of local victims. Other passionate artists joined us. We formed a board. And, thanks in part to receiving the 2013 Critical Mass Creative Stimulus grant and the devotion of these artists, we continue to put a Face to the youngest victims of gun violence. 

What we do

We paint a portrait -- the face of a child who fell victim to gun violence -- which is then framed generously by Julie Campbell and donated to the family. An acrylic transfer of that image is used to collage the faces on vintage handkerchiefs which are mounted on black canvas. We work with the St. Louis Crime Victim’s Advocacy (CVA) center to respectfully contact victims’ families for their permission to use these portraits in the fight against gun violence.

The artists volunteer from a number of area schools. There is a sign up sheet at university art classes. Several initial artists have responded to a Critical Mass call for artists. There has also been a call via the WCA women caucus for the arts.

All artists volunteer and express support for the cause -- to end gun violence. We believe it also empowers these artists as activists who might not be ready or able to express themselves in other ways.

We have exhibited the Faces project at The Vaughn Cultural Center, the Foundry, UMSL , Soulard Art Market, the Maryland Heights Community Center, The Regional Arts Center, Christ Church Catherdral and have numerous future exhibits planned.

 


Why we're raising money & What We Need

We are out of most of our donated materials now, having completed over 60 portraits regionally. However, we are being asked to expand the Faces Not Forgotten project around the country.

Here is how funding will impact the project:

  • We would have a new process that would allow us to do portraits in other cities beginning with Chicago.

  • We could afford to ship the exhibit, as it has been requested in other cities.

  • We would be able to develop our website so that families can easily download an application form that allows the families of victims to submit a photo of their child directly to us.

  • We could offer a materials gift certificate or small stipend to our volunteer artists and framer.

  • We would also use the reward money to transition to a printed form of the portraits that we exhibit. Our vision for this is to print 16"x20" images on flat canvas with grommets in the corners so that they can be tied together with black ribbons as a quilt or prayer flag. This could also be shipped more easily than the portraits' current form, which is stretched canvases.

The Impact

Jessica Meyers, director of CVA, said that one thing families say over and over is that they are afraid that their child will be forgotten. The Faces Project attempts to keep their memory alive and to offer some small comfort and support to the families.

These children are not just numbers or statistics. Each one of them was a life ended. Each one has a Face. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help financially, please help us spread the word by sharing our campaign on your social networks. 

If you are an artist of member of a family that has suffered a tragedy at the hand of gun violence, please reach out to us to learn about how you can get involved.

story:
Rupert James Baker

The Artist's work derives from his experiences at Barclays Capital Markets at the height of the Thatcher era. Witnessing products and services that conflicted with his own value structure, highlighted by the ethical influence that multinationals contribute to society; powerful enough to cross moral and geographical boundaries, in the pursuit of purely profit.

Baker’s pained and detached work meditates on our attempts to understand the shifting ethical constraints of human life through economic bench-marking and corporate governance. The sadness and tragedy in this work is apparent and is reflected in man’s economic success laying the foundations for his own destruction. Through a critical engagement with his own morals and that of multinational corporations he confronts fundamental questions of where humanity stands in relation to its environment.

Baker works across all mediums in his installations having worked with film, photography, fabric, paint, social media, clay, paper, copper, plastics and ink.


To Participate in

'Activist Investor by Rupert James Baker Ltd'

The artist is inviting you, the audience, to control by ownership, the installation 'Activist Investor by Rupert James Baker Ltd.' 
Baker sees his role as artist and facilitator of this perpetually evolving installation with the future direction now relinquished to you, the active audience. 
The monies donated from this and all ongoing campaigns, will be used to buy shares in the UK company BP Plc, to influence change and expectation . 'Activist Investor by Rupert James Baker Ltd.' will be present at BP Plc general meetings to vote NO, block and table resolutions, as directed by the audience. 
Becoming a Patron of 'Activist Investor by Rupert James Baker Ltd' means you will join the Patrons Register. You will be able to vote and table resolutions at the annual patrons meeting (either by email, in person or by proxy) to exploit BP for good.
Participate by donating for an 'Activist Investor by Rupert James Baker Ltd.' Print. These have been constructed by the artist are ink on paper with each signed & numbered. 
Participate by donating for a series of three paintings, titled 'Activist Investor by Rupert James Baker Ltd.' These have been painted by the artist are acrylic on paper with each signed.

Monies Donated

All monies donated from this campaign will be used to purchase shares and voting rights in the U.K. company BP Plc. 

The artist has selected one of the first ever multinationals, recently projected into the global consciousness, forced into transition and left vulnerable. This uncertainty offers the audience a perfect platform to influence change, adding more unpredictability to any conclusion. 

Running costs will be expected to come from BP Plc dividends with any remainder used to purchase more shares in BP Plc.

Fees expected are for campaign platforms, banking, legal, accounting and printing.

Anyone working directly for 'Activist Investor by Rupert James Baker Ltd.' will receive a London living wage or equivalent.

story:
• Hello everyone I am Reshada Pullen-Jireh!  I am a professional teaching artist living just outside of Washington, DC.  I have over 10 years teaching experience.  I currently teach art for DC Scholars Public Charter Schools .  I am a prolific painter, and I paint live at various events in the Metro DC Area.  I am currently the resident artist for Wednesday Verses, and Busboys and Poets at 14th and V and Hyattsville, MD.

  • After all of these years of teaching and creating, I’ve finally decided to apply to grad school to earn my Masters in Art Education.  I’ve been accepted into Maryland Institute College of Art located in Baltimore Maryland.  MICA offers art teachers the opportunity to earn their Masters of Art Education over a 14 month program, with two intense summers and online courses during the academic year.
  • I’ve been awarded $20,000 in scholarships to be distributed across two summers, which is a tremendous blessing, but it is not enough to cover everything.  I am asking for your patronage to help me reach my first goal of $16,500 to help me get started. In exchange for postcards, matted prints, limited edition canvas prints, live painting, and custom created artwork available in various sizes! 


Every now and then I am asked, "Why teach art? I thought kids who “got it” just do what they do." EVERYTHING that I know as an artist was taught to me before I took the time to develop it. I've always been talented in many things, but genuine wisdom and growth comes from the seed of knowledge planted by those who loved me enough to teach me what they know. I teach Art to give students the tools that they need to understand the visual world that surrounds them and to express the greatness within them. To expect the artistically talented in the world to only consist of child prodigies is like expecting only the hyperlexic to be able to read. No one would today, would deny the billions of us that required education to become literate. Everything that makes us human is amplified by the shared knowledge of those who are wiser than ourselves. I would not be the artist I am today without my former art teachers. Because of them, I know how to live my life learning, creating, growing and sharing. I want to continue do the same for my own students and empower those who would be art teachers to so effectively for generations to come.

In order to attend MICA this summer we’re raising $16,500 to cover:

  • Fees from IndieGogo (9% if we don't meet our goal, 4% if we do), Paypal (3%) and Credit Cards (3%) 
  • Cost of fulfilling perks (Materials, Prints, Postcards, Shipping, packaging, etc. costs are a large portion of the amount needed)
  • My tuition and fees for the first half of my graduate study at MICA.
  • Books, Art Supplies, other Educational expenses.

For Your generous contribution amounts you will receive beautiful perks!


Postcards!


$10 social media shout out on Facebook and my instagram page! 


Matted Prints!

$ 35 - social media shout out, AND a standard matted print

11"x14" with mat of any work currently available in standard print! 

$ 100 - social media shout out, 3 standard matted prints,

11"x14" with mats of any work currently available in standard print! 


Stretched Canvas Prints!

$350 - One signed 16” x20" limited edition STRETCHED CANVAS PRINT of ANY PAINTING listed above or on my website reshadapullenjireh.com, and a social media shout out!  If you love my work, and you prefer to purchase prints at a larger scale, this is for you!  ANY PAINTING ON MY WEBSITE IS AVAILABLE!

$1000 - Three signed 16” x20" limited edition STRETCHED CANVAS PRINT of ANY PAINTING on my website reshadapullenjireh.com, and a social media shout out!  If you love my work, and you prefer to purchase prints at a larger scale, AND would like to save $50 this is for you!  ANY PAINTING ON MY WEBSITE IS AVAILABLE!

New! Dancer Series Matted and Canvas Prints!

$ 35 - social media shout out, AND a standard matted print

11"x14" with mat of any dancer painting shown above

$ 130 - social media shout out, 4 standard matted prints,

11"x14" with mats of all of the dancer paintings shown above!

$350 - One signed 16” x20" limited edition STRETCHED CANVAS PRINT of any of the dancer paintings shown above, and a social media shout out!  If you love my work, and you prefer to purchase prints at a larger scale, this is for you!  
$1300 - four signed 16” x20" limited edition STRETCHED CANVAS PRINTS  of ALL of the dancer paintings above and a social media shout out!  If you love my work, and you prefer to purchase prints at a larger scale, AND would like to save $100 this is for you!  

Live Painting! (Metro DC, Baltimore and Richmond, VA Only)

Above photo courtesy of Blue Lightning Photography for Wednesday Verses

$200 Live Painting Express Package! (12) available)

Live Painting for your Saturday or Sunday event (Metro DC; Baltimore, MD and Richmond, VA Only)  I will arrive at your events on time and fully prepared to create an amazing work of art live in front of your events’ guests!  This package does not include the price of the created painting

$1750 Live Painting Full Package! (24 available)

Above photo courtesy of Blue Lightning Photography for Wednesday Verses

Live Painting and Artwork for your Saturday or Sunday event (Metro DC; Baltimore, MD; and Richmond, VA Only).  INCLUDES THE PAINTING AND THE SERVICE!!!), and social media promotion of your event!  I will arrive at your event on time and fully prepared to create an amazing work of art that you get to keep in front of your event’s guests!

$2750 Live Painting Plus Package! (24) available)

Above photo courtesy of Blue Lightning Photography for Wednesday Verses

Perfect for Weddings, Corporate Events and other Parties!

Live Painting, Artwork, and Prints for your Saturday or Sunday event (Metro DC; Baltimore, MD; and Richmond, VA Only)  INCLUDES LIVE PAINTINGS SERVICES, THE CREATED ARTWORK AND 100 ASSORTED 11”X14” MATTED PRINTS FOR YOUR GUESTS!!!

I will arrive at your event on time and fully prepared to create an amazing work of art in front of your event’s guests!

You get to keep the original custom painting created at the event forever!

Up to 100 guests get an 11”x14” matted print as a gift! Additional print will cost $35 each.

Original Artwork


Richly crafted original, real paintings created by my hands and brush in the peace and focus that my God, my time, my studio, my music and my snacks provide. These are one of a kind, museum quality works of art.

$1875 -One 18"x24" Custom Studio painting

I will paint any subject of your choice on a gallery quality stretched canvas! Choose a portrait of a loved one, your hero, a peaceful space, or an abstract design!   Each work comes with a signed certificate of Authenticity, and a social media shout out!

$3750 -One 24"x36" Custom STUDIO painting

 I will paint any subject of your choice on a gallery quality stretched canvas! Choose a unique portrait of loved ones, your hero, a peaceful space, or an abstract design!  Each work comes with a signed certificate of Authenticity, and a social media shout out!

$7500 -One 36"x48" custom studio painting


I will paint any subject of your choice on a gallery quality stretched, 36”x48” canvas! Choose a unique portrait of loved ones, your hero, a peaceful space, or an abstract design!  Each work comes with a signed certificate of Authenticity, and a social media shout out!


A Little Bit of Everything!

I want all the love (Metro DC and Metro Baltimore only):

For your contribution of $16,500, you will receive:

·  Up to $14,000 in original artwork, custom or already created with signed certificates of authenticity for each painting.

·  live painting with artwork included for two separate Saturday or Sunday events in Metro DC; Metro Baltimore; or Richmond Virginia (matted prints not included)

·  Four 16”x24” signed limited edition prints of any artwork on my website, reshadapullenjireh.com

·  Four 11”x14” matted prints of currently available standard prints.

All the Love I Can Get Package

For your contribution of $16,500, you will receive:

·  Up to $16,500 in original artwork, custom or already created with signed certificates of authenticity.

·  Four 16”x24” signed limited edition prints of any artwork on my website, reshadapullenjireh.com.

·  Four 11”x14” matted prints of currently available standard prints.

·  And a video message sent via email, thanking you for your support. 


Risks & Challenges

Many of you may ask “Reshada, you are a working grad school student, when will you have time to produce all of the prizes that you listed?”  Truthfully, the prizes are from my visual arts business.  I have all of the standard and limited edition canvas prints in my inventory. A large part of my graduate study requires that I continue doing what I am doing now, teaching and painting.  I am asking that if you’ve ever thought of owning a piece of my art, to make now the time to become a patron.  If you’ve never seen my art prior to viewing this campaign, check out my website www.reshadapullenjireh.com.  I would love your patronage and support.

If I don’t reach my goals, all funds contributed will still go to support my graduate studies at the Maryland Institute College of Art. And your physical prizes will still be fulfilled between June 14, 2015 and December 1, 2015 for printed works.  Original Custom Pieces may take longer.  The fulfillment of live painting prizes depends on the scheduling of the event.

If I exceed my goals, the funds will support my tuition and fees for 2016, and future gallery exhibits of my work.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not in the position to donate funds in exchange for art right now, its okay, I’ve been there before.  You can still help by sharing this campaign via social media on facebook, twitter, instagram, or whatever sites you like the most!

  • You can also use the indiegogo share tools

Thank you all so much for your support!

story:
I am a creative entrepreneur residing in Indianapolis, IN.  A jack of many trades, I especially love the process of casting and creating custom artwork on belly casts for pregnant women and couples. 

I noticed many women during pregnancy saying how bad they felt about their bodies at that particular point in their life.  By casting their belly at the fullest during the pregnancy (35-40 weeks) and creating meaningful custom artwork on it, I give mamas and couples a lasting memory of how beautiful their body actually is at this time.

It has been my dream to open a comfortable studio space out of which to work and just need a minor leg-up to make this happen.  The space is chosen and affordable. Please help me create an inviting and comfortable place for women to get this service.

This type of business has been successful in many places around the world and with low start up costs and low overhead, I believe I can make this work as well with your help.

What We Need

 What we need:
*  Furniture, particularly comfortable chairs and tables to work at.
*Plaster, joint compound, gesso, and other art supplies.
*Tools such as sanders and a drill.
*Marketing material like a door sign and take away artist cards.
*Food and drinks for open houses and monthly "First Friday." 

Risks & Challenges

 Like any business, there is the risk of not being profitable.  With experience running a successful face painting business for the past 2 years, I believe I will make decisions that will minimize risk and costs of running this business.  I have learned to be thrifty, spend wisely and take small risks.  I have also networked with more artists and am getting my name out in the community.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Make some noise!  Share on facebook, with your local pregnant friends, and other pregnancy services.  I appreciate it all!

story:
Hi my name is Jose Braithwaite and I am a visual artist. Points of departure for 

my artwork are spirituality, science, sociopolitical and historical events.  My 

work has been featured in several art venues such as South Africa’s Creative 

Network., Loma Casa Del Arte, and Allegro Galeria in Panama.  Dalla Rosa 

Gallery, 20x20 Magazine in London.  Harding Gallery San Francisco, the 

Institute of Polish Culture in Budapest, Project Smile Exibition FPFF in Gdynia 

Poland, and Perpignan France.


Immersed in the remotest areas of my thoughts, I depict themes using strong 

abstract and conceptual narratives that confront the viewer with bold directness 

and informal accuracy that which contains several stages of layers in a 

bewildering variety of materials.  Some examples are pigments extracted from 

the soils, clay, and a variety of ash from organic and inorganic elements 

overlaying abstract forms with elaborate schemes.




    

Some examples are pigments extracted from

the soils, clay, and a variety of ash from organic and inorganic elements 

overlaying abstract forms with elaborate schemes.









STAR  SEED WHISPER



﻿

Star Seed Whisper is a cultural research of American & African ethnic groups 

depicted in a fine art photography book through contemporary art venues.  Our 

goal is to create bridges between native and contemporary cultures  by showing 

their sociocultural ties through visual arts.



Emerging from fine art photographs of African and Central American ethnic 

groups and mixed media visual arts, Star Seed Whisper is bound with a series of 

art residencies / exhibitions in cities such as:  Chiyoda, Tokyo,  Berlin,  Beijing, 

Budapest,  Dubai,  Hong Kong,  New York,  London,  Paris,  Saudi Arabia,  

Stockholm,  and Zurich.



 

Star Seed Whisper collaborated with established and emerging performance

artists from each city and country, carrying out open studios, lectures, and 

workshops, thus creating a contemporary art dialogue between cultures.



﻿




By contributing whit these program  we will be able to achieve
  • Cultural research (Photo expedition)
  • Book publication
  • Art residencies / exhibition
  • Cultural exchange



CULTURAL RESEARCH


The photography and audio expedition will begin in the Central America region 

of Guatemala and its’ borders within South America's dense forest of the Darien 

province in Panama (which also borders with Colombia).  I will then visit the 

Dogon people living the central plateau region of Mali, West Africa, as well as 

South Sudan, touring the east of the continent into Ethiopia's southern nation of 

the Omo valley.

 

      

 The Miskito: from Cape Camarón Honduras to Río Grande Nicaragua.

 The Bribris and Gnassos (Teribe): Territory extends the border 

between Costa Rica and Panama. 

 The Ngobe -Bugle (Guaymí): Western mountainous areas of Bocas Del 

Toro, Panama. 

 The Embera –Wounaan:  are in the rainforest of the province of Darien 

Republic of Panama, and the border of the Republic of Colombia. 

 Dinka people:  One of the largest ethnic groups in the south of Sudan. 

 The Kara: Nilotic ethnic group inhabiting South Sudan. 

 Dogons:  living in the central plateau region of Mali, West Africa. 

 The Lenca people: The largest of the indigenous groups in Honduras.

 The Mursi, Kara, Jinka, Dimeka, Turmi, Hamar, and Surma inhabits 

Ethiopia's Omo Valley.






FINE ART PHOTOGRAPHIC BOOK


I will be publishing two versions of Star Seed Whisper book:  the Premier 

Edition and the Deluxe Exclusive Limited Edition.  ALL PERKS ARE 

EXCLUSIVE EDITIONS ONLY FOR STAR SEED WHISPER INDIEGOGO 

CONTRIBUTORS.

The Premier Edition is a hardcover, 8x10 inch, fine art photography book.  The 

Deluxe Limited Edition is a hardcover 12x12 inch fine art photography book.



Premier Edition is a  hardcover, 8x10 inch,  fine art photographic book.  The Deluxe Limited Edition is a hardcover 12x12 inch  fine art photographic book.




ART RESIDENCIES / EXHIBITIONS


The Star Seed Whisper art residencies/exhibitions will begin November

2015 and culminate in the year 2017.  I will develop a new series of 

mixed media visual art, adjoining photographs of ethnic communities.  

Star Seed Whisper will present exhibitions at contemporary art venues, 

collaborating with performance artists.  The public will also participate in 

a series of activities creating cultural bridges via lectures and workshops.



  • Collaborating with  The Office of Promotion of Culture Poland and World Smile Archive.  By creating art workshops and collecting smile autographs from children in hospitals around the world fighting the most deadly diseases.

                                                         

 







How will the founds will be used?


Your support to this project is crowd source funding at its best. Funds will be used for

Expeditions expenses
   Transportation, lodging, meals

Photographic supplies
   Color, Black & white negative films 35mm, medium format 120 and 4x5 Plates
   Colored, Black & white 16mm and 8mm negative motion film
   Dark room supplies
   Fine art fiber and paper and dark room chemistry

Art Residencies\Exhibitions and Cultural Expenses
   Art studio space rent
   Exhibition space rent ( New York, Tokyo,  Berlin,  Beijing, Budapest,  Dubai,  Hong Kong,  London,  Paris,  Saudi Arabia,  Stockholm and Zurich )
   Mix media art supplies ( Organic materials dirt, lead, woodcuts, straw and other materials such as steel, cooper and industrial materials )
   Art transportation studio to exhibition spaces

Exhibition expenses
Art performance casting
   Performances artist collaboration

Cultural exchanges expenses
   workshops
   lectures

Advertising and marketing expenses
   Flyers
   Social Media
   
Book Editorial
    Editing, Printing, Publication, Distribution




Thank you so much for your support! I feel so happy to share with you all!









FAQs


During the expedition and art residencies, our contributors  will be receiving Star Seed Whisper exclusives up dates.

PRE - PRODUCTION PHASE

Gain support of ethnic communities  (successful)
Fund Raise for production and post-production phase (current stage)

PRODUCTION AND POST PRODUCTION PHASE
Expeditions  ethnic cultural research: May 2015 to September 2015
Photographic Reproductions, editorial productions: September 2015 to mid November 2015
Perks will be sen to contributors: mid November 2015
Star Seed Whisper Book Publication mid December 2015
Art residencies / exhibitions and Cultural exchanges (workshops,  lectures): December 2015  true  2017




What's in the book?

Portraits, people, landscapes, autochthonous cultural and rituals, symbols, hand

made drawings,  natives, free hand writings,  and prose by established and 

emerging contemporary poets.  All textual content will be translated in over five 

languages.



Other ways you can Help

Spread the word! Let everyone know about STAR SEED WHISPER . Get in contact with your friend and social media contacts and let them know about this campaign. Mention it on Twitter,  Facebook, wherever people hang out on the internet nowadays.

Shipping Cost

Shipping will be estimated to cost:
USA                             $15
Everywhere Else      $20
Expedited shipping will be available to all contributors and you will be informed of all your shipping options via email at the book's completion.





Click here see how you can contribute

Keep in mind that sharing links to a campaign by email or social media is one of the very best ways to spread the word.





Challenges

 Our challenge in printing and publishing Star Seed Whisper, is to get superbly fine art books. Editorial challenge is covered, since we will be working with a well established publisher who has printed many fine art photography books before. Expedition challenges are the ground we have to cover in a specific time frame, and being in intimate contact with members of the communities. This challenge also is covered, by people we know personally who live and are members of the ethnic groups that we will be visiting.

story:
What is Museum Connect Project "By The Work of Her Hands "

By The Work of Her Hands  is an exchange program organized by the American Alliance of Museums (AAM) and supported by the US State Department, Bureau of Educational and Cultural Affairs, which  seeks to put a group of Moroccan and a group of American textile artists in conversation with one another.

In March, we had the pleasure to host the group of American women quilters and students from New York University in Morocco, where we held an exhibition of their collective pieces and documentary film and photographs and conducted several workshops on the American women's textile techniques with Moroccan women from the project that was also open to the public.

This June, it is the Moroccan group's turn to travel to the United States, where the Moroccan women and students will have the chance to visit New York City and Philadelphia, and exhibit their work at the Fabric Workshop and Museum. This is an once in a lifetime opportunity for these women, specifically, most of them who have never traveled outside of their home country, to learn about the American culture and way of life.

But the budget the Museum Connect allows us does not cover all travel expenses for all embroideries women participants. 

We need to raise enough money to cover the travel costs for two Moroccan women - in less than a month!

Help us bring these Moroccan embroiderers to the United States and be a part of this amazing project!

Why we need your help

This project, by linking women from both sides of the Atlantic Ocean through their shared passion for their art, leads towards a deeper cross-cultural understanding of one another.

First and foremost, this project allows for an exchange of experience - both in their work, as well as in their lives. This trip to the United States will allow the Moroccan participants to discover another culture, explore new ways to develop their creativity, and learn new skills.

What we need and your thank's gift

For each women, the total travel costs are equivalent to $4,080, which covers the following costs:

Flight (roundtrip): $1,800

Lodging in New York and Philadelphia: $1,440

Meals: $480

Passport and visa: $240

Transport in the US: $120

In total, in order for the four Moroccan women to participate in the program in the United States, we are looking for your support to raise $8,160 in total.

For helping out this campaign, you can choose from an assortment of goodies based on your level of funding, including the following:

  • An e-mail thank you card from Au Grain de Sésame
  • Beautiful photo of the handmade Moroccan embroidered patchworks made out of recycled paper and signed by the women themselves
  • Photo of traditional Moroccan embroidery
  • An unique piece of Moroccan embroidery made out of recycled paper by the Moroccan women

If we are not able to raise enough money in time for the trip, the money collected will go towards paying for new art books, materials, and tools for the women working in the Au Grain de Sésame workshops.

The IMPACT of Your Contribution

The project thus far has had nothing but success. "By the Work of Her Hands" won first prize by the Museums Connect Program and continues to garner attention and interest by the general public and by the press both in the United States as well as in Morocco. We hope that in this second phase taking place in the United States we will experience just as much success as we did in Morocco.

Art, through innovative and valuable training in the context of exchange, has the power to develop savoir-faire, strengthen skills, and open the world up to a deeper understanding of oneself and of the other. It gives access to a better life full of peace, love, and harmony.

Anything you can give is valuable to us!

  • Spread the word about the campaign,
  • Connect us with like-minded institutional partners and people interested in the work that we do,
  • Do not hesitate to use all the sharing options on Indiegogo to help spread our message of hope!

Shukran, Thank you.

story:
Short Summary

Hello! My name is Patrick and I need your help.  When my grandfather passed away a several years ago I inherited his large stamp collection.  I am currently in the process of sorting and cataloging each and every stamp.  So far I have over 1,000 stamps digitally scanned, categorized, and inventoried in my computer. 

Screen cap of the Inventory/Category software I use.

At first this tasked seemed daunting and never achievable due to the overwhelming amount of stamps he has.

Each box is FULL of stamps unknown.

 Plus, I was a little skeptical at the whole notion of stamp collecting. I mean they are just little pieces of paper you lick and slap on an envelope to mail a letter right? Well, technically YES, however, over the past year I have realized why people collect stamps.  Each stamp is work of ART.  A mini Picasso or Michelangelo if you will.  The early stamps were hand engraved and printed.  Even the PAPER was hand made. When you realize the detail and work put into the stamps you begin to appreciate them.

The oldest stamp I have discovered was printed in the late 1880's. 125 years old!!!! These stamps are old, fragile, and need protected.  

Belgium #49 from 1884

I am asking for your help to purchase a gun safe that is fire proof, so that in case the worst happens, at least these irreplaceable stamps will be protected.  I realize that this right now is a private collection and you may be skeptical of donating for a safe, which is understandable.  When I am done scanning and cataloging these stamps, I intend on DONATING the stamps to a museum or anything like a museum.

Collecting stamps is a dying hobby and I want to do what I can to continue the passion my grandfather had for it.

And of course, THANK YOU for any donation!!

Sincerely,

Patrick 


What I Need 

Fire Proof Gun Safe at least 5 feet high, 18 inches wide, and 12 inches deep (for Boxes)

  • Safes range from mid 600's to as high as 2500. The safe I am looking at is the size needed to safely store boxes and will protect them for at least an hour in 1,200 degree heat.
  • If my goal is not met, don't worry!  I thank you anyway for helping defer the cost of such a safe.  I will include the safe with the stamps if needed, or I will sell the safe and use the money to donate to Wounded Warrior Project.
  • Fire Proof Safe from Bass Pro. If not this model, one close to it will work.

The Impact

Each of your contributions no matter the size will help me protect my grandfathers collection of history.  Each of these stamps come from a time period of great turmoil in the world.  From WWI to WWII and conflicts in Russia.  Some of the stamps I have are from countries that NO LONGER EXIST.

  • It is because of the reasons above I feel the need to protect these stamps because they do have some historical value.

Other Ways You Can Help

Word of mouth is one of the most valuable resources anyone can have. If you can't or don't want to contribute monetarily, NO WORRIES! Your passing the word to others about this venture is just as valuable.  Thank you either way!


Google Drive Image Link

Thank you for taking a look at what stamps are available right now!  Every day I try to add at least 40 more stamps.  Some days I can't due to other commitments or just the sheer difficulty of categorizing each stamp.  Use this link to peruse.  
** If you were kind enough to donate $20 and get a wall print.  This link is where you want to find which stamp you want.**
Google Drive Stamp Images
story_txt:
Short Summary Hello! My name is Patrick and I need your help.  When my grandfather passed away a several years ago I inherited his large stamp collection.  I am currently in the process of sorting and cataloging each and every stamp.  So far I have over 1,000 stamps digitally scanned, categorized, and inventoried in my computer. 


Screen cap of the Inventory/Category software I use.
At first this tasked seemed daunting and never achievable due to the overwhelming amount of stamps he has.


Each box is FULL of stamps unknown. Plus, I was a little skeptical at the whole notion of stamp collecting. I mean they are just little pieces of paper you lick and slap on an envelope to mail a letter right? Well, technically YES, however, over the past year I have realized why people collect stamps.  Each stamp is work of ART.  A mini Picasso or Michelangelo if you will.  The early stamps were hand engraved and printed.  Even the PAPER was hand made. When you realize the detail and work put into the stamps you begin to appreciate them.
The oldest stamp I have discovered was printed in the late 1880's. 125 years old!!!! These stamps are old, fragile, and need protected.  


Belgium #49 from 1884
I am asking for your help to purchase a gun safe that is fire proof, so that in case the worst happens, at least these irreplaceable stamps will be protected.  I realize that this right now is a private collection and you may be skeptical of donating for a safe, which is understandable.  When I am done scanning and cataloging these stamps, I intend on DONATING the stamps to a museum or anything like a museum.
Collecting stamps is a dying hobby and I want to do what I can to continue the passion my grandfather had for it.
And of course, THANK YOU for any donation!!
Sincerely,
Patrick 
   What I Need  Fire Proof Gun Safe at least 5 feet high, 18 inches wide, and 12 inches deep (for Boxes)  Safes range from mid 600's to as high as 2500. The safe I am looking at is the size needed to safely store boxes and will protect them for at least an hour in 1,200 degree heat. 
If my goal is not met, don't worry!  I thank you anyway for helping defer the cost of such a safe.  I will include the safe with the stamps if needed, or I will sell the safe and use the money to donate to Wounded Warrior Project.

Fire Proof Safe from Bass Pro.  If not this model, one close to it will work.    The Impact Each of your contributions no matter the size will help me protect my grandfathers collection of history.  Each of these stamps come from a time period of great turmoil in the world.  From WWI to WWII and conflicts in Russia.  Some of the stamps I have are from countries that NO LONGER EXIST.  It is because of the reasons above I feel the need to protect these stamps because they do have some historical value.


    Other Ways You Can Help Word of mouth is one of the most valuable resources anyone can have. If you can't or don't want to contribute monetarily, NO WORRIES! Your passing the word to others about this venture is just as valuable.  Thank you either way!

Google Drive Image Link

story:
En Bref

Vous connaissez et appréciez les visites virtuelles que je réalise et qui sont à votre disposition sur https://www.vue-360.com depuis pas mal de temps. 

D'ici quelques jours il y aura l'option également de profiter de ces visites à l'aide de casques de réalité virtuelle (Google CardBoard, Homido, Samsung Gear VR, Oculus Rift, ... )

Mais je voudrais pouvoir aller plus loin et proposer de nouvelles fonctionnalités en utilisant les excellents logiciels de Kolor : http://www.kolor.com/store/virtual-tour/software/virtual-tour-software/pack-autopano-giga-3-0-panotour-pro-2-0-livepano.html

Ce dont j'ai besoin

J'ai financé moi-même tout mon matériel et de nombreux programmes. Je n'ai pas de budget pour financer ces logiciels (700 euros). Je me dis que si tout le monde participe un peu, vous aurez de nouveaux panoramas de lieux intéressants en Angleterre, pour le plaisir de vos yeux...

Voyage pour tous ? 

Dans le cadre de ce projet, je souhaite également permettre à des personnes ne pouvant se déplacer pour différentes raisons (âge, santé, finances, occupation) de pouvoir voyager de façon virtuelle.

Risques et défis

Vu que j'ai tout le matériel, la seule chose qui me manque c'est cet ensemble de programmes. La prise de vue panoramique est une technique que je maitrise, le beau temps arrivant, tout est ensemble pour pouvoir faire de belles visites.

D'autres façons d'aider

Si vous ne pouvez pas ou ne voulez pas investir dans ce projet artistique, vous pouvez aider... en partageant ce projet de financement, en partageant mon site ou en partageant ma page Facebook ( https://facebook.com/vue360 ) 


Merci

Merci

story:
Short Summary

I'm a full time worker who tries to be a knifemaker. This campaign is needed because i need some tools and a workshop in order to grow and to be a professional. I'll be apriciated if you can help me to reach my goal!

What We Need & What You Get

Let me give you all the detail about campaign;

  • The total amount of money needed is $3000 and here is the breakdown;
    • $520 - Belt Grinder 
    • $650 -  Milwaukee Band Saw (Turkey Price)
    • $1300 - 10 Months of Workshop Rent ($130 each month) 
    • ~$530 - Workshop Construction & small tools and furniture
  • Even if i dont reach my $3000 goal, i'll use every penny to my knifemaking story. 

The Impact

If i dont get a workshop and the tools i need, i'll stay as a hobbyist and who knows maybe one day i have to leave knifemaking because of the hardwork without tools & absent of the space i need. 

  • Knifemaking by hand is still an art and has to live around the world. I'm another knifemaker who tries to ensure knifemaking  is continuing around the world. 
  • I'm already making knifes but one knife takes 2 or 3 weeks to complete. You can check my works at my instagram page! 

Risks & Challenges

As i mention before, i'm doing knifes in my balcony (hardly 2 or 3 square meter) and it is too small for this kind of job. There will be some health issues (lack of the air ventilation) & noise about the getting more and more problem since i'm living in apartment. 

If i'll have a workshop, i can overcome these problems and make knifes more qualified and more clean. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you dont contribute my project, at least share this page on your facebook and instagram accounts to help me! 

Thanks!
