story:
About the project:

Light as a Feather… is an exhibition exploring the continuing cultural influence of the teen witch. In the wake of a shifting global political climate, magic manifests as a pop cultural symbol for empowerment and positivism. The exhibition is comprised of installations and a series of performative rituals, harnessing witchcraft and magic in its many forms. The Moana coven bring together the work of established and emerging artists. Conjuring quasi-rituals and pseudo-scientific experiments, they will call upon the witch’s enduring feminist strength and the role of superstition and talismans in our prevailing mood of uncertainty.

The exhibition will first be shown at the historic Domain House in Hobart, appearing as part of the inaugural HOBIENNALE, and reincarnated in Perth at Moana Project Space in early 2018.

HOBIENNALE 2017 is a new and unique festival which will take place in Hobart from the 3 -12th November 2017. A large group of artist-run initiatives from across Australia and New Zealand have teamed up for the festival, each curating an exhibition as part of the program. For more information on the festival see www.hobiennale.com

What you can help us achieve:

The potion in our cauldron is running low! Donations to our campaign will go towards paying artist fees, the cost of installation and construction materials, and publication costs. Some practical magic is urgently needed to make something wicked this way come. Payment in Galleons, Knuts, and Sickles not accepted.

About us:

Moana Project Space is an artist-run contemporary gallery located in the heart of Perth’s central business district.

Since its inception in 2012, Moana has operated as a platform for the production and exhibition of contemporary visual art, with a particular focus on supporting ambitious new work and curatorial projects from young and early career artists, curators and writers from across Australia. 

Moana’s current Directors are Jess Boyce, Emma Buswell, Grace Connors, Miranda Johnson, and Matthew Siddall.

Visit moana-ari.com for information on our previous exhibitions. 

What We Need & What You Get:

Our goal of $2,500 goes towards artist fees, installation and construction materials, and publication costs, all of which will greatly enrich the exhibition’s impact and ensure we don’t hex the heritage-listed walls! Funding will also help us to transport the exhibition back to Perth on our magic broomsticks to Moana Project Space for an exhibition in early 2018.

If we don’t reach our entire goal, we will prioritise paying artist fees, as we feel that this is the most important aspect of our show - artists should be paid for the amazing work they produce.

Supporters of our fundraising will receive a small talisman in return.

These talismans manifest in various forms:

All supporters will receive a message of thanks on our dedicated exhibition website, and will also receive a copy of our catalogue. 

For supporters of $5 or more, you will receive by express owl an e-card consisting of one of our favourite witchy GIFs.

For supporters of $10 or more, a Moana-branded mood ring will unlock the hidden powers of your psyche.

For supporters of $25 or more, a magical Spotify playlist will be manifested in your account, hand-picked by our coven.

For supporters of $50 or more, a bar card that provides the enchanter with renewable potion juice at a Moana gallery opening night of their choice AND a witchy e-card.

For supporters of $175 or more, a custom-conjured Weasley-initial jumper wand-knitted by coven member Emma Buswell AND a Spotify playlist AND a Moana branded mood ring AND a witchy e-card.

For supporters of $300 or more, you get ALL of the above, plus our eternal devotion, and a free cleansing of the soul at the next full moon.

The Impact:

Moana is one of only two artist-run spaces representing WA at this exciting new international, artist run festival. As such, it is an amazing opportunity for us to show the creativity and strength of our local community on a national scale.

It will also exhibit the work of emerging Australian artists to the wider national and international community, alongside more established and internationally respected artists - a unique opportunity for career development for these artists.

Moreover, this networking opportunity will have ongoing effects in terms of the quality of international exhibitions and collaborations we will be able to present at Moana Project Space in the future.

Other Ways You Can Help:

Share this campaign and receive 12 years of good luck. 

Attend Light as a Feather… and our associated public programs as part of HOBIENNALE at Domain House, Glebe, Tasmania. November 3-12 November 2017. See the full calendar of HOBIENNALE events here.

Share the event with your Hobart friends, families, and other magical beings.  

Attend Light as a Feather… at Moana Project Space, Perth in early 2018.

Sign up to our mailing list, like us on Facebook, or follow us on Instagram to keep up to date with all our magical adventures, including the announcement of the dates for the Perth iteration of the show.

Image: Jack Caddy, Keep Calm and Practice Wicca (still),2017, 3-channel looped video.

story:
Boston #StandsWithImmigrants is a public art project that seeks to push back against the intensifying climate of fear and exclusion by emblazoning the faces of immigrants on the cityscape of Boston. 

Jennis Perez | Cuban Cleaner - Projected onto the Old State House

The project is part portrait series, part public art installation. (All photographs you see here are pictures of our actual living projections, not mock-ups made in photoshop.)

I am photographing the region’s most compelling immigrants and refugees - from David Ortiz and Yo-Yo Ma to agricultural workers, policemen, and cleaners. Then, using cinema-grade technology, I am projecting those faces onto Boston’s urban landscape where they tower three-stories high, inhabiting trees, buildings, bridges and trains. 

Projection in the Boston Public Garden

The projections are both interactive (people happen upon them, which invites speculation, in-the-moment conversation, sharing, and reflection) and enduring (photos of the projections live on as a stand-alone body of work that will travel the world through galleries and social media).

Through this project, I seek to make evident — in a visually arresting, yet human way – that immigrants and refugees are integral to the fabric of our society. And that ‘they’ are, in fact, ‘us.’

Retired Red Sox Slugger David Ortiz | Dominican Republic

Background

Boston is viewed around the world as a leader in entrepreneurship, technology, science, academics and medicine. Much of the work that happens here - from the pioneering to the everyday - relies on the integral contributions of foreign-born residents. 

Twenty percent of Massachusetts entrepreneurs are foreign-born and they collectively employ nearly 135,000 workers, according to a study by New American Economy. Immigrants also account for significant portions of entire job categories in Massachusetts: housekeepers (65%), medical scientists (59%), head chefs (44%), software developers (35%), doctors and surgeons (34%), and manufacturing workers (34%) - according to the most recent census data.

Jennifer Hyoje-Ryu Kenty | South Korean Farmer - Projected on a barn in Concord, MA

But Boston is only one part of a national conversation. The travel bans, anti-immigrant rhetoric, and nationalist leanings in Washington white-wash our history as a nation of immigrants. And they slam the door on the flow of visitors, immigrants and refugees who have enriched our nation with their ideas, dreams, drive, culture and entrepreneurship.

Goals

The goals of this project are education, inspiration, and dialogue.  The project succeeds:

Every time someone learns the name of an immigrant and understands in a personal - and perhaps surprising way - the contributions they make.  

When a passerby pauses at a projection and leaves buoyed by its beauty and message of inclusion. 

 When our audience engages in conversation, especially respectful dialogue between people with divergent views.

A crowd gathered to see a projection on the Boston Public Garden

Current State of the Work

This project is already underway. Thanks to hundreds of hours logged by collaborators, teams of assistants working late into the night, loans of very expensive equipment and a growing network of partners, I’ve launched this project for less than $5,000. But I’ve exhausted every favor to source the technology and muster the manpower on the cheap. To fully bring this project to life, I need help. 

Specifically, I need your help to purchase a projector.

In order to project three-story images onto brightly-lit buildings, I need an industrial-strength projector. They are robust, expensive pieces of equipment (see below), but we’ve gotten a really generous price from our dealer. 

Projector Expenses

 Any money raised above and beyond the expenses above will be applied to expanding the project both in Boston and to other cities in the United States.

Haseeb Hosein | Trinidad Captain, Boston Police Department - Projected on Lee School in District B-3 where Hosein supervises.

Looking Forward 

I have four galleries eagerly awaiting the finished body of work, great partners, and many more subjects to feature (doctors, members of the military, religious leaders, a Syrian family...).  But I can't do it without you. 

I believe in this project. I believe that creativity can give elegant, human and delightful answers to the most complex problems in the world. This project is so effective because it cuts through the noise of our everyday existence. It’s unexpected, mysterious and beautiful. It provides a dignified answer to hate-filled rhetoric. It confronts us without being confrontational and touches people at a time when we’re hungry for reassurance. 

Thaer Abdallah | Iraq - Palestinian Artist and Human Rights Activist born in Baghdad

So please join me and take a stand for immigrants and refugees in this country. In the face of threats to our democracy, help me answer - With love. With thoughtful reproach. With art.

More information is available at our website - www.standswithimmigrants.org

Thank You!

Eva Millona | Albania Executive Director, Mass. Immigrant and Refugee Advocacy Coalition

Risks and Challenges

Given the current sensitivity around being an immigrant in this country, selecting subjects to take part in such a public campaign is a delicate process. We acknowledge and respect that people may not want to take part, and we will take extra effort to assure all participants are comfortable with their involvement.

More information is available at our website - www.standswithimmigrants.org
Thank You!

Eva Millona | Albania Executive Director, Mass. Immigrant and Refugee Advocacy Coalition
Risks and Challenges
Given the current sensitivity around being an immigrant in this country, selecting subjects to take part in such a public campaign is a delicate process. We acknowledge and respect that people may not want to take part, and we will take extra effort to assure all participants are comfortable with their involvement.

story:
Greetings from Uratz Studios

Uratz Studios have been producing costumes, Masks, props and other cosplay related gear for Cosplayers worldwide since 2009

Now we would like to present to you our latest masterpiece with special hybridization of 2 different materials that have never been done before which is a Carbonfiber Faceshell magnetized to a Resin Fiberglass Helmet. The entire helmet weighs less than 2 kg. even with all the soft Eva foam padding inside and internal fan and as an early bird special you can upgrade for free Light up Eyes.

Why this project is important to us.

Because of the way we do things like investing all we’ve got into quality materials and craftsmanship, it comes with a high price most companies would do mainly because it cuts down on the profit margin sacrificing quality. Here at Uratz Studios, founder Mike Loh, disagrees strongly against this practice, after all - why make someone pay so much for inferior products? It’s never fair to the consumers and as someone who asks himself daily:

“Would I pay for this knowing how this prop is made?” The answer, for me, is yes.

Because of this, we make little money and its been tough on our business and we hope that by supporting this campaign you can help us get out of debt so that we may continue to not just survive but thrive again so that we may support the cosplay community with supern designs done at a high quality with props that you can pass down to your children and their children unlike most props made of foam or inferior materials that won’t last the year even at high expenses.

Product Details:

2 Materials hybridization
Carbonfiber faceplate with magnetic attachments
Resin fiberglass helmet with back plate

2 sizes
Widest ear to ear diameter opening.
16cm medium
17cm Large

Several options
1 Carbonfiber with Black helmet
2 Red Carbonfiber standard edition
3 Red hood Edition

Mirror Lenses or Light Eyes Options available in the Perks or simply send me a message of what you want. Please include your phone number along with your Shipping Address.

We have already began production and once this campaign is over we will go full force on the Helmets with an expected delivery date in October, shipping mid October in time for Halloween!

 

So please feel free to share this campaign and be a part of History in making Uratz Studios great.

Thanks for your support!

 

*This Product is a totally Custom Original Concept totally unrelated to Marvel/Disney or DC properties. Any similarities are purely coincidental.

story:
THE IDEA!

 Experience the playa within a sacred universal symbol from the ancient future that radiates positivity, acceptance and love! 

We are ready to share our mobile art as a vortexual space of peace and light with the citizens of Black Rock City, NV and the residents of the universe! This project is a huge challenge, unlike anything we’ve ever conceived or attempted--and that challenge is very exciting for us! We feel inspired to push our boundaries and make great art happen!

 

WHAT WE NEED TO MAKE IT HAPPEN!

We are asking for $8,500 that will all be used towards materials, specialty metal cutting and fabrication, lighting, power, and general mutation of the base vehicle, as well as a full makeover of the interior cabin and second level platform, both a complete sit-inside rainbow. Our current platform, a 1973 Plymouth Fury has been to BRC in several iterations from other artists and crews between 2005-2009.

 

HOW WILL FUNDS BE USED? 

Parts, tools, fuel system, battery, brakes --$2900

 

Mutation Materials for prism concept, metal cutting/fabrication and interior retrofit--$1650

 

Electrical rewiring, batteries and parts -- $1100

 

Transportation to/from the playa --$900

 

Radical Illumination/Lights-- $900

 

Storage-- $800

 

Copper Pyramid-- $250

 

TOTAL = $8500

 

By donating to this project you will directly contribute to the creation of a mobile healing Vortex and art piece by and for the citizens of Black Rock City, debuting at Burning Man 2018. PLUS, there are several awesome perks levels to incentivize your gift, if you are so inclined.           

 

We LOVE our PERKS!

These are all unique, few of a kind, handmade art pieces or hard services from skilled tradespeople, all provided by our crew commanders! Counting down....

 

#16--For just $3, we will give you a huge hug when we see you or a distance hug from afar! 

 

#15--We've got opinions aplenty. Need a second one? Have an idea you’re unsure of? We will happily help via email or phone with your burning question or predicament. 

 

#14--Full color Burning Man schwag SPECTRA sticker

 

#13--Intuitive Oracle Card Reading; Ask a question or receive a general reading using the Ascended Masters Oracle Deck.

 

#12--Distance Reiki Healing Session. It’s simple: donate, send us a photo of yourself then grant us permission to do the good work!

 

#11--Limited Edition SPECTRA Enamel Art Pin

 

#10--$25 Baby SPECTRA Pendant is SPECTRA inspired, handcrafted jewelry-art by Heather Boom Caruso. All pendants are hand sculpted and painted polymer clay necklace with rainbows and prismatic glitter.

 

#9--$45 SPECTRA inspired pendant by Heather Boom Caruso.

 

#8--$65 SPECTRA PRISM EFFECT pendant with rainbow ray by Heather Boom Caruso.

 

#7--Bandana 2-pack; Variety of designer stash pocket bandanas by BandHana Fashion (www.bandhanafashion.com)

 

#6-- Bandana 4-pack; Variety of designer stash pocket bandanas by BandHana Fashion (www.bandhanafashion.com)

 

#5--Burning Man Hair did by SF Hair Artist Heather ‘Boom’ Caruso (www.gingerrubio.com)

 

#4--For a mere $600, enjoy a Southern-inspired 4-Course Dinner or Brunch meal for 8 on playa, Prepared by Chef Sam in the comforts of the Mothership Ascension camp.

 

#3--100% Handmade Custom Playa Coat (any from current collection) by Sublime Designs. Choose from a large selection beautiful faux furs and more (www.wearesublimedesigns.com)

 

#2--2 hr Burning Man 2018 Art Tour for you & 4 friends on SPECTRA: Prism of Perpetual Enlightenment (Your choice one-time only Monday-Thursday ...Perk is $$Priceless$$)!

 

#1--3 hr Burning Man 2018 'Champagne Cruise' for you & 5 friends on SPECTRA: Prism of Perpetual Enlightenment. 4 bottles of Champagne gifted during tour (Your choice one-time only Monday-Thursday ...Perk is $$Priceless$$). 

 

 

WHAT HAPPENS WITH FUNDS RAISED?

100% of funds raised will go towards building, lighting, and generally mutating the base shape of SPECTRA. If we do not reach the full fundraising goal for SPECTRA, the funds that ARE raised will all still go to funding as listed above, and will be supplemented through garage sales and selling crew plasma...teehee ;-P

 

RISKS & CHALLENGES?

The risks and challenges we face in this project are many! Learning a bunch of new skills well enough to bring a large-scale art project to life is quite daunting. 

We have 15-years  of festival camping setup experience, and as a crew have faced many types of significant logistical challenges in group planning, personalities, commitment and organization. Wiser now, we heartily welcome a new evolution that will come with working on project manifestation of a higher level and developing this creation for all to enjoy.

We will level with you...if there were NOT a SIGNIFICANT amount of risks and challenges in doing a project like this one, well...everyone would be doing it! The playa and default would be littered with art cars.But alas, only a select few are offered the opportunity to have their vehicle reviewed for licensing by the Department of Mutant Vehicles at Black Rock City; And we have this amazing opportunity!

SPECTRA art car will be met with positivity and exceptional solution-skills, community input and assistance, whilst remaining firmly flexible in concept and design. SPECTRA will require loads of support from our crew and of course, YOU! We are thankful to all who have given us direction, assistance and inspiration to continue on. 

 

WHAT CAN YOU DO TO HELP?

 

Contribute to our dream! Every donation counts towards our goal, and every dollar will be used mindfully towards that end.

 

We know not everyone can contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help! Please spread the rainbow and share our campaign far and wide!

 

Our biggest supporters are the members of the close-knit community that we intend to serve through this vehicle. We have already met so many new and incredible people that have chosen to come along on this ride with us! That alone motivates us to move forward. Please share our campaign with your family and anyone you think may be interested in our prismatic plight!

story:
Hiyeee! My name is Helen Schmidt. I'm a Tarot Reader based in Los Angeles. I'm a lifelong student of Mysticism with over 5 years of professional experience with Tarot. I've got to work with some rad companies like Teva, Vitruvi, Unique Markets, Savoir Collab, and Gladys Tamez. I am the Zodiac Tarotscope writer for Oh Holisticism. I was the official Tarot Reader for Lightning in a Bottle in 2016. And just 3-months ago, I launched my brand A B R A B I N A H. It means I will create through feminine reasoning. It is a platform for not too woo (but woo) feminine reasoners. The deck for this campaign will be one of the main tools offered on this platform.

About a year ago I had the vision to combine my skills as a Graphic Designer with my love for Tarot to create a Tarot Deck. Something I noticed immediately with Tarot was how old-school and a little out there it can be. So, I wanted to change that with this deck and along the way I got to dive deeper with myself, discover who I am, discover why I am who I am, and learn how to express it.

The three words I would describe my deck would be sultry, sophisticated and simple. It pairs nicely with a glass of Rosé and a fireplace. It is loosely based off of my first love, the Crowley-Thoth tarot deck. This set will come with 78 cards, a guide booklet, and a matchbook box.

Here's a little teaser of the deck...

DETAILED SPECS BELOW
CARDS: 350gsm white core paper + CMYK Printing + Matte lamination for both sides + 70x120 mm + 78 cards + silver foil detailing on the back of the cards.

BOOKLET: 200gsm white core paper for covers + 100gsm paper for inside pages, 200 pages + Matte lanimation + Size: 70x120mm + full-colour printing for covers, white and black printing for pages.

MATCHBOOK BOX: 1200gsm grey cardboard + 157gsm white core paper + matte lamination + CMYK printing for outside of the box.

I will still move forward with the production of the cards even if I don't hit my goal.

Production will begin after this campaign is over. Roughly 20 days to print and another 15 days to ship to my home. Campaign backers will be sent their decks immediately after, I'm estimating by the first week of September 2018. 

And if you rockstars manage to get this over my campaign goal, I will update this campaign page with my next phase plan. 

As a co-parent to 2 cats and a dog, animals mean a lot to me. I don't often think about how other parts of the world don't really have a system to keep my furry friends safe and protected. A close friend of mine recently shed this light on me with her powerful article about this tatted bad-ass in her town in Mexico who provides pro bono animal sterilizations. I mean, he really does so much more than that, so I really encourage you to read the article.

I just really believe in his cause, so, in an effort to help him and his organization out I will be donating $2 for every Tarot Deck I sell to Esteriliza y Educa. The counter begins when my decks go officially on sale in September 2018.

1 Card Baby E-Reading - You can ask me any question you want for this 1 Card pull. I will write it up then send it to you with e-love.

30-Min Tarot Sesh (over Skype) - My tarot reading sessions are designed to take you deeper into your reality. Leaving you with tools and insight to put you in better control of your world. It is navigated by the Crowley-Thoth (soon the A B R A B I N A H) deck then fine-tuned with Astrology and my intuition. If you contribute to a bundle reading session option, you can combine times for a longer session. You can gift a session of yours as well. 

Treat Yo Self-Love Ritual Candle - These candles were charged under the Full Moon in Sagittarius on May 29th, 2018 and Reiki infused by Paulina from Mystic Cravings. It comes with a couple of Rose Quartz pieces to help bring in the energy of love. Just a heads up, burning this candle will help you put yourself first and show you where you may be overextending your energies. 

Some risks I foresee is something happening with the printer company or the print run. It may delay the expected arrival.  

You don't need to contribute financially to be a part of this campaign. Here are some other ways to be part of the team:

  • Share this in your newsletter.
  • Post it on your social media outlets.
  • Or just talk about with your friends.

story:
Looking for a great wake up on the SUNNY side of life?

 Our mission is to help you solve your breakfast tussles with your kids through fun and attractive utensils. We offer a more rewarding breakfast experience for parents and kids alike and we make it easy for parents to get their children to eat  the most important meal of the day

Fried egg or scrambled egg is one of the most popular and quickest foods to prepare, a favorite of children and adults alike. With the help of a simple tool, anyone can become a real master chef in their own home, much to the delight of their family – children, especially. 

Egg shapers are typically made of silicone. These are molds created to be used in making fun-looking breakfasts, especially in cooking eggs, pancakes, waffle.


  • Food safe. Made out of silicone rubber. 
  • Measures approx. 5.5″”L x 1″W x 5″H.
  • Withstands temperatures of -20°F to 450°F (-30°C to 230­°C).
  • Dishwasher safe.
  • Instructions included





Where do We Stand 


We’ve come from the idea to making the first three shapes. The mold tools, the first few hundred pieces of the product and the packaging is ready. 

We have also launched our new website:  www.funnybreakfast.com


Production costs per item are relatively reasonable, but the mass production minimum order quantity make it really difficult to carry out with our own funds.




Here is where you guys can truly help.  All the money we raise will help us manufacture mass quantity of Funny Breakfast molds and bring the shapes to the next level.


The rewards


What’s next?

During the last 8 months, we were working around the clock designing and building the prototypes, during this time we also contacted dozens of manufacturers, got pricing offers and more importantly, production plans. After choosing some of them each manufacturer was examined carefully by us, and we started discussing specific details including the molds and tooling costs, specifying materials, manufacturing schedules, assembly and packaging options... Now, we have everything we need to make Funny Breakfast molds a perfected product.  

We have manufacturers that can produce our product. We know that the product can be made cost effectively so that you can get your own quality shape at an affordable price. 

All we need is your support. So please donate today and click the share button. Thank you! 

Risks and challenges

Few shapes are on stock now. 
Small quantities can be shipped immediately after the campaign is closed and funds are received.   if the campaign finishes big, we need more time to produce the shapes for you, so please be patient!


----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Special thanks to:  Alíz ,  Trisztán, Fanni, Angie, Robin and Réka.

story:
THE FIRST MOBILE APP OF ITS KIND IN ASIA PACIFIC


*Will be available for both Apple and Android phones


Ever had to leave the lab just to check a solution recipe, or missed a conference registration deadline because you were juggling too many projects simultaneously? 


Or perhaps you've wished you could consult other conservators about a particular type of mould you just can't figure out, but found you just don't know enough people outside your department or even organisation to have a really good brain-picking.


Or maybe you're a private conservator who's been shipping in your archival-grade supplies from across the globe, and you just don't have the time to do the leg-work to find out which manufacturers in Asia-Pacific can sell you the specific resin you need, probably for less money, and definitely with a smaller carbon footprint involved.


INTRODUCING: 

The Conservators' Kit -- 

More Features Than You Can Imagine, All in One Place


Featured Events and Calendar

 

Live Forum

Suppliers List

Resource Bank

       


"So, what's the plan?"

BETA phase 

  • 1-2 years (depending on funding receive)
  • Working out of potential bugs and developing the ConsKit community

Thereafter

  • Using feedback gained from the BETA phase, a primary permanent app will be developed to accommodate even more features
  • Depending on demand and viability, we may develop ConsKit on an international platform 

Campaign Timeline

Feb: Launch and maintain campaign

Early April: End campaign. Purchase app licence, start developing app. Consolidate perks, and place "perk" orders with suppliers. 

May-June: Receive, sort, and mail out tokens of appreciation ("perks").


"Sounds great! How can I help?"

By supporting us financially

We do need some funds to get the BETA phase going, and it would really help if you could donate any amount with which you're comfortable to help us get there. Below are our estimated running costs:



We'll probably need to crowd-source funding (again!) for the permanent app when the time comes, but we're really looking to get started on the BETA phase first. No counting chicks before getting the hens, and all that. 

Still, if we are able -- due to your astounding show of generosity -- able to to reach our goal for the BETA phase, the rest of the money donated will be put aside to fund the development and running of the permanent app, thus saving us the need to crowd-source these funds in the future (you'll see above that this crowd-sourcing endeavour actually loses us a good chunk of your donations in the process, in payments to Indiegogo and the banks for their services). 


"Okay, but don't you people have any perks? You know, stuff I get for giving you my money?"

Hmm, we don't see it that way, actually. We aren't producing a product that you can get for x% off for supporting its initial run; we're humbly seeking donations to develop an app that can benefit the conservation community (and by extension, everyone who benefits from our work) at large. 

So essentially, we're afraid you won't be "getting stuff" when you donate to us. Instead, we'd like to offer you our appreciation in the form of listing you as a supporter on the app when it launches,and sending you a physical token of this appreciation (tied to your contribution level) as a little memento.  We'd like to take this opportunity to thank “The Conservator” for generously agreeing to let us print two comics on stickers to be given as tokens of appreciation to campaign supporters! 

These are the tokens of appreciation we’ll be mailing out to you at each level of support. Shipping across the globe included! Don’t worry about needing to donate the exact minimum listed for a particular Indiegogo “perk”, if that’s a token you’re particularly keen on – you can always indicate a higher amount on the next page after clicking on the perk level in which you’re interested. We’ve only tied the perks to specific contribution levels because of the manufacturing costs associated with each token we’ve chosen!


The “Almost Famous” Perk (min. donation USD2)

To show our appreciation and welcome you into the ConsKit community, we'll list you -- and all other donors above this level of support -- as a supporter on the app when it launches. Don't forget to share your contribution on Facebook!

We’ll keep you updated about our progress!


The “Sticker Picker” Perk (min. donation USD10)

We'd like to offer you one of our two sticker designs as a token of our appreciation. Happy choosing! Both comics provided with the generous support of “The Conservator”. Do visit the website (https://theconservator.wordpress.com/) to take a look at other works! Don't worry about picking the design right now -- we'll send a request for your choice when the campaign ends!

 

Sticker 1: Broken Hearts

Sticker 2: In the Lab


The “Time to Pencil it in” Perk (min. donation USD15)

We're so grateful for your contribution, we're sending you a pencil! Besides being part of any conservator's kit, this little token is also a reminder that you're a part of the Conservators' Kit! (If you cringed, please don't send us hate mail -- just select another perk ;) )


The “Two’s Company” Perk (min. donation USD25)

To show our appreciation for your generous contribution, we’re sending you a sticker and a pencil (both featured above)! You’ll get to choose between two sticker designs, and both comics are provided with the generous support of “The Conservator”. Do visit the website (https://theconservator.wordpress.com/) to take a look at other works! Don't worry about picking the design right now -- we'll send a request for your choice when the campaign ends!


The “Share a Pair” Perk (min. donation USD45)

To let you share your excitement about ConsKit with a friend, we’re sending you two sets of the above (so that's two stickers and two pencils)! Snap a picture of you and your friend using your pencils, and post it on social media with the hashtag #ConsKit. Welcome to the ConsKit community! 


The “Welcome Aboard!” (Limited Edition) Perk (min. donation USD80)

Atthis level of contribution, you (or whoever chauffeurs you around on a regular/semi-regular basis) get to declare your support for ConsKit and caution those pesky tailgaters with a limited-edition car decal!  Alternatively, stick it on the inside of a clear folder and bring it to your next meeting.  Either way, we're so glad you're supporting our campaign! Don’t forget to 'document' how you’ve decided to use your decal, and post it on social media with the hashtag #ConsKit!



The “Take One for the Team” Perk (min. donation USD140)

Thank you for supporting ConsKit! To celebrate teamwork within conservation, your team of up to five members will each get a ConsKit pencil, a sticker of your choice, and a personalised engraved pencil with your team slogan or department name on it (up to 30 characters)! We’ll send you an email requesting for more details for the personalisation when the campaign ends. Don’t forget to take a picture of you and your team using your pencils, and post it on social media with the hashtag #ConsKit! 


The “Smells Like Team Spirit” Perk (min. donation USD230)

Here’s a token of appreciation larger teams can share! At this level of contribution, your team of up to ten members will each get a ConsKit pencil, a sticker of your choice, and a personalised engraved pencil with your team slogan or department name on it (up to 30 characters)! We’ll send you an email requesting for more details for the personalisation when the campaign ends. Don’t forget to take a picture of you and your team using your pencils, and post it on social media with the hashtag #ConsKit!



“That’s all fine and dandy, but I don’t want your stuff, I just want to see that this app gets made!”

That’s very generous of you! We’d love to mail you a little something for you to remember us by, but if you’d rather not receive anything, we’re more than happy to graciously accept your kind donation as well. You’ll be able to specify the amount you wish to contribute, and indicate if you’d rather not receive any “perk” from us when you click “CONTRIBUTE NOW”.


"Why Asia-Pacific? What about the rest of the world?"

We decided to focus on Asia-Pacific at the BETA stage in order to extend the network support in the region, as there isn't currently a platform for all existing Asia-Pacific network groups. If you're a caretaker of a collection with an Asia-Pacific focus, it's likely that you'll have specific needs, whether related to environmental concerns or cultural sensitivity, and a platform on which you can share your knowledge and expertise would really go a long way in developing conservation in the region. 

Also, an app with regional-focus will help you reduce your carbon footprint when ordering archival-grade supplies from manufacturers in the region. Just think about the fuel you'll save -- not counting the reduction in shipping time! -- when ordering from within Asia-Pacific, as opposed to across the globe. 

That said, we aren't ignoring the rest of the world! In fact, we've received some very encouraging messages from conservators across the world, and we are considering developing ConsKit on a more international platform in future -- while of course retaining its regional specificity for the reasons above -- but that's all rather contingent on our successfully launching ConsKit's BETA phase first!

 

And if you can't quite rub two coins together, you could... 

  • Spread the word, and encourage others who benefit from the conservation practice to donate their hard-earned money to our campaign.
  • Like us on Facebook, and join our mailing list for updates, hoping that enough people will provide the necessary financial support to our campaign to allow us to actually have updates. 
  • Don't worry, we're just kidding about the last part. We completely empathise if you can't support us financially. That's really okay! Just drop us an encouraging message to make our day, and get word about our campaign out there, then join us on the app when it's up and running! 


Risks and Challenges

  • The success of this app will be heavily dependent on network support, and the active contribution of app users. As such, we will be publicising both this campaign and the app when it is developed on network newsletters, and on Facebook, where we already have a landing page. 
  • We realise that conservation is very much a niche field, and the pool of individuals who might have personal incentives to support our fundraising campaign is, in reality, quite small. We really are depending on the generosity of those who can give to help make this app happen. 

Thanks once again to everyone who’s expressed interest in our project, and we hope that we’ll all be able to benefit from this amazing app very soon!


SEE YOU ON THE CONSERVATORS' KIT

story:
The Six Comforts book, an cyclical work of text and image by artist Christopher Gustave, must not be lost to obscurity.

Christopher Gustave’s immense conceptual art book “The Six Comforts”, 344 pages in total, more than 308 full color plates, will be printed as a tightly-limited edition. We need to pre-sell 230 books in 40 days 130 books in 6 days. Contribute $100 and receive Christopher Gustave's last art work: The Six Comforts.

Gustave conceived of the Six Comforts as a method for living in response to personal tragedy, primarily the death by heroin overdose of his best friend, Daniel Brack, in San Francisco, on September 13th, 1996. Over the next several years, he focused his creative output in book-design, conceptual art, collage and assemblage within a framework of this “sorting construct” of the Six Comforts: key components of a method of living in opposition to super-cultural alienation, and unrecoverable loss.

"The Six Comforts are Home, Sleep, Work, Love, Food and Self. The Six Comforts’ is a sorting construct I formulated around the summer of 1997. At that point in my life I had just endured a blistering spate of profoundly bad luck—death, divorce, unemployment, homelessness… you name it—and I was in a deep state of emotional turmoil and mental resignation… really heart-broken and bereft of hope. Life nearly unendurable and all that. However, given a little time, it was pretty clear that, in spite of all of this, I was not going to just stop living. I had resigned myself to the Nietzschean formula (“That which does not kill us…”). Part of my survival regimen at that time was to simply sort out what I most needed in order to keep on going and just focus on those basics; get myself back into a healthy, sane and productive place. So, those “basics” became ‘The Six Comforts’." — Christopher Gustave, 2002.

The work “The Six Comforts” existed primarily in book-page spreads, diptychs, comprised of poetical texts and, aphorisms layered with photographic elements. It can be read forward to back, back to front, and starting anywhere in the middle. Pages from the unbound book were exhibited and sold in St. Louis galleries between 1999 and 2002. Other works from this series include a Six Comforts “screen” assembly the size of a room, The Six Comforts as a series of hand-pulled woodcuts, The Six Comforts Panels (assemblage of found objects with encaustic) and finally culminating in a concept-album in collaboration with several talented St. Louis musicians.

On January 17th, 2014, Christopher Gustave was found dead in his apartment of a overdose of anti-depressants. Within days of his passing, hundreds of his friends and supporters organized and began gathering together his works of art. A fundraising memorial was held at MAD Art Gallery in St. Louis, with the purpose to raise money for his eight-year-old daughter, Sophia. We are continuing that purpose in perpetuity with the initial release of this book The Six Comforts, which will mark the completion of Gustave’s final, and perhaps most challenging and important, work of art.

This book embodies a spiritual quest against the backdrop of modern industrial oppression.

The experience one has of reading the book is extraordinary. Gustave tears down megalithic conceptions foisted upon us by a vapid culture and replaces them with sharp, emancipating anti-slogans. While the punk-rock ideals inherent to Gustave’s practice keep everything on the edge, there is redemption on every page.

Please share this campaign with everyone you know and love.

UPDATE!  OUR LATEST VIDEO, FEATURING TRACKS FROM THE SIX COMFORTS ALBUM:

Caption: Page spread from the book The Six Comforts

Caption: Installation view of the Six Comforts, Brokaw residence, St. Louis.

Caption: Page spread from the book The Six Comforts

Caption: Mock-up of the book The Six Comforts
1. The Six Comforts Book

Each contributor of $100 gets the book The Six Comforts containing every one of his Six Comforts designs.

  • 348 pages of full-color designs. 9.25” x 9.25”
  • approx. 1.75” thick
  • 80# quality paper
  • embossed hardcover
  • smyth-sewn binding

Every person who buys a book will have his or her name recorded on the Six Comforts Book’s Acknowledgements page.

2. The Six Comforts: Singleton Series

Selections from The Six Comforts Singleton Series are available for $50 each in limited edition of 100.

  • 12” x 12” image size,
  • Archival 100% Cotton Rag Paper
  • Estate stamped and numbered
3. The Six Comforts Box Set and Deluxe Box Set


Specifications for the Box Set:

  • 18” x 18” hand-made wood box, silk-screened images from The Six Comforts series on front and back, drawer format with removable inner box.
  • 1 shadow boxed "Comfort Relic" from Gustave's collection.
  • The Six Comforts Limited-Edition Book
  • The Six Comforts Singleton limited edition prints, series of 6, 12”x12” on archival paper with estate stamps
  • The Six Comforts T-shirt with slogan chosen by collector
  • The Six Comforts CD in special book-binding format.
  • Edition of 12 only
  • $1200

Specifications for the Deluxe Box Set:

  • 18” x 18” hand-made wood box,  silk-screened images from The Six Comforts series on front and back, suitcase format with slide out display.
  • Pull out display drawers on either side of the box displaying The Six Comfort Singleton limited edition prints, series of 6, 12”x12” on archival paper with estate stamps
  • 1 shadow boxed "Comfort Relic" from Gustave's collection.
  • The Six Comforts Limited-Edition Book
  • The Six Comforts T-shirt with slogan chosen by collector
  • The Six Comforts CD in special book-binding format.
  • Photographic print of Gustave
  • Hidden compartment with additional artifacts
  • Edition of 7, only 6 available
  • $2300


4. The Six Comforts T-Shirt 

Choose from several designs, each an aphorism from the pages of The Six Comforts.

  • $30 each
  • Black High-Quality American Apparel T-Shirt
  • Screen applied white lettering and design
  • We will contact you after purchase to specify size and style information

Caption: The Six Comforts CD, Front and Back Image
4. The Six Comforts CD

We have a small number of the Six Comfort CDs to offer as perks for $25 donations.

This album contains 17 tracks: 3 of which feature Christopher Gustave. Other artists include: Colony, Tripstar, Languid and The Drew Johnson Band. The production quality (by Drew Johnson) is masterful.

story:
To fund part two of this project please go to this link

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/scarlet-oak-leaves-for-brookland-dc-part-two/x/12569250#/


My name is Charles Bergen. I am a native Washingtonian and make my living as an sculptor and public artist. I live in the Brookland Neighborhood of Washington, DC near Catholic University and have Studio 11 at the Arts Walk on Monroe Street Market.

I received a Brookland Beautification grant from the DC Office of Planning and DCCAH to create a sculpture at the corner of 12th and Rhode Island Avenue NE--the Southern Gateway to Brookland's 12th Street Commercial Corridor. My original idea was to attach a metal sculpture to the back of the curved brick wall that holds the Welcome to Brookland Sign. When I was given the grant they asked that I not bolt anything to the sign but rather install the sculpture on the ground behind the wall.  As the sign is curved and symmetrical I thought it would be funny to have a sculpture on one side of the sign.

My idea for the sculpture is to have two very large Scarlet Oak Leaves and Acorns. One leaf with acorns is placed either side of the brick sign. The Scarlet Oak is the State Tree of Washington, DC.  On the acorns are squirrels and crows--two animals that have historically lived off of the Scarlet Oak's Acorns. The sculptures will each be seven feet long and about three and a half feet tall at their tallest. Made out of steel the sculptures will be painted a bright red like Scarlet Oak Leaves are in the Fall. An anti-graffiti hardener will be added to the paint so that graffiti can easily be wiped away. Please see the colored sketches that I have done of the sculpture as well as the cad presentation drawings that a designer friend Brandon Bailey has done for the project.

The larger sculptures and footings are significantly more costly than the original simple sculpture that was to the bolted to the brick wall. My original grant budget was $3,000.00.  I need an additional $8,600.00 to pay for the sculpture fabrication, transportation costs to move the sculpture once it is fabricated to the site where it will be installed, painting of the sculpture with a durable paint and primer as well as an anti graffiti clear coat, structural design of the footings and the attachment brackets for the sculptures, footing costs, labor and a crane to install the sculptures as well as money for stainless steel plaques.

Please look at my website charlesbergenstudios.com for more images and information about the Scarlet Oak Leaves for Brookland and to learn more about my work.

story:
OUR STORY:


HATCH SERIES was founded in April of 2015 to bridge the gap between communities of creative individuals in New York while providing the opportunity for emerging artist to showcase their work. We are an interdisciplinary exhibition series, organized by emerging artists, curators, and young professionals to foster a community of creative individuals interested in the arts.


Through the production of curated group exhibitions, as well as through our online platform, HATCH aims to carve out spaces for creative exploration and perceptive criticism of  the current socio-cultural condition within various contexts. HATCH is innovating curating practice by inviting participants to help steer the direction of the show, as opposed to a traditional model of a single curator dictating the entire narrative.


Using a grass roots model, these exhibitions come together with the help and hard work of different people with skills and expertise in the various fields. Inspired by the concept of an incubator, HATCH exhibitions not only showcase the work of talented and underrepresented artists, but also provide a space for individuals interested in exploring curatorial practices.


To accomplish these goals, HATCH has taken the form of pop up exhibitions in informal settings to break the mold of traditional gallery spaces, while also helping artists gain visibility in an over-saturated industry.


WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP:


As our roster of talent has quickly grown, so has our turnout for our pop-up events.  We hope to be able to accommodate a larger audience for our next exhibition HATCH No. 3. We will need your to help raise at least $1,500 to be able to produce the upcoming show in December of this year.


With this sum of money, we will be able to better showcase the work of talented artists and their incredible work. Additionally, this will allow us to bring in a larger audience to experience our exhibition.


A research study funded by the National Endowment for the Arts (NEA) titled  “Best Practices At-A-Glance: Serving Emerging Artists” identifies top critical disadvantages confronted by emerging artists and arts administrators in the ongoing battle of resource allocation -- the most handicapping of them all includes a lack of access to opportunities and an insufficient community support network.


HATCH Series aims to include audience members that are outside the parameters of the arts and cultural industry. Since its inception, HATCH has been able to produce two exhibitions, operating on a low budget with the help and support of artists and local community.


HOW YOU CAN HELP:

All of the proceeds will go towards operational costs that will help keep HATCH sustainable!


Our detailed budget is as follows:


  • $600-Venue rental

  • $150-Equipment rental (Sound system, lighting, projectors...etc. )

  • $100-Printed materials including programs, flyers, wall texts

  • $400-Videographer and editing

  • $150-Drinks, refreshments

  • $100-Miscellaneous costs


We are continuously looking for support to keep this project and the HATCH community growing. Any additional funds we receive will go towards our exhibitions in the Spring and Summer of 2016!


Why should you donate to HATCH?

By supporting HATCH, you will be supporting the local creative community. HATCH series was conceived because we felt that there was a need for a larger support system for emerging talented artists. But above all, the purpose of HATCH is to provide an opportunity for bridging artistic circles and the general public.


ABOUT OUR PERKS:


Limited edition artist prints:

 

Our Limited Edition Artist Prints features work by HATCH Series artists Richard Lapham, Tao Xian, Stephanie Gamarra, Cassandra Brown, Han Wenjie and Louis Dorantes.


HATCH Artist Canvas Bags:


HATCH artists Amanda Picotte, Colin LoCascio, Hello Velocity, Michelle Carolina Levie,  Ahna Hughes, Evelyn Tao, and Maggie Dunlap have customized limited edition Canvas bags for you. First come first serve-check back weekly to stay updated on new bags!




Other Ways YOU can help!


  • Help spread the word about our campaign!
  • Sign up for our newsletter to get more information about our upcoming exhibitions and events over on our website

  • Like us on Facebook and follow us on instagram (@hatch.series)

  • Come to our exhibition in December!

story:
“Very moist and fresh tasting - like they were just made this morning.” Eve, Seattle, WA

We started testing our Smart Cookie recipes over two years ago to create a cookie our families and friends would love and nothing more.  What we created was something uniquely delicious and suitable for so many dietary restrictions, we decided to share it with the world!  You would never know they are made from nut butter and oats rather than butter and flour.  The rich sweetness provided by roasted nuts combined with ingredients like vanilla, cranberries, dark chocolate and more offers a variety of textures and flavors and are packed with nutrients. 



These are still sweet, delicious cookies, but a smarter choice than traditional cookies for anyone who wants their food made from real ingredients or who wants to be sure their calories and carbs are worth it.  They started off accidentally gluten free, safe for those who are lactose intolerant or allergic to soy and easily made as vegan cookies when desired, now it isn’t an accident.  We work with only certified gluten free ingredients, a smaller portion of sugar and consciously do not add butter or ingredients with soy, dairy or whey for a cleaner, healthier cookie choice.

“Vegan Chewy Peanut Butter: Soft and amazingly delicious!” Drew and Beth, Biloxi, MS (not vegans)

Our first successful cookie was a dark chocolate chip cookie.  Luscious and so popular that we had to try more flavors.  We now have over 20 types of cookies all with our unique twists on ingredients.  We offer walnut oatmeal currant, pecan mince, pistachio fig, cookies with jam filling and the list goes on.  We even have cookies made from pepita seed butter for folks who have nut allergies or peanut allergy.  Why have plain cookies with a few nuts mixed in when you can have cookies that use spreadable butter made from your favorite nuts as the primary ingredient?

“I’m gonna be as blunt as I can.  At first I was like, these cookies are missing all the things that make a cookie a cookie. You know what? I was wrong about what makes a cookie a cookie. These are some very health conscious cookies. They are specialty diet friendly and they taste great. I’d eat them every day. And because I can, I’d dunk them in my milk!” ~ Dave, Mesa, AZ

Dave was talking about these...


In addition ordering cookies from our website anytime, we offer a Cookie of the Month membership; a different dozen cookies delivered to your doorstep (or someone else’s if you prefer!) every month on or around the 15th.  To celebrate this, we got together with our friends to create a Cookie of the Month calendar.  The work for this is largely done.  We are raising funds for the printing; hence, this crowdfunding effort.  We are also continuing to grow and look forward to a broader offering, more members, pursuing custom gifts and possibly even distribution to groceries locally and across the nation.

“My sampler from 2 Smart Cookies arrived! Not only is the packaging totally adorable, the first cookie we tried -- the pecan pie -- got total raves from Teen Girl! YUM! We look forward to trying the rest, ladies! Thank you!” Connie, Sierra Vista, AZ

We hope you enjoy the video we put together to give you a peek into our cookie business as well as have a laugh at ourselves and our friends.  While we are extraordinarily proud of our efforts and the growth of our business so far, we believe that if it isn’t fun, and you can’t include time you’re your friends and families, quit doing it!

BLOOPERS!


If you back our crowdfunding effort, your dollars will fund:

·  Printing of the 2016 Cookie of the Month calendar

·  Bulk ingredients from local producers wherever available

·  Greener packaging options

·  Additional baking tools

·  Quantity storage bins

·  R&D for larger batch production

·  Contract research for distribution opportunities

The gifts we have to offer are diverse and donated not only from our stock and efforts, but the efforts of several small business owners who have provided tremendous local networking and support as we get up and running for a formal launch of our company. 

Thanks so much for your support and contributions!

Nikki & Sharon as well as the whole crew

story:
Worum geht es hier eigentlich?

Magische Zahlen (magical numbers) faszinierten schon immer die Menschen. Durch die Kombination von mathematischen Formeln und Zahlenreihen entstehen die faszinierendsten Muster. bei mag numb kannst Du 5 verschiedene Motive aus Zahlen kaufen. Auf Wunsch lassen sich diese sogar noch individualisieren, so dass das Bild nur für Dich hergestellt wird.

 

Warum Zahlen?

Zahlen sind neben den Buchstaben der Grundstein unserer Kommunikation. Wir rechnen, bezahlen, programmieren, ja wir nutzen sie sogar für Geheim- und Geisteswissenschaften (vgl. Numerologie). Zahlen bestimmen oft nur indirekt unser Leben. Geprägt werden wir von Emotionen und Entscheidungen, die wir an jedem einzelnen Tag treffen. Zahlen bilden dabei eine entscheidende Rolle: Ist das Produkt preiswerter? Wie viel Strom verbrauche ich? Wie lange dauert ein Waschvorgang? Auch in Unternehmen stellen die Zahlen die Basis dar, jedoch geraten sie mehr und mehr in den Hintergrund. Emotionen sind das neue Marketinginstrument von Unternehmen und doch ist der Geschäftsbericht mit den Kennzahlen das A und O.

Mag numb möchte deshalb die Bedeutung von Zahlen wieder hervorheben. Es zeigt in einzigartigen Kunstwerken stillvolle Muster die alle eins gemeinsam haben: Die Basis sind Zahlen. Erst bei genauerer Betrachtung werden diese deutlich. Durch das Hervorheben von zwei Zahlen wird deutlich, dass, auch wenn die Zahlenwelt komplex und riesig erscheint, wir immer noch unseren Platz finden können.

 

Das Motiv wird auf Premium-Fotopapier auf eine leichte 5 mm starke Hartschaum-Platte aufkaschiert. Die Oberfläche wird durch ein zusätzliches UV-Schutzlaminat vor Kratzern und UV-Strahlen geschützt. Eine matte Oberfläche sorgt für eine edle Optik. An jedes Bild ist ein Alu-Aufhängesystem montiert. Damit lässt sich das Bild kinderleicht an der Wand befestigen und gleichzeitig verleiht es Deinem Bild zusätzliche Formstabilität, vor allem bei größeren Formaten. Du musst dann nur noch eine Schraube an der gewünschten Stelle in der Wand anbringen und das Bild daran einhängen. Das Bild ist, dank der durchgängigen Schiene des Rahmens, jederzeit nach links oder rechts verschiebbar, so entfällt ein millimetergenaues Messen! Dein Bild scheint vor der Wand zu schweben!

   

 

Ist das nicht Massenware?

Nö. Bei mag numb kannst Du zwischen 5 Motiven wählen und auf Wunsch personalisieren lassen. Du hast die Möglichkeit Dein Bild zu personalisieren, in dem Du zwei Zahlen einfärben lässt. Dadurch, dass die Zahlen öfter in einem Motiv vorkommen, entstehen so besondere Effekte. 

 

Wie kommt das Bild an?

Die Bilder sind sehr dezent und drängen sich nicht in den Vordergrund. Landet der Blick jedoch einmal auf ihnen, so gehen viele dichter heran und betrachten es genauer. Zumeist entsteht ein Gespräch über das Bild. Durch die Personalisierung erhält es einen individuellen Touch. Sowohl auf weißen als auch auf farbigen Wänden kommt das Bild gut zur Geltung.
 

Welche Motive gibt es denn?

Die Motive tragen die Namen flow, vortex, star, wave und implosion, weil sie genau so aussehen. Aber mach Dir am besten ein eigenes Bild:

flow

 

vortex

 

star

 

wave

 

 

implosion


Die Motive gibt es in den folgenden Größen:
  • 60 x 40 cm
  • 90 x 60 cm 
  • 120 x 80 cm
  • 150 x 100 cm
  • 180 x 120 cm

 

 

Gerne helfe ich, was bekomme ich dafür?

Je nach dem, mit welchem Betrag Du mich unterstützt, erhältst Du unterschiedliche Gegenleistungen:

  • Für 1€ erhältst Du eine persönliche Mail von mir.
  • Für 10 € erhältst Du Dein Wunschmotiv als Wallpaper.
  • Für 20€ bekommst Du eine Postkarte mit Deinem Wunschmotiv .
  • Wenn Du ganz schnell bist, bekommst du für 95€ Dein Wunschmotiv in 60 x 40 cm inkl. Personalisierung.
  • Für 100€ erhältst Du Dein Wunschmotiv in 60 x 40 cm inkl. Personalisierung.
  • Für 140€ bekommst Du Dein Wunschmotiv in 90 x 60 cm inkl. Personalisierung.
  • Für 200€ bekommst Du Dein Wunschmotiv in 120 x 80 cm inkl. Personalisierung.

     

    Was willst Du mit meinem Geld machen?

    Mit Deiner finanziellen Unterstützung möchte ich insbesondere die Vertriebskanäle ausbauen und Marketing betreiben. Dabei möchte ich insbesondere Werbung auf sozialen Netzwerken betreiben und größere Formate drucken, um für Firmen attraktiver zu werden. Über 10.000€ plane ich die Integration einer weiteren Individualisierung: Du kannst Dir Deine Motive dann komplett selber gestalten. Mit Hilfe von Schiebereglern ändert sich das Motiv basierend auf mathematischen Algorithmen.
     

    Ich habe kein Geld, kann ich trotzdem helfen?

    Ja, auf jeden Fall. Verbreite das Projekt in Deinen sozialen Netzwerken und hilf mir, so viele Menschen wie möglich zu erreichen.
     

     

    Entstehen für mich irgendwelche Risiken?

    Nein. Du erhältst in jedem Fall deinen Gegenwert. Die Herstellungskette läuft bereits 100% stabil.

Du musst dann nur noch eine Schraube an der gewünschten Stelle in der Wand anbringen und das Bild daran einhängen. Ist das nicht Massenware?
Nö. Bei mag numb kannst Du zwischen 5 Motiven wählen und auf Wunsch personalisieren lassen. Du hast die Möglichkeit Dein Bild zu personalisieren, in dem Du zwei Zahlen einfärben lässt. Dadurch, dass die Zahlen öfter in einem Motiv vorkommen, entstehen so besondere Effekte.  Wie kommt das Bild an?Die Bilder sind sehr dezent und drängen sich nicht in den Vordergrund. Landet der Blick jedoch einmal auf ihnen, so gehen viele dichter heran und betrachten es genauer. Zumeist entsteht ein Gespräch über das Bild. Durch die Personalisierung erhält es einen individuellen Touch. Sowohl auf weißen als auch auf farbigen Wänden kommt das Bild gut zur Geltung. Welche Motive gibt es denn?Die Motive tragen die Namen flow, vortex, star, wave und implosion, weil sie genau so aussehen. Aber mach Dir am besten ein eigenes Bild:flow
 
vortex star wave  
implosion
Die Motive gibt es in den folgenden Größen:
60 x 40 cm
90 x 60 cm 
120 x 80 cm
150 x 100 cm
180 x 120 cm

 
 
Gerne helfe ich, was bekomme ich dafür?
Je nach dem, mit welchem Betrag Du mich unterstützt, erhältst Du unterschiedliche Gegenleistungen:

Für 1€ erhältst Du eine persönliche Mail von mir.
Für 10 € erhältst Du Dein Wunschmotiv als Wallpaper.
Für 20€ bekommst Du eine Postkarte mit Deinem Wunschmotiv .
Wenn Du ganz schnell bist, bekommst du für 95€ Dein Wunschmotiv in 60 x 40 cm inkl. Personalisierung.
Für 100€ erhältst Du Dein Wunschmotiv in 60 x 40 cm inkl. Personalisierung.
Für 140€ bekommst Du Dein Wunschmotiv in 90 x 60 cm inkl. Personalisierung.
Für 200€ bekommst Du Dein Wunschmotiv in 120 x 80 cm inkl. Personalisierung.



 
Was willst Du mit meinem Geld machen?Mit Deiner finanziellen Unterstützung möchte ich insbesondere die Vertriebskanäle ausbauen und Marketing betreiben. Dabei möchte ich insbesondere Werbung auf sozialen Netzwerken betreiben und größere Formate drucken, um für Firmen attraktiver zu werden. Über 10.000€ plane ich die Integration einer weiteren Individualisierung: Du kannst Dir Deine Motive dann komplett selber gestalten. Mit Hilfe von Schiebereglern ändert sich das Motiv basierend auf mathematischen Algorithmen. 
Ich habe kein Geld, kann ich trotzdem helfen?Ja, auf jeden Fall. Verbreite das Projekt in Deinen sozialen Netzwerken und hilf mir, so viele Menschen wie möglich zu erreichen.  
Entstehen für mich irgendwelche Risiken?
Nein. Du erhältst in jedem Fall deinen Gegenwert. Die Herstellungskette läuft bereits 100% stabil.

story:
We are raising money in hopes to expand Emilee's "Emi's" operations. The donations you provide will allow her to grow her small business/studio and have the ability to continue creating her works of art as well as progress into other artistic venues. Her ultimate goal is to use the money her artwork provides to help her with her graduate degree and the costs of school. Plus allow her to continue to advance her passion for art in all its forms! 

Emi has been invited to small, local art shows, plus sells her work online sometimes. She also takes her paintings and sketches anywhere she can, every chance she gets, trying to get the word out about what she does. She has had several sells online and also people who have commissioned her for particular paintings or sketches. 

She not only does interpretaion paintings and sketches but also realistic and creative impressions; all in acrylic or pencil. Her talent truly is great! (And I'm not being bias... She's had 2 galleries invite her to show her work. One here in the states, locally, and another abroad). 

If you have any questions please feel free to ask me. I would not post this or attempt to ask for assistance if she did not have true talent along with a future goal to apply her funds towards. Look under the "Gallery" section for more pictures of her artwork.

In advance--- Thank You So Much! If you view the "Perks" section you will see several offers for discounts to those who donate. Discounts vary by donation amount. Once again, Thanks!

story:
Hi! My name is Dan and I am a student at Wesleyan University in Connecticut. I started Energy Frontline Communities of America in the spring of 2015 along with a close friend, Toby, who is a student at the University of Massachusetts, Amherst. 

This project hopes to share the stories of people directly affected by energy production, an industry that is hotly divisive yet unquestionably necessary for our lives as we know them. This summer, Toby and I will be travelling in Pennsylvania, West Virginia, and Louisiana to create a documentary film about the complicated relationships that people have with American energy. By speaking with folks that interact directly with processes like hydraulic fracturing, coal mining, and oil drilling, this project hopes to encourage constructive discussion about energy and electricity production in this country with the knowledge that the “other side” is made up of people with real lives, families, and stories, whether it is the person seeking to shut down the local coal mine or the worker walking into it.


WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP

In order to document such a wide spectrum of experiences, we will be filming our travels and speaking with as many people as possible. THIS IS WHERE YOU COME IN! We've made a great start, as we have received invaluable support from countless friends, faculty, and alumni at both of our schools, including a grant from Wesleyan University’s College of the Environment Visualizing the Environment Fund -- but we need your help with fundraising to go the full distance! Your donations to this Indiegogo campaign will help us feed and house ourselves, put gas in the car, rent filming equipment, and get the editing software that we need. Any amount would be greatly appreciated! It’ll help us share the experiences of those interacting with energy production across America, one story at a time.

For everything - thank you SO MUCH.


Sincerely yours,

Dan and Toby
